original: de nyid ma bsgoms yid la ma byas pa ni mi skal ba chung pa dang skal ba mnyam par skye ba gang yin pa'i gnas yod pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid ma bsgoms yid la ma byas pa ni mi skal ba chung pa dang skal ba mnyam par skye ba gang yin pa'i gnas yod pa yin no //
translated: Those who do not cultivate that and do not attend to it are born in a place equal to those of little fortune.

original: de la 'di dag ni mi skal ba chung ba yin te /
analyzed: de la 'di dag ni mi skal ba chung ba yin te /
translated: Those of little fortune are as follows:

original: 'di lta ste rigs ngan nam gdol ba'i rigs sam shing rta byed pa'i rigs so //
analyzed: 'di lta ste rigs ngan nam gdol ba'i rigs sam shing rta byed pa'i rigs so //
translated: they are born in a low caste, such as a caste of untouchables, a caste of outcastes, or a caste of cartwrights.

original: gzhan yang dman pa smad pa 'og ma ngan pa byed pa chung ba zas skom med pa de 'dra'i rigs dang skal ba mnyam par skye ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang dman pa smad pa 'og ma ngan pa byed pa chung ba zas skom med pa de 'dra'i rigs dang skal ba mnyam par skye ste /
translated: Moreover, they are born in a place equal to those of low, contemptible, inferior, bad, and small fortune, without food and drink.

original: de dag ni skal ba chung ba'i mi'i mdo las yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni skal ba chung ba'i mi'i mdo las yin no //
translated: This is from the Sūtra on Those of Little Fortune.

original: skal ba can gyi mi'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: skal ba can gyi mi'i mdo las kyang /
translated: Also, the Sūtra on Those of Fortunate Mind says:

original: dge slong dag 'di na kha cig gis sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po cung zad tsam byas shing bsags pa dang @107a * //
analyzed: dge slong dag 'di na kha cig gis sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po cung zad tsam byas shing bsags pa dang @107a * //
translated: “Monks, here some people have done and accumulated a small wholesome action that is a basis for merit arisen from giving.

original: tshul khrims las byung ba cung zad tsam byas kyi bsgoms pa las byung ba ni yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: tshul khrims las byung ba cung zad tsam byas kyi bsgoms pa las byung ba ni yod pa ma yin la /
translated: They have done a small wholesome action arisen from morality, but they have not done a wholesome action arisen from meditation.

original: mi skal ba can yang 'dis mthong ste /
analyzed: mi skal ba can yang 'dis mthong ste /
translated: The person of good fortune sees this and thinks, “Oh, I am born with the same good fortune as those people.”

original: de 'di snyam du kye ma bdag ni mi skal ba can rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye'o snyam nas de'i sems bsten cing bsgoms lan mang du byas so //
analyzed: de 'di snyam du kye ma bdag ni mi skal ba can rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye'o snyam nas de'i sems bsten cing bsgoms lan mang du byas so //
translated: He cultivates and frequently practices that thought.

original: de'i sems bsten cing bsgoms lan mang du byas pa dman par 'dug cing dman par shin tu 'dug pa las gong du shin tu 'pho'o /
analyzed: de'i sems bsten cing bsgoms lan mang du byas pa dman par 'dug cing dman par shin tu 'dug pa las gong du shin tu 'pho'o /
translated: When he cultivates and frequently practices that thought, which is inferior and very inferior, he is reborn in a higher state, very far away.

original: shin tu tshad med par bsgoms shing lan mang du byas pa ni gang mi skal ba can rnams dang / skal ba mnyam par skye ba'i gnas yod pa yin no //
analyzed: shin tu tshad med par bsgoms shing lan mang du byas pa ni gang mi skal ba can rnams dang / skal ba mnyam par skye ba'i gnas yod pa yin no //
translated: When he cultivates and frequently practices that thought, which is immeasurable and very much so, there is a place where he is reborn with the same good fortune as those people of good fortune.

original: de la 'di dag ni mi skal ba can yin te /
analyzed: de la 'di dag ni mi skal ba can yin te /
translated: Here are those people of good fortune:

original: 'di lta ste rgyal rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu'am /
analyzed: 'di lta ste rgyal rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu'am /
translated: the kṣatriya caste, which is like a great sāla tree;

original: bram ze'i rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu 'am /
analyzed: bram ze'i rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu 'am /
translated: the brahmin caste, which is like a great sāla tree;

original: khyim bdag gi rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu'am /
analyzed: khyim bdag gi rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu'am /
translated: the householder caste, which is like a great sāla tree;

original: gang gzhan yang shin tu phyug cing longs spyod che ba dang nor mang po yod pa la dbang byed pa dang ; nor dang yo byad mang po dang / nor dang 'bru dang / mdzod dang / bang ba la sogs pa tshogs mang ba dang /
analyzed: gang gzhan yang shin tu phyug cing longs spyod che ba dang nor mang po yod pa la dbang byed pa dang ; nor dang yo byad mang po dang / nor dang 'bru dang / mdzod dang / bang ba la sogs pa tshogs mang ba dang /
translated: who have many stores of wealth, grain, treasuries, and granaries,

original: bran pho dang / bran mo dang / las byed pa'i mi mang ba dang / mdza' bshes dang / blon po dang / gnyen dang / spun tshan rab tu mang ba lta bu de'i rigs dang skal ba mnyam par skye ba yin no //🔽'di lta ste dge slong dag 'dir kha cig gis sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po chung ba yang zhes snga ma bzhin du byas nas thos pa yang yod cing 'dis rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha dang gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha'i bar
analyzed: bran pho dang / bran mo dang / las byed pa'i mi mang ba dang / mdza' bshes dang / blon po dang / gnyen dang / spun tshan rab tu mang ba lta bu de'i rigs dang skal ba mnyam par skye ba yin no // 'di lta ste dge slong dag 'dir kha cig gis sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po chung ba yang zhes snga ma bzhin du byas nas thos pa yang yod cing 'dis rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha dang gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha'i bar
translated: who have many male and female servants and workers, who have many friends, ministers, relatives, and siblings, will be reborn in a family of similar type and fortune.🔽Bhikṣus, in this world some people, as previously stated, have a small wholesome action that produces merit from generosity. They have heard that this leads to rebirth

original: du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: du 'gyur ro //
translated: among the Catur­mahā­rāja­kāyika gods, up to the Para­nirmita­vaśa­vartin gods.

original: 'di snyam du sems te ;
analyzed: 'di snyam du sems te ;
translated: They think:

original: kye ma bdag ni rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba nas gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar 'gyur ro snyam nas de'i sems brten cing bsgom mo zhes snga ma
analyzed: kye ma bdag ni rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba nas gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar 'gyur ro snyam nas de'i sems brten cing bsgom mo zhes snga ma
translated: He thinks, Alas, I will be reborn with the same fortune as the gods of the Caturmaharajakayika realm up to I will be reborn with the same fortune as the Paranirmitavasavartin gods, and he stabilizes and cultivates that thought.

original: bzhin no // lan tshva srang gcig lta bu las kyang rgyas par gsungs nas /🔽dge slong dag 'di la kha cig gis re zhig mi dge ba'i las byas shing bsags pa gang yin pa de ni mthong ba'i chos la myong bar 'gyur ba las dmyal ba myong bar 'gyur bar gyur to //
analyzed: bzhin no // lan tshva srang gcig lta bu las kyang rgyas par gsungs nas / dge slong dag 'di la kha cig gis re zhig mi dge ba'i las byas shing bsags pa gang yin pa de ni mthong ba'i chos la myong bar 'gyur ba las dmyal ba myong bar 'gyur bar gyur to //
translated: As before, it is extensively taught, up to a single ounce of salt.🔽Bhikṣus, some here, having created and accumulated unwholesome karma, experience it in the present life, and it becomes karma to be experienced in hell.

original: dge slong dag gang zag ji lta bus re zhig sdig pa mi dge ba'i las byas shing bsags @107b pa dag 'di mthong ba'i chos la myong bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni dmyal ba myong bar 'gyur bar gyur zhe na /
analyzed: dge slong dag gang zag ji lta bus re zhig sdig pa mi dge ba'i las byas shing bsags @107b pa dag 'di mthong ba'i chos la myong bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni dmyal ba myong bar 'gyur bar gyur zhe na /
translated: Bhikṣus, what kind of person, having created and accumulated unwholesome karma, experiences it in the present life, and it becomes karma to be experienced in hell?

original: 'di la dge slong dag gang zag kha cig ni lus ma bsgoms pa /
analyzed: 'di la dge slong dag gang zag kha cig ni lus ma bsgoms pa /
translated: Here, monks, some person does not cultivate the body,

original: tshul khrims ma bsgoms pa /
analyzed: tshul khrims ma bsgoms pa /
translated: does not cultivate virtue,

original: sems ma bsgoms pa /
analyzed: sems ma bsgoms pa /
translated: does not cultivate the mind,🔽does not cultivate wisdom.🔽Having thus described in detail the person who does not cultivate the body, etc.,

original: shes rab ma bsgoms pa zhes bya ba de lta bu gang zag rgyas par byas nas cung zad cig byas pa la yang chen po kho nar snang ba'o //
analyzed: shes rab ma bsgoms pa zhes bya ba de lta bu gang zag rgyas par byas nas cung zad cig byas pa la yang chen po kho nar snang ba'o //
translated: the Buddha says that even a small action appears to be great.

original: rna rigs kyi mdo las kyang rgyas par smras nas /
analyzed: rna rigs kyi mdo las kyang rgyas par smras nas /
translated: In the Sūtra on the Family of the Tathāgatas, after describing in detail,

original: bram ze dag 'dis kha cig ni srog gcod pa yin pa nas log par lta ba po'i bar du yin no //
analyzed: bram ze dag 'dis kha cig ni srog gcod pa yin pa nas log par lta ba po'i bar du yin no //
translated: the Buddha says, “Brahmins, some people kill living beings up to they have wrong views.🔽They give gifts to virtuous brahmins and ascetics.

original: dge sbyong bram ze dag la sbyin pa yang byin pa yin te zhes rgyas par smras nas /
analyzed: dge sbyong bram ze dag la sbyin pa yang byin pa yin te zhes rgyas par smras nas /
translated: ” Having described in detail,

original: gang zag de tshul khrims 'chal ba yin la /
analyzed: gang zag de tshul khrims 'chal ba yin la /
translated: the Buddha says, “That person is immoral.

original: las de'i rnam par smin pas glang po che dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las de'i rnam par smin pas glang po che dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By the evolution of that action, he is reborn in the animal realm, in the destiny of elephants.

original: de sbyin pa byin pa gang yin pa de'i las kyi rnam par sman pa ni glang po cher gyur na yang /
analyzed: de sbyin pa byin pa gang yin pa de'i las kyi rnam par sman pa ni glang po cher gyur na yang /
translated: The evolution of the action of his giving is that even as an elephant,

original: bza' ba dang btung ba nas /
analyzed: bza' ba dang btung ba nas /
translated: he has food and drink,

original: glang po che'i rgyan gyi bar du rnyed par 'gyur ro zhes rgyas par byas nas bram ze 'dir kha cig dag srog gcod pa spangs te /
analyzed: glang po che'i rgyan gyi bar du rnyed par 'gyur ro zhes rgyas par byas nas bram ze 'dir kha cig dag srog gcod pa spangs te /
translated: Here, some abandon killing,

original: srog gcod pa las slar log pa nas yang dag par lta ba'i bar du yin no //
analyzed: srog gcod pa las slar log pa nas yang dag par lta ba'i bar du yin no //
translated: and turn away from killing, up to right view.🔽They give gifts to monks and brahmins, and so on.

original: sbyin pa yang dge slong ngam bram ze dag la byin te zhes rgyas par byas nas de tshul khrims dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: sbyin pa yang dge slong ngam bram ze dag la byin te zhes rgyas par byas nas de tshul khrims dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: They are endowed with morality,

original: de'i las kyi rnam par smin pas lha rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i las kyi rnam par smin pas lha rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and by the maturation of that karma, they are reborn with the fortune of the gods.

original: gang sbyin pa de byin pa de'i las kyi rnam par smin pas ni lhar gyur ba na yang bza' ba dang btung ba nas lha rnams kyi rgyan rnam pa sna tshogs kyi bar du rnyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang sbyin pa de byin pa de'i las kyi rnam par smin pas ni lhar gyur ba na yang bza' ba dang btung ba nas lha rnams kyi rgyan rnam pa sna tshogs kyi bar du rnyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: By the maturation of the karma of giving that gift, when they become gods, they obtain food and drink, up to various ornaments of the gods.

original: de bzhin du mi rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du mi rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Similarly, they are reborn with the fortune of humans.

original: de'i las kyi rnam par smin pas ni mir gyur ba na yang bza' ba dang btung ba nas mi'i rgyan sna tshogs kyi bar du rnyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i las kyi rnam par smin pas ni mir gyur ba na yang bza' ba dang btung ba nas mi'i rgyan sna tshogs kyi bar du rnyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: And by the evolution of that karma, even when born as a human, one obtains food and drink, and various human ornaments.

original: de ltar na mdo sde de dag las /
analyzed: de ltar na mdo sde de dag las /
translated: Thus, in those sūtras,

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i las kyi rnam par smin pa ni g-yo bar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i las kyi rnam par smin pa ni g-yo bar bstan pa yin no //
translated: the evolution of karma in the desire realm is said to be unstable.

original: bsod nams zad nas zhes bya ba 'dir dpe na ji ltar gzugs na spyod pa'i dge ba'i las la bsod nams zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: bsod nams zad nas zhes bya ba 'dir dpe na ji ltar gzugs na spyod pa'i dge ba'i las la bsod nams zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: Here, merit is like the virtuous karma in the form realm, which is called merit.

original: bsod nams de ni yod de zhes bya ba ni 'od gsal ba de'i dge ba'i las ni 'bras bu yid du 'ong ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽khyad par brjod par bya ba'i phyir te zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir sa de las las kyi rnam @108a * //
analyzed: bsod nams de ni yod de zhes bya ba ni 'od gsal ba de'i dge ba'i las ni 'bras bu yid du 'ong ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro // khyad par brjod par bya ba'i phyir te zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir sa de las las kyi rnam @108a * //
translated: That merit exists means that the virtuous karma of that bright light is the pleasant result.

original: par smin pa mi g-yo ba yin no zhes 'di'i khyad par du brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: par smin pa mi g-yo ba yin no zhes 'di'i khyad par du brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to state a distinction means that because the evolution of karma in that realm is stable, it is said to be a distinction of that realm.

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba la sogs pa bzhin te zhes bya ba lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa bzhin te /
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba la sogs pa bzhin te zhes bya ba lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa bzhin te /
translated: It is like the once-returner and so on.

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa de dag rgyun du zhugs pa ma yin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa de dag rgyun du zhugs pa ma yin pa ma yin te /
translated: The once-returner, non-returner and arhat are not stream-enterers.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i las kyi rgyun de nas song ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i las kyi rgyun de nas song ba'i phyir /
translated: Because they have gone beyond the stream of the karma that leads to nirvana.

original: de dag ni der zhugs shing thob pa yin pas rgyun du zhugs pa yin yang /
analyzed: de dag ni der zhugs shing thob pa yin pas rgyun du zhugs pa yin yang /
translated: They are stream-enterers because they have entered and attained that stream.

original: khyad par gyi ming gis bstan te /
analyzed: khyad par gyi ming gis bstan te /
translated: But they are taught by their specific names.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa las 'bras bu thog ma la gnas pa dang 'bras bu ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa las 'bras bu thog ma la gnas pa dang 'bras bu ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the first fruit of the stream-enterer?

original: de ni de ltar thogs na srid pa lan bdun pa zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de ni de ltar thogs na srid pa lan bdun pa zhes bstan to //
translated: If it is obstructed, it is taught as the one who transmigrates seven times.

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba ni 'jig rten 'dir lan cig phyir 'ongs nas sdug bsngal gyi tha ma byed par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba ni 'jig rten 'dir lan cig phyir 'ongs nas sdug bsngal gyi tha ma byed par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The once-returner returns to this world once and makes an end to suffering.

original: lan cig phyir mi 'ong ba ni de nyid du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir 'jig rten 'dir 'ong bar mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: lan cig phyir mi 'ong ba ni de nyid du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir 'jig rten 'dir 'ong bar mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: A once-returner does not come to this world again because he attains nirvana in that very life.

original: dgra zhes bya ba ni khams gsum pa'i nyon mongs pa la bya ste /
analyzed: dgra zhes bya ba ni khams gsum pa'i nyon mongs pa la bya ste /
translated: The term foe refers to the mental afflictions of the three realms.

original: de dag des ma lus par bcom pas dgra bcom pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de dag des ma lus par bcom pas dgra bcom pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Because they have completely destroyed those, they are called those who have destroyed the foe.

original: de dag bzhin no //
analyzed: de dag bzhin no //
translated: They are like that.🔽Karma that is to be experienced as pleasure is meritorious.

original: bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i las ni bsod nams so zhes bya ba ni bde ba'i tshor ba ni 'dod pa'i khams dang / bsam gtan gsum pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i las ni bsod nams so zhes bya ba ni bde ba'i tshor ba ni 'dod pa'i khams dang / bsam gtan gsum pa'i bar du'o //
translated: The experience of pleasure extends from the desire realm up to the third meditative absorption.

original: de'i phyir bsam gtan gsum pa'i bar du dge ba'i las ni bsod nams yin par bstan to zhes gsungs so //🔽sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa myong bar 'gyur ba ni mi g-yo ba ste zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal yang ma yin /
analyzed: de'i phyir bsam gtan gsum pa'i bar du dge ba'i las ni bsod nams yin par bstan to zhes gsungs so // sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa myong bar 'gyur ba ni mi g-yo ba ste zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal yang ma yin /
translated: Therefore, it is taught that virtuous karma up to the third meditative absorption is meritorious.🔽Karma that is to be experienced as neither pleasure nor suffering is invariable.

original: bde ba yang ma yin ba'i tshor ba ni bsam gtan bzhi pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin ba'i tshor ba ni bsam gtan bzhi pa nas bzung ste /
translated: The experience of neither pleasure nor suffering extends from the fourth meditative absorption up to the peak of cyclic existence.

original: srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du'o //
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du'o //
translated: up to the summit of cyclic existence.

original: de ltar byas na bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa'i dge ba'i las dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i thams cad ni mi g-yo ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar byas na bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa'i dge ba'i las dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i thams cad ni mi g-yo ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, the wholesome action of the fourth meditation stage and all of those of the formless realm are called unshakable.

original: de bas na bsam gtan gsum pa'i gong ma'i 'o zhes smras so //
analyzed: de bas na bsam gtan gsum pa'i gong ma'i 'o zhes smras so //
translated: Therefore, it is said that the fourth meditation stage is superior to the third.

original: 'dir khungs ci yod ce na /
analyzed: 'dir khungs ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the scriptural source for this?

original: de ltar ni bcom ldan 'das kyis bsam gtan gsum po 'di na ni 'phags pa 'di dag g-yo ba yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de ltar ni bcom ldan 'das kyis bsam gtan gsum po 'di na ni 'phags pa 'di dag g-yo ba yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: The Blessed One said, “In these three meditations, the noble ones are shaken.”

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa 'dir ni 'phags pa 'di dag mi g-yo ba yin par gsungs so zhe'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa 'dir ni 'phags pa 'di dag mi g-yo ba yin par gsungs so zhe'o //
translated: In the fourth meditation stage, the noble ones are said to be unshaken.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is this known?

original: dge slong 'char ka 'di ltar 'dod pa las @108b rnam par dben pa /
analyzed: dge slong 'char ka 'di ltar 'dod pa las @108b rnam par dben pa /
translated: The Blessed One said, “The monk Udayi, in this way, is secluded from desires,

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos las dben pa /
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos las dben pa /
translated: secluded from evil, unwholesome dharmas,

original: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas shing /🔽rnam par dpyod pa dang bcas pa /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas shing /🔽rnam par dpyod pa dang bcas pa /
translated: with applied and sustained thought,🔽and with joy and happiness born of seclusion,

original: dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan dang po nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan dang po nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: He attains and dwells in the first concentration, which is accompanied by applied and sustained thought, with joy and bliss born of seclusion.

original: 'di ni 'dir 'phags pa rnams g-yo ba yin par bstan to //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dir 'phags pa rnams g-yo ba yin par bstan to //
translated: This is taught here as the movement of the noble ones.

original: ci'i phyir 'dir 'phags pa rnams g-yo ba yin par bstan zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'dir 'phags pa rnams g-yo ba yin par bstan zhe na /
translated: Why is this taught here as the movement of the noble ones?

original: 'dir rnam par rtog pa dang rnam par dpyod pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir rnam par rtog pa dang rnam par dpyod pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: Here, applied and sustained thought are the movement of the noble ones.

original: 'di ni 'dir 'phags pa rnams g-yo ba yin par bstan to //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dir 'phags pa rnams g-yo ba yin par bstan to //
translated: This is taught here as the movement of the noble ones.

original: dge slong 'char ka gzhan yang /🔽rnam par rtog pa dang rnam par dpyod pa nye bar zhi nas nad yongs su dang bas sems kyi rgyud gcig tu gyur ba'i phyir rnam par rtog pa med cing /
analyzed: dge slong 'char ka gzhan yang / rnam par rtog pa dang rnam par dpyod pa nye bar zhi nas nad yongs su dang bas sems kyi rgyud gcig tu gyur ba'i phyir rnam par rtog pa med cing /
translated: Moreover, monks,

original: rnam par dpyod pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan gnyis pa nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: rnam par dpyod pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan gnyis pa nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: after the stilling of applied and sustained thought, with the mind inwardly unified and focused, he attains and dwells in the second concentration, which is without applied and sustained thought, and is born of concentration, filled with joy and bliss.

original: 'di ni 'dir 'phags pa dag g-yo ba yin par bstan to //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dir 'phags pa dag g-yo ba yin par bstan to //
translated: This is taught here as the movement of the noble ones.

original: ci'i phyir 'dir 'phags pa dag g-yo ba yin par bstan zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'dir 'phags pa dag g-yo ba yin par bstan zhe na /
translated: Why is it taught here that the noble ones move?

original: 'dir gang bde ba dang ma bral ba gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir gang bde ba dang ma bral ba gang yin pa ste /
translated: Here, it is taught that the noble ones move in the sense that they are not separated from pleasure.

original: 'di ni 'dir 'phags pa dag g-yo ba yin par bstan to //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dir 'phags pa dag g-yo ba yin par bstan to //
translated: This is taught here as the movement of the noble ones.

original: gzhan yang dge slong 'char ka dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang bral te /
analyzed: gzhan yang dge slong 'char ka dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang bral te /
translated: Moreover, the monk Udayi, free from attachment to pleasure,

original: btang snyoms su gnas pa dran pa dang shes bzhin can bde ba lus kyis so sor myong ba gang 'phags pa rnams kyis bka' stsal ba gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: btang snyoms su gnas pa dran pa dang shes bzhin can bde ba lus kyis so sor myong ba gang 'phags pa rnams kyis bka' stsal ba gang yin pa ste /
translated: abides in equanimity, mindful and fully aware, experiencing with his body the bliss of which the noble ones declare:

original: btang snyoms can dran pa dang ldan zhing bde ba la gnas pa bsam gtan gsum pa nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: btang snyoms can dran pa dang ldan zhing bde ba la gnas pa bsam gtan gsum pa nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: “Equanimous and mindful, one abides in bliss,” he has attained the third absorption.

original: 'di ni 'dir 'phags pa rnams g-yo ba yin par bstan to //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dir 'phags pa rnams g-yo ba yin par bstan to //
translated: This is taught here as the movement of the noble ones.

original: ci'i phyir 'phags pa rnams g-yo bar bstan zhe na /🔽'di lta ste 'di ni bde ba'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'phags pa rnams g-yo bar bstan zhe na / 'di lta ste 'di ni bde ba'o //
translated: Why is it taught that the noble ones move?🔽It is like this: “This is bliss.

original: 'di ni bde ba'o zhes sems kyis rtsol ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni bde ba'o zhes sems kyis rtsol ba yin te /
translated: This is bliss,” the mind strives.

original: 'di ni 'dir 'phags pa rnams g-yo ba yin par bstan to //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dir 'phags pa rnams g-yo ba yin par bstan to //
translated: This is taught here as the noble ones’ movement.

original: dge slong 'char ka gzhan yang bde ba yang spangs sdug bsngal yang spangs te /
analyzed: dge slong 'char ka gzhan yang bde ba yang spangs sdug bsngal yang spangs te /
translated: “Bhikṣus, furthermore, having abandoned pleasure, having previously abandoned pain,

original: yid bde ba dang / yid mi bde ba ni snga nas med cing /🔽bde ba yang med /
analyzed: yid bde ba dang / yid mi bde ba ni snga nas med cing / bde ba yang med /
translated: having abandoned mental disquiet and mental pleasure,🔽without pain, without pleasure,

original: sdug bsngal ba yang med cing btang snyoms dang dran pa yongs su dag cing /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba yang med cing btang snyoms dang dran pa yongs su dag cing /
translated: and with complete purity of mindfulness owing to equanimity,

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa nye bar bsgrubs nas gnas te /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa nye bar bsgrubs nas gnas te /
translated: he accomplishes and dwells in the fourth meditation.

original: 'di ni 'dir 'phags pa rnams mi g-yo ba yin par bstan to //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dir 'phags pa rnams mi g-yo ba yin par bstan to //
translated: This is taught here as the noble ones’ immobility.

original: gal te sa 'og ma mi g-yo @109a * //
analyzed: gal te sa 'og ma mi g-yo @109a * //
translated: If the lower stages are immobile,

original: ba yin na ni sa gong ma 'di dag mi g-yo ba yin par 'grub ste /
analyzed: ba yin na ni sa gong ma 'di dag mi g-yo ba yin par 'grub ste /
translated: then these higher stages are established as immobile.

original: gzugs med pa'i sa rnams mi g-yo ba yin par bstan to //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i sa rnams mi g-yo ba yin par bstan to //
translated: The formless stages are taught as immobile.

original: de lta na 'og ma rnams kyi bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba ni rnam par smin pa ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan bzhi pa las 'og man sdug bsngal yang ma yin /
analyzed: de lta na 'og ma rnams kyi bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba ni rnam par smin pa ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan bzhi pa las 'og man sdug bsngal yang ma yin /
translated: Thus, the feeling that is neither pleasure nor pain would not be the karmic maturation of karma that is neither pleasant nor unpleasant.

original: bde ba yang ma yin pa myong bar 'gyur ba'i mi g-yo ba'i las yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽sdug bsngal yang ma yin /
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin pa myong bar 'gyur ba'i mi g-yo ba'i las yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro // sdug bsngal yang ma yin /
translated: This is because karma that is neither pleasant nor unpleasant and that is to be experienced as neither pleasant nor unpleasant does not exist below the fourth absorption.

original: bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba ni bsam gtan gzhan gyi las kyi rnam par smin pa yin par 'dod pa yang yin no //
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba ni bsam gtan gzhan gyi las kyi rnam par smin pa yin par 'dod pa yang yin no //
translated: The feeling that is neither pleasant nor unpleasant is asserted to be the karmic maturation of karma of the other absorptions.🔽It would also contradict the sutras.

original: mdo sde dang yang 'gal bar 'gyur te zhes rgyas par 'byung ba las /
analyzed: mdo sde dang yang 'gal bar 'gyur te zhes rgyas par 'byung ba las /
translated: The sutra states:🔽When merit is exhausted,

original: bsod nams zad nas zhes bya ba 'di ni bsam gtan gsum pa'i gong ma na yang bsod nams yod do zhes bya ba'i dper 'di yin no //
analyzed: bsod nams zad nas zhes bya ba 'di ni bsam gtan gsum pa'i gong ma na yang bsod nams yod do zhes bya ba'i dper 'di yin no //
translated: This is an example of the existence of merit above the third absorption.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa na ni rang gi sa pa'i g-yo ba med pas mi g-yo ba yin par bstan to zhes bya ba ni rkyen brgyad spangs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa na ni rang gi sa pa'i g-yo ba med pas mi g-yo ba yin par bstan to zhes bya ba ni rkyen brgyad spangs pa'i phyir te /
translated: In the fourth meditation, it is taught that it is unshakable because there is no movement in its stage.

original: de dag kyang rnam par rtog pa dang rnam par dpyod pa dang bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang yid bde ba dang dbugs rngub pa dang dbugs 'byung ba yin no //🔽bsam gtan gzhan dag kyang mi g-yo ba med pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag kyang rnam par rtog pa dang rnam par dpyod pa dang bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang yid bde ba dang dbugs rngub pa dang dbugs 'byung ba yin no // bsam gtan gzhan dag kyang mi g-yo ba med pa ni ma yin te /
translated: This is because it is free from the eight conditions, which are discursiveness, investigation, pleasure, pain, mental satisfaction, mental dissatisfaction, inhalation, and exhalation.

original: sa 'og ma'i g-yo ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sa 'og ma'i g-yo ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: The other meditations are not unshakable because they are not free from the movement of lower stages.

original: bsam gtan dang po ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs bas mi bskyod pa yin pas mi g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs bas mi bskyod pa yin pas mi g-yo ba'o //
translated: The first meditation is unshakable because it is not moved by the afflictions and secondary afflictions that occur in the desire realm.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa ni bsam gtan dang por gtogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang rnam par dpyod pas mi g-yos pa yin pa'i phyir mi g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa ni bsam gtan dang por gtogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang rnam par dpyod pas mi g-yos pa yin pa'i phyir mi g-yo ba'o //
translated: The second meditation is unshakable because it is not moved by the discursiveness and investigation that occur in the first meditation.

original: bsam gtan gsum pa ni bsam gtan gnyis par gtogs pa'i dga' ba gang yin pas mi g-yos pa'i phyir mi g-yo ba yin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa ni bsam gtan gnyis par gtogs pa'i dga' ba gang yin pas mi g-yos pa'i phyir mi g-yo ba yin no //
translated: The third meditative absorption is unshakable because it is not agitated by the joy that belongs to the second meditative absorption.🔽It is reasonable to say that it is unshakable by way of its synonyms,

original: rnam grangs kyis mi g-yo ba yin par brjod par rigs te zhes bya ba ni g-yo ba dang bcas pa yin du zin kyang /🔽rnam pa gzhan gyi sgo nas bstan to //
analyzed: rnam grangs kyis mi g-yo ba yin par brjod par rigs te zhes bya ba ni g-yo ba dang bcas pa yin du zin kyang / rnam pa gzhan gyi sgo nas bstan to //
translated: even though it is agitated.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: de'i phyir / de'i yan lag gis mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba bzhin zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / de'i yan lag gis mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba bzhin zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “it is like nirvana that is due to its branches.”

original: sa 'og ma pa'i nyon mongs pa de dag gi yan lag gis mya ngan las 'das pa yin te /🔽de'i yan lag gis mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba gang yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sa 'og ma pa'i nyon mongs pa de dag gi yan lag gis mya ngan las 'das pa yin te / de'i yan lag gis mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba gang yin pa bzhin no //
translated: Nirvana is due to the branches of those lower stages’ afflictions.🔽It is like nirvana that is due to its branches.🔽How is nirvana due to its branches?

original: de'i yan lag gis mya ngan las 'das @109b pa zhes bya ba ji lta bu zhe na zhes bya ba rgyas par bstan nas /
analyzed: de'i yan lag gis mya ngan las 'das @109b pa zhes bya ba ji lta bu zhe na zhes bya ba rgyas par bstan nas /
translated: Having explained this in detail,

original: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' lo de'i yan lag gis mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bstan na tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo de'i yan lag gis mya ngan las 'das par bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa gang lags /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' lo de'i yan lag gis mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bstan na tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo de'i yan lag gis mya ngan las 'das par bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa gang lags /
translated: Venerable Ānanda, if nirvāṇa is taught as a part of that, then, Venerable Ānanda, what is the part of that nirvāṇa that the Blessed One has taught?

original: tshe dang ldan pa dge slong 'dod pa can 'dod pa las dben pa /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dge slong 'dod pa can 'dod pa las dben pa /
translated: “Venerable, a lustful monk, separated from desire,

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos las rnam par dben pa rnam par rtog pa dang bcas /
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos las rnam par dben pa rnam par rtog pa dang bcas /
translated: separated from evil, unwholesome states,

original: rnam par dpyod pa dang bcas pa /
analyzed: rnam par dpyod pa dang bcas pa /
translated: with applied and sustained thought,

original: dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan dang po nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan dang po nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: with joy and happiness born of separation, dwells having attained the first absorption.

original: de ni de'i yan lag gis mya ngan las 'das pa yin par bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam grangs kyis bstan to //
analyzed: de ni de'i yan lag gis mya ngan las 'das pa yin par bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam grangs kyis bstan to //
translated: That is the part of that nirvāṇa that the Blessed One has taught by way of synonyms.”

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so zhes bya ba'i bar du rgyas par byas nas 'di ni rnam grangs kyis de'i yan lag gis mya ngan las 'das pa yin par bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan to //
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so zhes bya ba'i bar du rgyas par byas nas 'di ni rnam grangs kyis de'i yan lag gis mya ngan las 'das pa yin par bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan to //
translated: up to: “having actualized the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception, he abides there.” This is the nirvāṇa with a remainder of grasping taught by the Blessed One through synonyms.

original: tshe dang ldan pa dge slong 'dod pa can gzhan yang thams cad du 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched las yang dag par 'das te 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa lus kyis mngon du byas nas nye bar gnas so //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dge slong 'dod pa can gzhan yang thams cad du 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched las yang dag par 'das te 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa lus kyis mngon du byas nas nye bar gnas so //
translated: “Venerable monk, furthermore, having completely transcended the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception, he abides having attained the cessation of perception and feeling with his body, but not through insight.

original: 'dis shes rab kyis kyang zag pa rnams zag pa mthong ste /
analyzed: 'dis shes rab kyis kyang zag pa rnams zag pa mthong ste /
translated: Through insight, he sees the defilements as defilements.

original: yongs su zad pa 'di ni de'i yan lag gis mya ngan las 'das pa rnam grangs med par bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan to //
analyzed: yongs su zad pa 'di ni de'i yan lag gis mya ngan las 'das pa rnam grangs med par bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan to //
translated: This complete exhaustion is the nirvāṇa without a remainder of grasping taught by the Blessed One through synonyms.

original: nus pa zhes bya ba de chos gang zhe na /
analyzed: nus pa zhes bya ba de chos gang zhe na /
translated: What is the dharma called ‘ability’?

original: rgyu'i dngos po yin no zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i dngos po ni 'bras bu bskyed pas rnam par phye ba yin no //
analyzed: rgyu'i dngos po yin no zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i dngos po ni 'bras bu bskyed pas rnam par phye ba yin no //
translated: The cause is the entity that is the cause. The cause is distinguished by the production of the effect.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dper na 'bru'i 'bras bu ni rkyen gyi bye brags gzhi dang zhes rgyas par 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dper na 'bru'i 'bras bu ni rkyen gyi bye brags gzhi dang zhes rgyas par 'byung ba yin no //
translated: For this very reason, the Sūtra says: “The fruit of the seed is the earth, etc.,” and so on.

original: 'dir 'di dpyad par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir 'di dpyad par bya ste /
translated: Here, this should be investigated:

original: rgyu'i dngos po 'di ci yin /
analyzed: rgyu'i dngos po 'di ci yin /
translated: What is the entity that is the cause?

original: dngos po las gzhan ma yin pa yin /
analyzed: dngos po las gzhan ma yin pa yin /
translated: Is it not different from the effect?

original: ci nyes gal te gzhan yin na ni sa bon la sogs pa'i chos ni 'di ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci nyes gal te gzhan yin na ni sa bon la sogs pa'i chos ni 'di ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is different, the seed, etc., would not be the cause.

original: gal te gzhan ma yin pa yin na ni rgyu'i dngos po du ma las rnam par ma log pa gcig yin par ji ltar 'grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te gzhan ma yin pa yin na ni rgyu'i dngos po du ma las rnam par ma log pa gcig yin par ji ltar 'grub par 'gyur /
translated: If it is not different, how can the cause be established as one, not distinguished from the many entities?

original: yang rgyu zhes bya ba'i dngos po dag gang las rnam par log cing rdzas su yod pa'i chos ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //🔽yang rnam par log pa'am /
analyzed: yang rgyu zhes bya ba'i dngos po dag gang las rnam par log cing rdzas su yod pa'i chos ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no // yang rnam par log pa'am /
translated: Moreover, the entity called “cause” is not a real entity that is distinguished from anything.

original: ma log pa yang rung ste /
analyzed: ma log pa yang rung ste /
translated: And again, whether it is distinguished or not,

original: @110a * // sa bon la sogs pa yin pa brjod pa'i dngos po de ni rgyu du ma gzhan dang gzhan snga ba yin pa las de ltar mngon par grub pa yin te /
analyzed: @110a * // sa bon la sogs pa yin pa brjod pa'i dngos po de ni rgyu du ma gzhan dang gzhan snga ba yin pa las de ltar mngon par grub pa yin te /
translated: The thing that is said to be the seed, etc., is established in that way from many other causes that are prior.

original: dper na rkyen la ltos nas de'i 'bras bu 'grub pa gzhan no //🔽lus gang yin las ci yin ci'i phyir na lus zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba dang ; de bzhin du yid kyi las kyi bar du'o zhes bya ba ni ji ltar lus las ci yin ci'i phyir na lus zhes bya /
analyzed: dper na rkyen la ltos nas de'i 'bras bu 'grub pa gzhan no // lus gang yin las ci yin ci'i phyir na lus zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba dang ; de bzhin du yid kyi las kyi bar du'o zhes bya ba ni ji ltar lus las ci yin ci'i phyir na lus zhes bya /
translated: For example, the result is established in dependence on conditions.🔽What is the body? What is the meaning of body?🔽And so on up to: What is mental karma? What is the meaning of mental karma?

original: las zhes bya ba yang gang yin zhes bya ba de bzhin du ngag gang yin /
analyzed: las zhes bya ba yang gang yin zhes bya ba de bzhin du ngag gang yin /
translated: Just as it is said: What is the body? What is the meaning of body?

original: ci'i phyir ngag ces bya ba dang / ngag gi las kyang gang /🔽yid kyi las ci yin ci'i phyir na yid kyi las zhes bya /
analyzed: ci'i phyir ngag ces bya ba dang / ngag gi las kyang gang / yid kyi las ci yin ci'i phyir na yid kyi las zhes bya /
translated: What is the meaning of verbal karma?🔽What is mental karma? What is the meaning of mental karma?

original: yid kyi las kyang gang yin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yid kyi las kyang gang yin zhes bya'o //
translated: What is mental karma?

original: de bas na de dag ni grub pa las gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: de bas na de dag ni grub pa las gzung bar bya ste /
translated: Therefore, they should be understood from the established meaning.

original: las grub pa las lus la sogs pa yang ji ltar bstan zhe na /
analyzed: las grub pa las lus la sogs pa yang ji ltar bstan zhe na /
translated: How can the body, etc., be established as action?

original: lus ni dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur ba 'dus pa'i bye brag go //
analyzed: lus ni dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur ba 'dus pa'i bye brag go //
translated: The body is a collection of the elements and derivative form, together with the faculties.

original: bsags pa'i don gyis lus zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bsags pa'i don gyis lus zhes bya ste /
translated: It is called “body” because it is a collection,

original: 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur ba'i rdul phra rab bsags pa yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽kha cig na re smad pa'i don gyis yin te /
analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur ba'i rdul phra rab bsags pa yin pa'i phyir ro // kha cig na re smad pa'i don gyis yin te /
translated: because it is a collection of subtle particles of the elements and derivative form.

original: mi gtsang ba'i rdzas kyi 'byung khungs yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: mi gtsang ba'i rdzas kyi 'byung khungs yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Some say that it is called “body” because it is the source of impure substances.

original: de lta na ni lha'i lus lus ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni lha'i lus lus ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, the bodies of the gods would not be bodies.🔽The body is called “action” because it is formed by the mental faculty, which is the agent, in the sense of the Sanskrit verbal root kr, to form.

original: nges pa'i tshig gi tshul gyi byed pa po yid kyis mngon par 'du byed pa ni las yin pa dang / lus skyob par byed pa'i las ni lus kyi las zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig gi tshul gyi byed pa po yid kyis mngon par 'du byed pa ni las yin pa dang / lus skyob par byed pa'i las ni lus kyi las zhes bya ba la /
translated: The action that protects the body is called bodily action.

original: sems pa yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: sems pa yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three kinds of intention.

original: shin tu bskyod pa dang / nges pa dang bskyod pa ste gang gis lus skyong par byed pa de ni de'i rgyun yul gzhan du 'byung bar byed pa'i rgyu rlung sgrub par byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: shin tu bskyod pa dang / nges pa dang bskyod pa ste gang gis lus skyong par byed pa de ni de'i rgyun yul gzhan du 'byung bar byed pa'i rgyu rlung sgrub par byed pa'i phyir te /
translated: The wind that establishes the cause for the arising of the body's continuum in another place is the wind that moves the body, the wind that definitely moves the body, and the wind that moves the body very much.

original: de ni lus kyi las zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ni lus kyi las zhes bya ste /
translated: This is called bodily karma.

original: tshig bar ma mi mngon par byas pa'i phyir 'bru mar gyi stobs dang rlung gi rdul bzhin no //
analyzed: tshig bar ma mi mngon par byas pa'i phyir 'bru mar gyi stobs dang rlung gi rdul bzhin no //
translated: The middle word is omitted, just as in the expressions “the power of oil” and “the dust of wind.”

original: las kyi lam la ni las rnam pa gsum yin par 'dod pa /
analyzed: las kyi lam la ni las rnam pa gsum yin par 'dod pa /
translated: Karma is asserted to be of three types in the case of the karmic paths.

original: srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pa log par spyod pa yin na sems pa la de dag ji ltar brjod par bya zhe na /
analyzed: srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pa log par spyod pa yin na sems pa la de dag ji ltar brjod par bya zhe na /
translated: If killing, taking what is not given, and sexual misconduct are karma, how can they be described as intention?

original: nges shin tu gsod pa dang len pa dang log par spyod pa'i phyir dang / des bskyod pa'i lus kyi rgyun byas pa ni des byas pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: nges shin tu gsod pa dang len pa dang log par spyod pa'i phyir dang / des bskyod pa'i lus kyi rgyun byas pa ni des byas pa zhes bya ste /
translated: They are called killing, taking what is not given, and sexual misconduct because they are the intention to kill, to take what is not given, and to engage in sexual misconduct. The continuum of the body that is moved by that intention is called that which is done by that intention.

original: dper na rkun pos grong bsregs pa dang / rtsvas 'bras chan tshos pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rkun pos grong bsregs pa dang / rtsvas 'bras chan tshos pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, a town is burned by a thief and rice is cooked by grass.

original: ji ltar @110b sems pa las kyi lam yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar @110b sems pa las kyi lam yin zhe na /
translated: How can intention be a path of action?

original: de ni las kyang yin /
analyzed: de ni las kyang yin /
translated: It is an action and

original: ngan 'gro rnams kyi las kyang yin pas las kyi lam yin pa'am /
analyzed: ngan 'gro rnams kyi las kyang yin pas las kyi lam yin pa'am /
translated: it is the action of the evil destinies, thus it is a path of action.

original: lus skyod par byed pa'i sems pa zhes bya ba rnam pa gsum char yang las kyi lam yin no //
analyzed: lus skyod par byed pa'i sems pa zhes bya ba rnam pa gsum char yang las kyi lam yin no //
translated: Or else, the three types of intention that cause the body to move are paths of action.

original: de gang zhe na /
analyzed: de gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: de'i dbang gis 'jug pa'i phyir dang / des srog la sogs pa gcod pa dang / len pa dang / log par spyod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis 'jug pa'i phyir dang / des srog la sogs pa gcod pa dang / len pa dang / log par spyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they engage in action by the power of intention, and because they kill, take up, and engage in life, etc.

original: 'jig rten dang rjes su mthun par bya ba'i phyir de ni lus kyi las yin no zhes kyang ston to //
analyzed: 'jig rten dang rjes su mthun par bya ba'i phyir de ni lus kyi las yin no zhes kyang ston to //
translated: They are also called bodily actions because they conform to the world.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba nyid ni de ma yin no //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba nyid ni de ma yin no //
translated: But they are not virtuous or nonvirtuous.

original: gdags na ni sems pa de'i sgo nas 'jig rten pa'i 'jug pa dang ldog pa shin tu sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gdags na ni sems pa de'i sgo nas 'jig rten pa'i 'jug pa dang ldog pa shin tu sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If they were, then the world would not engage in or disengage from them by means of that intention.

original: gal te sems pa kho na dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las yin na ni mdo sde las bsams nas byas pa'i lus kyi las rnam pa gsum byas shing nye bar bsags pa'i mi dge ba sdug bsngal 'byung bar byed pa rnam par smin pa sdug bsngal ba'o
analyzed: gal te sems pa kho na dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las yin na ni mdo sde las bsams nas byas pa'i lus kyi las rnam pa gsum byas shing nye bar bsags pa'i mi dge ba sdug bsngal 'byung bar byed pa rnam par smin pa sdug bsngal ba'o
translated: If intention alone were virtuous or nonvirtuous karma, why would a sutra declare:🔽The nonvirtuous karma committed and accumulated by the three types of physical karma motivated by intention produces suffering.

original: zhes bya ba ci'i phyir gsung bar 'gyur sgo de nas byas pa'i phyir ro zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ci'i phyir gsung bar 'gyur sgo de nas byas pa'i phyir ro zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: Its karmic maturation is suffering.

original: de las gzhan pa'i sems pa ni yid kyi las yin no zhes bstan te /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i sems pa ni yid kyi las yin no zhes bstan te /
translated: The intention that is different from that is mental karma.

original: yid dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir dang / lus dang ngag 'jug par mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir dang / lus dang ngag 'jug par mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is mental karma because it is concomitant with the mind and it does not engage the body and speech.

original: 'o na ci'i phyir sems pa'i las dang bsams pa'i las zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs she na /
analyzed: 'o na ci'i phyir sems pa'i las dang bsams pa'i las zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs she na /
translated: Why did the Bhagavān declare intention karma and post intention karma?

original: sngar sems pa rnam pa gsum bstan pa de la gnyis ni bsams nas so //
analyzed: sngar sems pa rnam pa gsum bstan pa de la gnyis ni bsams nas so //
translated: The three types of intention previously explained are intention karma.

original: gsum pas ni 'jug par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: gsum pas ni 'jug par byed pa yin te /
translated: The third type is post intention karma.

original: 'di yang bsams pa'i las zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di yang bsams pa'i las zhes bya'o //
translated: It is also called post intention karma.

original: tshig ni ngag yin te /
analyzed: tshig ni ngag yin te /
translated: Speech is the voice.

original: brjod pa gang gis don khong du chud par byed pa'i las te kun nas slong bar byed pa'i sems pa ni yi ge'i rnam pa dang ldan pa'i ngag gi las yin te snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: brjod pa gang gis don khong du chud par byed pa'i las te kun nas slong bar byed pa'i sems pa ni yi ge'i rnam pa dang ldan pa'i ngag gi las yin te snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The action of understanding the meaning by means of the expression is the volition that instigates the action of speech that is associated with the aspect of syllables, as before.

original: ngag kun nas slong bar byed pa'i las ni ngag gi las zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ngag kun nas slong bar byed pa'i las ni ngag gi las zhes bya ste /
translated: The action of instigating speech is called the action of speech.

original: tshig bar ma mi mngon par byas pa snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: tshig bar ma mi mngon par byas pa snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The intermediate term is elided, as before.

original: yid ni rnam par shes pa la bya ste /
analyzed: yid ni rnam par shes pa la bya ste /
translated: Mind is the consciousness.

original: mnyam par ma bzhag pa yin pa'i phyir dang / skye gnas gzhan dang / yul la 'dud par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mnyam par ma bzhag pa yin pa'i phyir dang / skye gnas gzhan dang / yul la 'dud par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not in equipoise, because it is the other birth, and because it is the object of bowing down.

original: yid kyi las ni de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems pa yin te /
analyzed: yid kyi las ni de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems pa yin te /
translated: The action of mind is the volition that is associated with it.

original: yid dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i las ni yid kyi las so zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: yid dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i las ni yid kyi las so zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The action of that which is associated with mind is the action of mind, as before.

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed @111a * //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed @111a * //
translated: Conditioned by ignorance, there are volitions.

original: ces bya ba 'dir rkyen dang rkyen can gnyis nges pa dang ma nges pa la skyon yod pa yin te zhes bya ba la rkyen dang rkyen can nges pa la skyon yod pa dang / gnyi ga nges pa la skyon yod pa dang ma nges pa la skyon yod pa'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba 'dir rkyen dang rkyen can gnyis nges pa dang ma nges pa la skyon yod pa yin te zhes bya ba la rkyen dang rkyen can nges pa la skyon yod pa dang / gnyi ga nges pa la skyon yod pa dang ma nges pa la skyon yod pa'o //
translated: Here, the error in the ascertainment and non-ascertainment of the condition and that which has the condition is stated. The error in the ascertainment of the condition and that which has the condition, the error in the ascertainment of both, and the error in the non-ascertainment of both.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: gal te ma rig pa kho na 'du byed kyi rkyen yin na ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba yin no //🔽dge ba dang mi dge ba dang 'dun pa dang rtsol ba la sogs pa med par yang zhes bya ba ni dge ba dang 'dun cing lus dang ngag dge ba'i rtsa ba la rtsol ba dang / mi dge ba dang 'dun cing lus dang ngag mi dge ba'i rtsa ba rtsol ba dang /
analyzed: gal te ma rig pa kho na 'du byed kyi rkyen yin na ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba yin no // dge ba dang mi dge ba dang 'dun pa dang rtsol ba la sogs pa med par yang zhes bya ba ni dge ba dang 'dun cing lus dang ngag dge ba'i rtsa ba la rtsol ba dang / mi dge ba dang 'dun cing lus dang ngag mi dge ba'i rtsa ba rtsol ba dang /
translated: If only ignorance were the condition of formations, etc.🔽Even without intention and effort for virtue and non-virtue, etc. means even without intention for virtue and effort in the roots of virtue of body and speech, and intention for non-virtue and effort in the roots of non-virtue of body and speech,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba dang 'dun cing lus dang ngag dge ba'i las la rtsol ba med par yang /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba dang 'dun cing lus dang ngag dge ba'i las la rtsol ba med par yang /
translated: and even without intention for the roots of virtue and effort in virtuous actions of body and speech,

original: ma rig pa tsam las bsod nams dang / bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i 'du byed rnams rgyun du 'byung bar thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: ma rig pa tsam las bsod nams dang / bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i 'du byed rnams rgyun du 'byung bar thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba yin no //
translated: nonmerit, and nonmovement would occur continuously, due to mere ignorance.🔽Moreover, another sutra states:

original: yang mdo sde gzhan las dge ba'i rtsa ba yang gsum mo //
analyzed: yang mdo sde gzhan las dge ba'i rtsa ba yang gsum mo //
translated: There are three roots of virtue.

original: mi dge ba'i rtsa ba yang gsum ste /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i rtsa ba yang gsum ste /
translated: There are three roots of nonvirtue.

original: gsum pa ni las kyi gzhi dang kun 'byung ba yin no zhes bya ba ni chags pa ni las kyi gzhi dang kun 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: gsum pa ni las kyi gzhi dang kun 'byung ba yin no zhes bya ba ni chags pa ni las kyi gzhi dang kun 'byung ba yin te /
translated: The basis and origin of karma is attachment,

original: zhe sdang dang rmongs pa yang yin no //
analyzed: zhe sdang dang rmongs pa yang yin no //
translated: aversion, and delusion.

original: chags pa med pa la sogs pa yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: chags pa med pa la sogs pa yang de bzhin no //
translated: The absence of attachment and so on is also like that.🔽This would contradict other sūtras.

original: de la sogs pa dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa kho na de dag gi rkyen yin na dge ba'i rtsa ba la sogs pa dag 'du byed rnams kyi rkyen yin par 'byung ba dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la sogs pa dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa kho na de dag gi rkyen yin na dge ba'i rtsa ba la sogs pa dag 'du byed rnams kyi rkyen yin par 'byung ba dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If ignorance alone is the condition of the formative forces, it would contradict the statement that the roots of virtue and so on are the conditions of the formative forces.

original: de bzhin du reg pa ni sems pa'i rkyen yin par 'byung ba dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du reg pa ni sems pa'i rkyen yin par 'byung ba dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Likewise, it would contradict the statement that contact is the condition of intention.

original: rnam par rtog pa yang rnam par dpyod pa gnyis ngag gi rkyen yin par 'byung ba la sogs pa dang 'gal lo //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa yang rnam par dpyod pa gnyis ngag gi rkyen yin par 'byung ba la sogs pa dang 'gal lo //
translated: And it would contradict the statement that investigation is the condition of discernment and so on.

original: de ltar na re zhig ma rig pa kho na 'du byed de dag gi rkyen yin na ni de dag gi rkyen ma rig pa yin pas rkyen nges par byas na skyon yod pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig ma rig pa kho na 'du byed de dag gi rkyen yin na ni de dag gi rkyen ma rig pa yin pas rkyen nges par byas na skyon yod pa yin no //
translated: Thus, if ignorance alone were the condition of those formations, then since ignorance would be the condition of those formations, the fault of specifying the condition would ensue.

original: 'on te 'du byed kho na'i rkyen ma rig pa yin te zhes bya ba ni rkyen can nges par byas na skyon yod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on te 'du byed kho na'i rkyen ma rig pa yin te zhes bya ba ni rkyen can nges par byas na skyon yod pa yin no //
translated: But if ignorance were the condition of formations alone, then the fault of specifying the conditioned would ensue.

original: rkyen can nges pa yin na ni /
analyzed: rkyen can nges pa yin na ni /
translated: If the conditioned were specified,

original: ma rig pa'i rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu med par 'gyur ro //
translated: then ignorance would not have the maturational result.

original: 'on te ma nges pa yin na ni ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed ces brjod pa ji ltar don med par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on te ma nges pa yin na ni ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed ces brjod pa ji ltar don med par mi 'gyur te /
translated: But if it is not specified, then why would the statement “Conditioned by ignorance, formations arise” be meaningless?

original: gal te re zhig 'du byed kyi rgyu brjod par @111b 'dod de ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed ces bya ba 'di smras pa yin na ni 'du byed thams cad kyi rgyu yin par brjod par bya dgos so //
analyzed: gal te re zhig 'du byed kyi rgyu brjod par @111b 'dod de ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed ces bya ba 'di smras pa yin na ni 'du byed thams cad kyi rgyu yin par brjod par bya dgos so //
translated: If it is the cause of formations that is being stated, then it must be stated that ignorance is the cause of all formations.

original: 'on te ma rig pa'i 'bras bu brjod par 'dod na ni ma rig pa'i 'bras bu thams cad brjod par bya dgos so //🔽'on te rgyu brjod par bya ba'i phyir yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on te ma rig pa'i 'bras bu brjod par 'dod na ni ma rig pa'i 'bras bu thams cad brjod par bya dgos so // 'on te rgyu brjod par bya ba'i phyir yang ma yin no //
translated: If the effect of ignorance is being stated, then it must be stated that ignorance is the effect of all formations.

original: 'bras bu brjod par bya ba'i phyir yang ma yin na ni 'o na ni ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed ces 'chad pa 'di don med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'bras bu brjod par bya ba'i phyir yang ma yin na ni 'o na ni ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed ces 'chad pa 'di don med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If it is neither the cause nor the effect that is being stated, then this explanation of ignorance as the condition of formations is meaningless.

original: 'dir nges pa dang ma nges pa gnyi ga yin na yang bshad pa don med par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dir nges pa dang ma nges pa gnyi ga yin na yang bshad pa don med par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Here, even if it is both definite and indefinite, the explanation is not meaningless.

original: de bzhin du bstan pa ni 'du byed rnams kyi rkyen gyi gtso bo bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: de bzhin du bstan pa ni 'du byed rnams kyi rkyen gyi gtso bo bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di skad bstan te /
translated: In the same way, it is taught that ignorance is the principal condition of formations.

original: rkyen bstan pa'i phyir ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed ces bya ba de bzhin du bstan du zin kyang rkyen thams cad bstan pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rkyen bstan pa'i phyir ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed ces bya ba de bzhin du bstan du zin kyang rkyen thams cad bstan pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: In order to teach the conditions, he said, “Conditioned by ignorance, there are karmic formations.” But this was not said in order to teach all the conditions.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: gtso bo'i rkyen brjod par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtso bo'i rkyen brjod par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to state the principal condition.

original: de bas na ston pa don med pa ma yin no ;
analyzed: de bas na ston pa don med pa ma yin no ;
translated: Therefore, the teaching is not meaningless.

original: / bsod nams la sogs pa'i las rnams 'du byed nyid yin par ni de'i dbang gis yin pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba la de'i dbang gis yin pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba ni bsod nams dang / bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i las rnams kyis yang srid pa mngon par 'du byed pa ni ma rig pa'i dbang gis yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: / bsod nams la sogs pa'i las rnams 'du byed nyid yin par ni de'i dbang gis yin pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba la de'i dbang gis yin pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba ni bsod nams dang / bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i las rnams kyis yang srid pa mngon par 'du byed pa ni ma rig pa'i dbang gis yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Karmic formations are actions such as merit, etc. because they are due to that, i.e., because the actualization of renewed existence is due to the power of ignorance.

original: de khong du chud par byed pa smras pa ni 'di lta ste rig pa de ma skyes na ni yang srid pa mngon par 'du byed pa yin gyi rig pa skyes na ni ma yin no zhes bya ba dang / kun nas 'byung ba na yang ci'i rkyen yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ci zhe na /
analyzed: de khong du chud par byed pa smras pa ni 'di lta ste rig pa de ma skyes na ni yang srid pa mngon par 'du byed pa yin gyi rig pa skyes na ni ma yin no zhes bya ba dang / kun nas 'byung ba na yang ci'i rkyen yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ci zhe na /
translated: The explanation of how that is understood is as follows: If that cognition does not arise, then one accumulates the karma that leads to rebirth, but if that cognition does arise, then one does not.

original: bsod nams la sogs pa'i las kyi gtso bo'i rkyen ni ma rig pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bsod nams la sogs pa'i las kyi gtso bo'i rkyen ni ma rig pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: What is that? It is that ignorance is the primary condition of meritorious and other types of karma.

original: ji ltar kun nas 'byung ba na ma rig pa'i spyi'i rkyen yin pa de bzhin du ston pa ni bsod nams ma yin pa'i 'du byed rnams kun nas 'byung ba na nyon mongs pa thams cad dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir spyi'i rkyen yin no zhes bya ba
analyzed: ji ltar kun nas 'byung ba na ma rig pa'i spyi'i rkyen yin pa de bzhin du ston pa ni bsod nams ma yin pa'i 'du byed rnams kun nas 'byung ba na nyon mongs pa thams cad dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir spyi'i rkyen yin no zhes bya ba
translated: Just as ignorance is the general condition of origination, so too it is the general condition of the origination of nonmeritorious karma, because it is concomitant with all the afflictions.

original: ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad kyis bsgrubs pa'i las kun nas 'byung ba na nyon mongs pa'i sa chen po pa yin pa'i phyir ma rig pa ni spyi'i rkyen yin no //
analyzed: ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad kyis bsgrubs pa'i las kun nas 'byung ba na nyon mongs pa'i sa chen po pa yin pa'i phyir ma rig pa ni spyi'i rkyen yin no //
translated: Ignorance is the general condition, because it is the great ground of all the karma that is produced by all the afflictions and the secondary afflictions such as attachment and hatred.

original: gang du 'dod chags kyis kun nas bslang ba'i las de'i rkyen ni zhe @112a * //🔽sdang ma yin no //
analyzed: gang du 'dod chags kyis kun nas bslang ba'i las de'i rkyen ni zhe @112a * // sdang ma yin no //
translated: The condition of the karma that is produced by attachment is not hatred.🔽The condition of the karma that is produced by hatred is not attachment.

original: zhe sdang gis kun nas bslang ba'i las de'i rkyen ni 'dod chags ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhe sdang gis kun nas bslang ba'i las de'i rkyen ni 'dod chags ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: And so on.🔽Just as all the afflictions are produced by the condition of ignorance, so too are all the volitions that are concomitant with it.

original: ji ltar nyon mongs pa thams cad ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis kun nas bslang ba de bzhin du de dang mtshungs par ldan pa sems pa rnams kyi yang yin no zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa thams cad dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams kyi yang yin zhes🔽bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ji ltar nyon mongs pa thams cad ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis kun nas bslang ba de bzhin du de dang mtshungs par ldan pa sems pa rnams kyi yang yin no zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa thams cad dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams kyi yang yin zhes🔽bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that all the volitions that are concomitant with the afflictions are also produced by the condition of ignorance.

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad kun nas 'byung ba'i rkyen ma rig pa ji ltar yin //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad kun nas 'byung ba'i rkyen ma rig pa ji ltar yin //
translated: How is ignorance the condition for the origination of all defilements?

original: ci brag pa kun du 'byung ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes sam zhe na /
analyzed: ci brag pa kun du 'byung ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes sam zhe na /
translated: Do you understand the origination of ignorance as it truly is?

original: ma rig pa kun 'byung gis zag pa kun 'byung ste /
analyzed: ma rig pa kun 'byung gis zag pa kun 'byung ste /
translated: The origination of the defilements is due to the origination of ignorance.

original: ji skad du rmongs pa kho nas de dag skye ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ji skad du rmongs pa kho nas de dag skye ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: It is said that “they arise only through delusion. ”

original: re zhig bsod nams ma yin pa ni de lta bu yin no //
analyzed: re zhig bsod nams ma yin pa ni de lta bu yin no //
translated: This is how non-merit is.

original: bsod nams kyi 'du byed rnams kyi yang rkyen yin te /
analyzed: bsod nams kyi 'du byed rnams kyi yang rkyen yin te /
translated: It is also the condition for meritorious formations.🔽When one is motivated to accomplish and to follow a life and enjoyments that are different from those of the previous life, then, as stated in the sutra, “due to the origination of merit, the origination of consciousness occurs. ”

original: srid pa dang longs spyod tha dad pa mngon par sgrub pa dang rjes su mthun pa kun nas dbyung ba na yang zhes rgyas par 'byung ba de la srid pa ni lha dang mi la sogs pa'i lus la bya'o //
analyzed: srid pa dang longs spyod tha dad pa mngon par sgrub pa dang rjes su mthun pa kun nas dbyung ba na yang zhes rgyas par 'byung ba de la srid pa ni lha dang mi la sogs pa'i lus la bya'o //
translated: Life refers to the bodies of gods, humans, and so on.

original: longs spyod ni gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'i yul rnams so //
analyzed: longs spyod ni gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'i yul rnams so //
translated: Enjoyments refers to objects such as form, sound, and so on.

original: srid pa dang longs spyod de dag gi dbye ba ni srid pa dang longs spyod dbye ba tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: srid pa dang longs spyod de dag gi dbye ba ni srid pa dang longs spyod dbye ba tha dad pa'o //
translated: The differentiation of existence and enjoyment is the differentiation of existence and enjoyment.

original: mngon par sgrub pa de 'du byed gang yin pa de dag gi rgyu byed pa la rjes su mthun pa zhes bya ba yin pas de ni srid pa dang longs spyod dbye ba tha dad pa mngon par sgrub pa dang rjes su mthun pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mngon par sgrub pa de 'du byed gang yin pa de dag gi rgyu byed pa la rjes su mthun pa zhes bya ba yin pas de ni srid pa dang longs spyod dbye ba tha dad pa mngon par sgrub pa dang rjes su mthun pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The conformity of the cause of those formations that are the establishment of existence and enjoyment is called conformity.

original: de dag kun nas 'byung ba na yang de dag dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i ma rig pa ni spyi'i rkyen yin zhes bya ba de la mngon par sgrub pa ni 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: de dag kun nas 'byung ba na yang de dag dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i ma rig pa ni spyi'i rkyen yin zhes bya ba de la mngon par sgrub pa ni 'dod pa ste /
translated: And when they arise, the ignorance that coexists with them is the general condition.

original: lhar shog shig / mir shog shig / bdag gi longs spyod kyang khyad par can du shog shig ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: lhar shog shig / mir shog shig / bdag gi longs spyod kyang khyad par can du shog shig ces bya ba yin no //
translated: The establishment of existence and enjoyment is the desire to be born as a god, to be born as a human, and to have special enjoyments.

original: mngon par sgrub pa de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ma rig pa ni de dag dang lhan cig 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: mngon par sgrub pa de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ma rig pa ni de dag dang lhan cig 'byung ba yin no //
translated: The ignorance associated with that establishment is what coexists with them.

original: sa der nges par 'byung bar lta bas kun nas bslang ba mi g-yo ba rnams kyi yang zhes rgyas par 'byung ba la bsam gtan dang po nas srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du sa der thar par 'dod pas nges par 'byung bar lta ba ni sa der nges
analyzed: sa der nges par 'byung bar lta bas kun nas bslang ba mi g-yo ba rnams kyi yang zhes rgyas par 'byung ba la bsam gtan dang po nas srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du sa der thar par 'dod pas nges par 'byung bar lta ba ni sa der nges
translated: The Abhidharmakosa states,

original: par 'byung bar lta ba'o //
analyzed: par 'byung bar lta ba'o //
translated: The view of definite emergence is the motivating force🔽for the unmoved.

original: sa der nges par 'byung bar lta bas kun nas bslang ba ni sa der nges par 'byung bas kun nas bslang ba'o //
analyzed: sa der nges par 'byung bar lta bas kun nas bslang ba ni sa der nges par 'byung bas kun nas bslang ba'o //
translated: The view of definite emergence is the view that one definitely emerges from that level.🔽The motivating force of the view of definite emergence is the motivating force of definite emergence.🔽The ignorance that is concomitant with the view that is the motivating force of definite emergence is the ignorance that is concomitant with the motivating force of definite emergence.

original: sa der nges par 'byung bas @112b kun nas bslang ba mi g-yo ba'i 'du byed de dag gi yang de dag dang lhan cig 'byung bar lta ba de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ma rig pa ni ci zhe na /
analyzed: sa der nges par 'byung bas @112b kun nas bslang ba mi g-yo ba'i 'du byed de dag gi yang de dag dang lhan cig 'byung bar lta ba de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ma rig pa ni ci zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: spyi'i rkyen yin no zhes bya'o //
analyzed: spyi'i rkyen yin no zhes bya'o //
translated: It is a general condition.

original: don de dag nyid tshigs su bcad de brjod pa zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni nyon mongs pa gzhan dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ma rig pa yang 'du byed kyi rkyen yin /
analyzed: don de dag nyid tshigs su bcad de brjod pa zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni nyon mongs pa gzhan dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ma rig pa yang 'du byed kyi rkyen yin /
translated: The ignorance concomitant with other afflictions is also a condition of formations.🔽Nonconcomitant ignorance is the dominant condition.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa yang gtso bo'i rkyen yin no zhes bstan ma thag pa rnams tshigs su bcad pas brjod pa ni /🔽'du byed rnams kyi rkyen nyid du //
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa yang gtso bo'i rkyen yin no zhes bstan ma thag pa rnams tshigs su bcad pas brjod pa ni / 'du byed rnams kyi rkyen nyid du //
translated: The just explained meaning is stated in verse:🔽Ignorance is taught as the condition

original: ma rig bstan pa rnam gnyis te //
analyzed: ma rig bstan pa rnam gnyis te //
translated: of the two kinds of formations.

original: zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis ni rnam gnyis so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis ni rnam gnyis so //
translated: Two kinds means two.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?🔽Therefore it is said:

original: de'i phyir / nyon mongs gzhan ldan spyi yi rkyen //🔽de med pa ni gtso bo'i rkyen //
analyzed: de'i phyir / nyon mongs gzhan ldan spyi yi rkyen // de med pa ni gtso bo'i rkyen //
translated: Concomitant with other afflictions is the general condition.

original: ces smras te /
analyzed: ces smras te /
translated: Its absence is the dominant condition.

original: ci zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: nyon mongs pa gzhan dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa ni gtso bo'i rkyen yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa gzhan dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa ni gtso bo'i rkyen yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Nonconcomitant with other afflictions is the dominant condition.

original: gal te de dag gi rkyen kyang ma rig pa yin pa'i phyir zhes rgyas par 'byung pa ni gal te nyon mongs pa de dag gi rkyen yang ma rig pa yin bzhin du ma rig pa'i yan lag kho na bstan gyi /
analyzed: gal te de dag gi rkyen kyang ma rig pa yin pa'i phyir zhes rgyas par 'byung pa ni gal te nyon mongs pa de dag gi rkyen yang ma rig pa yin bzhin du ma rig pa'i yan lag kho na bstan gyi /

analyzed: nyon mongs pa gzhan ma yin na go / ma rig pa ni nyon mongs pa rnams kyi rkyen yin la / nyon mongs pa yang 'du byed rnams kyi yin pas /

analyzed: yan lag ltag par ji ltar thal bar mi 'gyur zhes rgol pa ni glags mi thod pa yin te / gtso bo'i rkyen brjod par bzhed pa'i phyir ro //

original: ma rig pa las gzhan pa'i nyon mongs pa ni 'du byed rnams kyi rkyen yin du zin kyang gtso bo'i rkyen ma yin no //🔽'du byed rnams kyis bsdus pa'i don rnam par gzhag pa 'dir rnam pa bcur rig par bya ste /
analyzed: ma rig pa las gzhan pa'i nyon mongs pa ni 'du byed rnams kyi rkyen yin du zin kyang gtso bo'i rkyen ma yin no //🔽'du byed rnams kyis bsdus pa'i don rnam par gzhag pa 'dir rnam pa bcur rig par bya ste /
translated: If you say that ignorance is the condition of those afflictions, then why is ignorance not a condition of ignorance?🔽If you say that ignorance is the condition of those

original: rab tu dbye ba rnams par gzhag pa ni ji skad du 'du byed ni gsum ste /
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba rnams par gzhag pa ni ji skad du 'du byed ni gsum ste /
translated: There are three kinds of formations:

original: lus kyi 'du byed dang / ngag gi 'du byed dang / yid kyi 'du byed do zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: lus kyi 'du byed dang / ngag gi 'du byed dang / yid kyi 'du byed do zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: bodily, verbal, and mental.

original: bya ba byed pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa ni /
analyzed: bya ba byed pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa ni /
translated: The characteristic of activity is presented as follows:

original: ji skad du lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las kyi bye brag ni 'dir lus la sogs pa'i 'du byed yin par dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: ji skad du lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las kyi bye brag ni 'dir lus la sogs pa'i 'du byed yin par dgongs pa'o //
translated: The different kinds of bodily, verbal, and mental actions are considered here to be the formations of body, speech, and mind.

original: 'di ji ltar mngon zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ji ltar mngon zhe na /
translated: How is this known?

original: mdo sde dang rigs pa las zhes rgyas par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: mdo sde dang rigs pa las zhes rgyas par bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is taught extensively in the sutras and in the treatises.

original: bye brag rnam par gzhag pa ni bsod nams dang / bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba zhes bya ba'o //🔽'du byed kyi @113a * //🔽mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa ni /
analyzed: bye brag rnam par gzhag pa ni bsod nams dang / bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba zhes bya ba'o // 'du byed kyi @113a * // mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa ni /
translated: The specific classification is into meritorious, nonmeritorious, and unshakable.🔽The characteristic of formation is presented as follows:

original: ji skad du las kyi bye brag dbye ba'i phyir 'du byed smos te /
analyzed: ji skad du las kyi bye brag dbye ba'i phyir 'du byed smos te /
translated: The term formation is used to distinguish different kinds of action.

original: las gang yang srid pa mngon par 'du byed pa de nyid ji ltar shes par 'gyur ba de yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: las gang yang srid pa mngon par 'du byed pa de nyid ji ltar shes par 'gyur ba de yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: That very action which produces the manifest elements of existence is just as it is known.
