original: yang srid mngon par 'du byed pa rnam par gzhag pa ni ji skad du ma btab pa de 'debs pa ste /
analyzed: yang srid mngon par 'du byed pa rnam par gzhag pa ni ji skad du ma btab pa de 'debs pa ste /
translated: The establishment of the production of the manifest elements of existence is as follows: It is the planting of the seed which has not been planted.

original: rnam par shes pa'i rgyud la thog ma nyid du de sa bon gzhag pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rgyud la thog ma nyid du de sa bon gzhag pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Because the seed is planted in the beginning in the stream of consciousness.

original: rjes su 'brel pa rnam par dbye ba rnam par gzhag pa ni /
analyzed: rjes su 'brel pa rnam par dbye ba rnam par gzhag pa ni /
translated: The establishment of the differentiation of the connection is as follows:

original: ji skad du sa bon zhes bya ba 'di ci yin nus pa'i bye brag go //
analyzed: ji skad du sa bon zhes bya ba 'di ci yin nus pa'i bye brag go //
translated: What is this so-called seed? It is a special potency.

original: nus pa zhes bya ba de chos gang zhe na zhes rgyas par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: nus pa zhes bya ba de chos gang zhe na zhes rgyas par bstan pa'o //
translated: What is this so-called potency? It is a dharma.

original: mthar thug par rnam par gzhag pa ni ji skad du sa bon rgyas pa de sems kyi rgyud la yun ji srid gcig tu gnas she na /
analyzed: mthar thug par rnam par gzhag pa ni ji skad du sa bon rgyas pa de sems kyi rgyud la yun ji srid gcig tu gnas she na /
translated: The establishment of the finality is as follows: How long does that seed, which is the expansion, remain in the stream of consciousness?

original: ji srid 'bras bu ma skyes pa'i bar du'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: ji srid 'bras bu ma skyes pa'i bar du'o zhes bstan to //
translated: It remains until the fruit has arisen.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa ni ji skad du de bas na de dag ni las grub pa las gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa ni ji skad du de bas na de dag ni las grub pa las gzung bar bya'o //
translated: The definition of intrinsic identity is stated as follows: Therefore, they are to be apprehended from the establishment of action.

original: de las kyang sems pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid ni las yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de las kyang sems pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid ni las yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: And from that, the intrinsic identity of intention is taught to be action.

original: byed pa rnam par gzhag pa ni de nyid las ji skad du lus skyod par byed pa'i las ni lus kyi las so //
analyzed: byed pa rnam par gzhag pa ni de nyid las ji skad du lus skyod par byed pa'i las ni lus kyi las so //
translated: The definition of activity is stated in the same text: The activity of moving the body is bodily action.

original: dag kun nas slong bar byed pa'i las ni ngag gi las so //
analyzed: dag kun nas slong bar byed pa'i las ni ngag gi las so //
translated: The activity of motivating speech is verbal action.

original: byed pa po yid kyi mngon par 'du byed pa ni yid kyi las so zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: byed pa po yid kyi mngon par 'du byed pa ni yid kyi las so zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: The activity of mental volition is mental action.

original: gtso bo'i rkyen rnam par gzhag pa ste /
analyzed: gtso bo'i rkyen rnam par gzhag pa ste /
translated: The definition of the principal condition is stated as follows:

original: ji skad du /🔽'du byed rnams kyi rkyen nyid du //
analyzed: ji skad du / 'du byed rnams kyi rkyen nyid du //
translated: As it is said:🔽Ignorance is taught to be the condition

original: ma rig bstan pa rnam gnyis te //
analyzed: ma rig bstan pa rnam gnyis te //
translated: of the formative forces in two ways:

original: nyon mongs gzhan ldan spyi yi rkyen //
analyzed: nyon mongs gzhan ldan spyi yi rkyen //
translated: It is the general condition of other defilements,

original: de med pa ni gtso bo'i rkyen //🔽ces bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de med pa ni gtso bo'i rkyen // ces bstan pa'o //
translated: and its absence is the principal condition.

original: 'du byed rnam par dbye ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: 'du byed rnam par dbye ba rdzogs so /
translated: The analysis of the formative forces is completed.

original: // / rnam par shes pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba mdo sde gzhan las ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug la bya bar grags so //
analyzed: // / rnam par shes pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba mdo sde gzhan las ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug la bya bar grags so //
translated: In other sutras, consciousness is known to be the six collections of consciousness.

original: 'dir ni 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa yin par gsungs te de'i phyir gtan la dbab par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir ni 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa yin par gsungs te de'i phyir gtan la dbab par bya ste /
translated: Here, consciousness is said to have formations as its condition. Therefore, it should be determined:

original: ci 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis thams cad yin nam /
analyzed: ci 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis thams cad yin nam /
translated: Is consciousness conditioned by all formations,

original: 'on te 'ga' zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te 'ga' zhig yin zhe na /
translated: or by some?

original: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug ste zhes bya ba 'di bstan to //🔽de ni re zhig rnam par nges pa dang bcas pa rgyas par bshad pa byas na shugs kyis zhes bya ba ni rnam par nges pa'i shugs ni rnam par nges pa'i shugs @113b so ;
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug ste zhes bya ba 'di bstan to // de ni re zhig rnam par nges pa dang bcas pa rgyas par bshad pa byas na shugs kyis zhes bya ba ni rnam par nges pa'i shugs ni rnam par nges pa'i shugs @113b so ;
translated: Therefore, it is taught that it is the six collections of consciousness.🔽If that is explained in detail with determination, then indirectly means that the force of determination is the force of determination.

original: / rnam par nges pa dang bcas pa'i shugs zhes bya ba ni rnam par nges pa dang lhan cig pa'i shugs te /
analyzed: / rnam par nges pa dang bcas pa'i shugs zhes bya ba ni rnam par nges pa dang lhan cig pa'i shugs te /
translated: The force of determination means the force together with determination.

original: de'i don rgyas par bshad par byas na rgyas pa'i shugs kyis phyis dgongs pa'i don gyis de kho na nyid legs par khong du chud par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i don rgyas par bshad par byas na rgyas pa'i shugs kyis phyis dgongs pa'i don gyis de kho na nyid legs par khong du chud par 'gyur te /
translated: If the meaning of that is explained extensively, then by the force of the extensive explanation, later the meaning of the intention will be well understood.

original: shugs kyi tshul gyis kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa yin no //
analyzed: shugs kyi tshul gyis kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa yin no //
translated: The meaning of the intention is that the consciousness of the ground of all is the consciousness that is the condition for formations.

original: gdul bya gnas pa'i bye brag la ltos nas zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe'i gdul bya'i bye brag la ltos nas ni de dag ni 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo the tshom za ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gdul bya gnas pa'i bye brag la ltos nas zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe'i gdul bya'i bye brag la ltos nas ni de dag ni 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo the tshom za ba ma yin gyi /
translated: In dependence on the distinctions of the disciples, means that in dependence on the distinctions of disciples at that time, they are not uncertain about the nature of consciousness that is the condition for formations.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /🔽ci 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa thams cad yin nam /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na / ci 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa thams cad yin nam /
translated: What then?

original: 'on te 'ga' zhig yin the tshom za ba'o //🔽ma 'ongs pa'i gdul bya'i bye brag la ltos nas kyang ngo bo nyid ni gsungs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te 'ga' zhig yin the tshom za ba'o // ma 'ongs pa'i gdul bya'i bye brag la ltos nas kyang ngo bo nyid ni gsungs pa ma yin te /
translated: Are they uncertain about whether all consciousness is the condition for formations or whether some is?

original: ngo bo nyid bstan pa'i skabs su ma bab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid bstan pa'i skabs su ma bab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In dependence on the distinctions of future disciples, the nature of consciousness is not taught because it is not the occasion to teach the nature of consciousness.

original: 'dir dgos pa ni 'di yin no zhes bya bar ji ltar mngon zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir dgos pa ni 'di yin no zhes bya bar ji ltar mngon zhe na /
translated: How do we know that this is the purpose of the sutra?

original: de'i phyir 'di lta ste kha cig tu ni rnam par dbye ba yang mi ston to zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di lta ste kha cig tu ni rnam par dbye ba yang mi ston to zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it says, “In some places, the Buddha did not even teach the classification of consciousnesses.”

original: gang gi phyir mdo sde gzhan las bcom ldan 'das kyis gdul bya gnas pa'i bye brag la stos nas rnam par shes pa gnas pa'i bye brag kyang ma gsungs kyi bstan pa tsam kho na zhig gsungs te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mdo sde gzhan las bcom ldan 'das kyis gdul bya gnas pa'i bye brag la stos nas rnam par shes pa gnas pa'i bye brag kyang ma gsungs kyi bstan pa tsam kho na zhig gsungs te /
translated: Because in other sutras, the Buddha did not teach the classification of the abodes of consciousness in terms of the specific natures of the disciples, but only taught the classification of the abodes of consciousness in general terms.🔽For example, in the Sutra of the Questions of Revata, the Buddha said:

original: dper na dge slong khyed la rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i chos rnams bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: dper na dge slong khyed la rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i chos rnams bshad par bya ste /
translated: “Monks, I will teach you dependent origination and the dharmas that arise in dependence.

original: nyon la legs par rab tu yid la zung shig dang bshad do //
analyzed: nyon la legs par rab tu yid la zung shig dang bshad do //
translated: Listen well and keep it in mind, and I will explain it to you.”

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is dependent origination?

original: 'di lta ste 'di yod na 'di 'byung 'di skyes pas 'di skye ba'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste 'di yod na 'di 'byung 'di skyes pas 'di skye ba'o //
translated: If this exists, that comes to be; from the arising of this, that arises.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
translated: What are the dharmas that arise in dependence?

original: 'di lta ste ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed ces rgyas par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed ces rgyas par 'byung ba'o //
translated: It is as follows: “Conditioned by ignorance, there are the karmic predispositions.

original: de bzhin du dge slong dag byed la chos rnams kyi 'du ba dang bral ba yang bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dge slong dag byed la chos rnams kyi 'du ba dang bral ba yang bshad par bya'o //
translated: ” In the same way, “Monks, I will teach you the combination and separation of things.

original: chos rnams kyi 'du ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi 'du ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the combination of things?

original: 'di lta ste 'di yod na 'di 'byung zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin te de la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste 'di yod na 'di 'byung zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin te de la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is as follows: ‘If this exists, that comes to be,’ as before, and so on.🔽” The word “collection” also indicates the classification of engagement with objects.

original: tshogs kyi sgras ni dmigs pa la 'jug pa'i dbye ba yang bstan pa yin te zhes rgyas par 'byung ba la rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug ces bya ba'i tshogs kyi sgras 'dis gzugs la sogs pa'i dmigs pa la mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa🔽de dag gi 'jug pa'i dbye ba yang @114a * //
analyzed: tshogs kyi sgras ni dmigs pa la 'jug pa'i dbye ba yang bstan pa yin te zhes rgyas par 'byung ba la rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug ces bya ba'i tshogs kyi sgras 'dis gzugs la sogs pa'i dmigs pa la mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa de dag gi 'jug pa'i dbye ba yang @114a * //
translated: The six collections of consciousness are called “collections” because they engage with objects such as form.

original: bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bstan pa yin no //
translated: The word “collection” also indicates the classification of their engagement.

original: ji ltar byas nas she na /
analyzed: ji ltar byas nas she na /
translated: How is this?

original: tshogs kyi sgras ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa re re yang rnam pa mang bar bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: tshogs kyi sgras ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa re re yang rnam pa mang bar bstan pa yin te /
translated: The word “collection” indicates that each of the six collections of consciousness, such as visual consciousness, has many aspects.

original: de la sngon po la sogs pa'i dmigs pa tha dad pa'i phyir tshogs kyi sgras mig gi rnam par shes pa rnam pa mang bar bstan to //
analyzed: de la sngon po la sogs pa'i dmigs pa tha dad pa'i phyir tshogs kyi sgras mig gi rnam par shes pa rnam pa mang bar bstan to //
translated: Since the objective supports such as blue are different, the word collection indicates the many aspects of eye consciousness.

original: de la sngon po la sogs pa'i dmigs pa tha dad pa'i phyir mig gi rnam par shes pa rnam pa mang ba de bzhin du chos tha dad pa'i phyir yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: de la sngon po la sogs pa'i dmigs pa tha dad pa'i phyir mig gi rnam par shes pa rnam pa mang ba de bzhin du chos tha dad pa'i phyir yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du'o //
translated: Just as eye consciousness has many aspects because the objective supports such as blue are different, so too, up to mental consciousness has many aspects because the objective supports such as form are different.

original: de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te /
translated: If that were not so,

original: gal te tshogs kyi sgras dmigs pa la 'jug pa'i dbye ba mi ston na ni /
analyzed: gal te tshogs kyi sgras dmigs pa la 'jug pa'i dbye ba mi ston na ni /
translated: if the word collection did not indicate the differentiation of engagement with the objective supports,

original: rnam par shes pa drug ces de tsam zhig gsungs par 'gyur te /🔽tshogs kyi sgra dgos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa drug ces de tsam zhig gsungs par 'gyur te / tshogs kyi sgra dgos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then it would be stated that there are just six consciousnesses,🔽because the word collection would be purposeless.🔽Because the meaning of the word collection is already fulfilled,

original: tshogs kyi sgra'i don byas zin pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba ni tshogs kyi sgra kho nas dmigs pa la 'jug pa'i dbye ba bstan zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshogs kyi sgra'i don byas zin pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba ni tshogs kyi sgra kho nas dmigs pa la 'jug pa'i dbye ba bstan zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the differentiation of engagement with the objective supports is already indicated by the word collection alone.

original: rnam par shes pa las gzhan tshogs zhes bya ba med par bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug bstan nas mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa 'chad par byed pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa las gzhan tshogs🔽med pa yin no zhes bya ba gang yin pa de ston pa yin no /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa las gzhan tshogs zhes bya ba med par bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug bstan nas mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa 'chad par byed pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa las gzhan tshogs med pa yin no zhes bya ba gang yin pa de ston pa yin no /
translated: The phrase in order to demonstrate that there is no collection apart from consciousness means that the six collections of consciousness are taught in order to demonstrate that there is no collection apart from the six collections of consciousness.

original: de lta ma yin na rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug 'chad par byed pa kho na yin par gzung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug 'chad par byed pa kho na yin par gzung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were otherwise, the text would be understood to state that the six collections of consciousness are taught in order to demonstrate that there is no collection apart from the six collections of consciousness.🔽The phrase the eye consciousness, etc. refers to the explanation of the eye consciousness, etc.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is the eye consciousness?

original: mig la brten cing gzugs so so rnam par rig pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: mig la brten cing gzugs so so rnam par rig pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The eye consciousness is the individual perception of form that is based on the eye.

original: de bzhin du yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du ci rigs par brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni rna ba la brten cing sgra so so rnam par rig pa ni rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du ci rigs par brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni rna ba la brten cing sgra so so rnam par rig pa ni rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The same should be said, in the appropriate manner, of the other consciousnesses up to the mind consciousness. The ear consciousness is the individual perception of sound that is based on the ear.

original: sna la brten cing dri so so rnam par rig pa ni sna'i rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: sna la brten cing dri so so rnam par rig pa ni sna'i rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The consciousness that arises in dependence on the nose and that is aware of the various smells is olfactory consciousness.

original: lce la brten cing ro so so rnam par rig pa ni lce'i rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: lce la brten cing ro so so rnam par rig pa ni lce'i rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The consciousness that arises in dependence on the tongue and that is aware of the various tastes is gustatory consciousness.

original: lus la brten cing reg bya so so rnam par rig pa ni lus kyi rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: lus la brten cing reg bya so so rnam par rig pa ni lus kyi rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The consciousness that arises in dependence on the body and that is aware of the various tangible objects is tactile consciousness.

original: yid la brten cing chos so so rnam par rig pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'o zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: yid la brten cing chos so so rnam par rig pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'o zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The consciousness that arises in dependence on the mind and that is aware of the various entities is mental consciousness.🔽The eye is its support, and therefore it is said that consciousness is supported by the eye and is aware of visible form.

original: mig ni 'di'i rten yin pas 'di ni mig la brten cing gzugs so so rnam par rig pa'o //🔽thun mong dang thun mong ma @114b yin pa'i rgyu nyid gyis gtso bo'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rten ston pa'o //
analyzed: mig ni 'di'i rten yin pas 'di ni mig la brten cing gzugs so so rnam par rig pa'o // thun mong dang thun mong ma @114b yin pa'i rgyu nyid gyis gtso bo'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rten ston pa'o //
translated: The eye is the dominant condition for the arising of visual consciousness.🔽The eye is the dominant condition for the arising of visual consciousness because it is the cause of that consciousness in two ways: as a cause that is the same entity and as a cause that is a different entity.🔽The eye is a cause that is the same entity because the eye is the material substance that constitutes visual consciousness.🔽The eye is a cause that is a different entity because it is the support for visual consciousness.🔽The eye is a cause that is the same entity because visual consciousness is a transformation of the eye.🔽The eye is a cause that is a different entity because it is the support for visual consciousness.🔽The eye is a cause that is the same entity because visual consciousness is a transformation of the eye.🔽The eye is a cause that is a different entity because it is the support for visual consciousness.🔽The eye is a cause that is the same entity because visual consciousness is a transformation of the eye.🔽The eye is a cause that is a different entity because it is the support for visual consciousness.🔽The eye is a cause that is the same entity because visual consciousness is a transformation of the eye.🔽The eye is a cause that is a different entity because it is the support for visual consciousness.🔽The eye is a cause that is the same entity because visual consciousness is a transformation of the eye.🔽The eye is a cause that is a different entity because it is the support for visual consciousness.🔽The eye is a cause that is the same entity because visual consciousness is a transformation of the eye.🔽The eye is a cause that is a different entity because it is the support for visual consciousness.🔽The eye is a cause that is the same entity because visual consciousness is a transformation of the eye.

original: gzugs kyi gzugs brnyan lta bu'i mig gi rnam par shes pa ni gzugs snang ba'i don gyis gzugs so so rnam par rig pa'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: gzugs kyi gzugs brnyan lta bu'i mig gi rnam par shes pa ni gzugs snang ba'i don gyis gzugs so so rnam par rig pa'o zhes bstan to //
translated: The eye is a cause that is a different entity because it is the support for visual consciousness.🔽The eye is a cause that is the same

original: so so rnam par rig pa mig gi rnam par shes pa yin no zhes smras na ni rnam par shes pa thams cad kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid smras par 'gyur gyi bye brag gi mtshan nyid ni ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: so so rnam par rig pa mig gi rnam par shes pa yin no zhes smras na ni rnam par shes pa thams cad kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid smras par 'gyur gyi bye brag gi mtshan nyid ni ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If you say that the individual perception is the eye consciousness, you would be stating the general characteristic of all consciousnesses, but not their specific characteristic.

original: gzugs so so rnam par rig pa yin no zhes smras na ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang mig gi rnam par shes pa yin par rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzugs so so rnam par rig pa yin no zhes smras na ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang mig gi rnam par shes pa yin par rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: If you say that the individual perception is form, you would be implying that mental consciousness is eye consciousness.

original: de yang gzugs so so rnam par rig pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang gzugs so so rnam par rig pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that also has the specific characteristic of the individual perception of form.

original: de bas na mig la brten cing zhes bya bas khyad par du byas so //
analyzed: de bas na mig la brten cing zhes bya bas khyad par du byas so //
translated: Therefore, the phrase “based on the eye” is used to specify.

original: tshor ba la sogs pa yang mig la brten pa de bas na so so rnam par rig pa zhes smras so //
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa yang mig la brten pa de bas na so so rnam par rig pa zhes smras so //
translated: Since feeling and so on are also based on the eye, the phrase “individual perception” is used.

original: de dag kyang bye brag snang ba yin pa'i phyir gzugs kyi bye brag dga' ba dang yongs su gdung ba la sogs pa'i rnam par snang ba yin pas gzugs smos so //
analyzed: de dag kyang bye brag snang ba yin pa'i phyir gzugs kyi bye brag dga' ba dang yongs su gdung ba la sogs pa'i rnam par snang ba yin pas gzugs smos so //
translated: Since they also appear as specific forms, such as the appearance of pleasure and pain, they are called form.

original: de lta ma yin na ci zhig rnam par rig pa nges par mi zin to //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ci zhig rnam par rig pa nges par mi zin to //
translated: If it were not so, what would be ascertained by the consciousness?

original: de bzhin du lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du thams cad brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du thams cad brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said of all the other consciousnesses up to the body consciousness.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni yid la brten cing chos so so rnam par rig pa'o zhes bya ba la rten gyi don ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni yid la brten cing chos so so rnam par rig pa'o zhes bya ba la rten gyi don ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The mental consciousness is the awareness of each mental object, having the mental faculty as its basis. The meaning of basis is as before.

original: so so rnam par rig pa'i don ni mdor na mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa gzhan yang yid la brten pa yin yang yid 'ba' zhig la brten pa ma yin no //
analyzed: so so rnam par rig pa'i don ni mdor na mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa gzhan yang yid la brten pa yin yang yid 'ba' zhig la brten pa ma yin no //
translated: The meaning of awareness of each is this: in brief, the other consciousnesses, such as the visual consciousness, are also based on the mental faculty, but they are not based exclusively on the mental faculty.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni yid 'ba' zhig la brten pa yin pas de bas na rten gyis kyang mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa la bye brag yod pa yin no //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni yid 'ba' zhig la brten pa yin pas de bas na rten gyis kyang mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa la bye brag yod pa yin no //
translated: The mental consciousness is based exclusively on the mental faculty. Therefore, there is a distinction among the consciousnesses, such as the visual consciousness, on the basis of their support.

original: dmigs pa yang bye brag yod de chos so so rnam par rig pa zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa yang bye brag yod de chos so so rnam par rig pa zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is also a distinction in their objects, because it is said that they are the awareness of each object.

original: gzhan yang chos so so rnam par rig pa smos pa med pa na ni tshor ba la sogs pa la yang thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang chos so so rnam par rig pa smos pa med pa na ni tshor ba la sogs pa la yang thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, if the term for each individual phenomenon were not mentioned, it would follow that it would also apply to feeling and so on.

original: de dag kyang yid la brten pas so //
analyzed: de dag kyang yid la brten pas so //
translated: Moreover, if the term “discernment of the object” were not mentioned, then feeling, etc., would also be mental factors, because they are supported by the mind.

original: yid la brten pa zhes ma smos na ni rten ci yin pa nges par mi zin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yid la brten pa zhes ma smos na ni rten ci yin pa nges par mi zin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the term “supported by the mind” were not mentioned, then it would be uncertain what is supported.

original: mig la sogs pa ni gcig kho nar sems can gyi grangs su gtogs pa'i phyir ci zhe na /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa ni gcig kho nar sems can gyi grangs su gtogs pa'i phyir ci zhe na /
translated: Why is it that the eye, etc., are not called “discernment”?🔽Because they are counted as sentient beings, and because the consciousnesses of form, etc., are not called “discernment.”

original: gzugs kyi rnam par shes pa nas chos kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du mi brjod do //🔽sems @115a * //
analyzed: gzugs kyi rnam par shes pa nas chos kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du mi brjod do // sems @115a * //
translated: The consciousnesses of form, sound, etc., are not called “discernment,”🔽because they are counted as sentient beings.

original: can gyi grangs su gtogs pa ni dbang byed pa'i dngos po ston pa'i phyir de dag gang yin pa dang dbang byed pa dang 'brel ba'i mtshan nyid kyi drug pa yin par brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: can gyi grangs su gtogs pa ni dbang byed pa'i dngos po ston pa'i phyir de dag gang yin pa dang dbang byed pa dang 'brel ba'i mtshan nyid kyi drug pa yin par brtag par bya'o //
translated: The six sense faculties should be considered as the support of the mind, because they are the cause of the mind’s control.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul ni sems can gyi grangs su gtogs pa dang / sems can gyi grangs su ma gtogs pa yang yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul ni sems can gyi grangs su gtogs pa dang / sems can gyi grangs su ma gtogs pa yang yin no //
translated: The objects of form, etc., are counted as sentient beings and not counted as sentient beings.

original: thun mong dang thun mong ma yin pa'i rgyu nyid kyi gtso bo'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ci zhe na /
analyzed: thun mong dang thun mong ma yin pa'i rgyu nyid kyi gtso bo'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ci zhe na /
translated: because it is the principal cause, being the cause of the common and uncommon.

original: mig la sogs pa ni gcig kho nar sems can gyi grangs su gtogs pa'i phyir gzugs kyi rnam par shes pa zhes ma bstan to //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa ni gcig kho nar sems can gyi grangs su gtogs pa'i phyir gzugs kyi rnam par shes pa zhes ma bstan to //
translated: The eye, etc. are not mentioned as the consciousness of form, etc. because they are counted as sentient beings only as individuals.

original: chos kyi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i bar du ma bstan to //
analyzed: chos kyi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i bar du ma bstan to //
translated: up to the consciousness of dharmas is not mentioned.

original: gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'i yul rnams ni thun mong gi rgyu kho na yin no //
analyzed: gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'i yul rnams ni thun mong gi rgyu kho na yin no //
translated: The objects such as form, sound, etc. are only the common cause.

original: gtso bo'i rgyus kyang 'bras bu ston par byed de /
analyzed: gtso bo'i rgyus kyang 'bras bu ston par byed de /
translated: The principal cause is also mentioned as the result.

original: dper na rnga'i sgra lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na rnga'i sgra lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the sound of a drum.

original: thun mong gi rgyu nyid ni mig ni gzugs sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa thams cad kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thun mong gi rgyu nyid ni mig ni gzugs sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa thams cad kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The common cause is the eye, because it is the cause of all consciousnesses of form, etc.

original: rigs tha dad pa med pa'i dbang du byas nas de skad bstan te rnam par shes pa so so'i ni mig gi dbang po'i skad cig ma gzhan dang gzhan yin no //
analyzed: rigs tha dad pa med pa'i dbang du byas nas de skad bstan te rnam par shes pa so so'i ni mig gi dbang po'i skad cig ma gzhan dang gzhan yin no //
translated: This is taught from the point of view of the absence of different types. The moments of the eye faculty are different for each consciousness.

original: gzugs la ni gnyi ga yod de 'di lta ste rnam pa tha dad pa dang skad cig ma tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la ni gnyi ga yod de 'di lta ste rnam pa tha dad pa dang skad cig ma tha dad pa'o //
translated: But in the case of form, both are present, that is, different aspects and different moments.

original: 'dir ni skad cig ma gzhan tha dad pa'i dbang du byas te bstan pa ma yin no /🔽// / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang po dang rnam par dbye ba bstan pa rgya cher 'grel pa /
analyzed: 'dir ni skad cig ma gzhan tha dad pa'i dbang du byas te bstan pa ma yin no / // / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang po dang rnam par dbye ba bstan pa rgya cher 'grel pa /
translated: Here, it is not taught from the point of view of different moments.

original: bam po lnga pa /
analyzed: bam po lnga pa /
translated: Commentary on the Transmission of the Doctrine

original: thun mong gi rgyu zhes bya ba ni mig ni sngon po la sogs pa'i gzugs kyi rnam par shes pa thams cad kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ji lta bu zhe na rnam pa tha dad pa'i dbang du byas pa yin no //
analyzed: thun mong gi rgyu zhes bya ba ni mig ni sngon po la sogs pa'i gzugs kyi rnam par shes pa thams cad kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ji lta bu zhe na rnam pa tha dad pa'i dbang du byas pa yin no //
translated: The so-called common cause is because the eye is the cause of all consciousnesses of form such as blue, etc. What is this like? It is from the point of view of different aspects.

original: gzugs la ni rnam pa tha dad pa yod du zin kyang rnam par shes pa rnam pa tha dad pa'i rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs la ni rnam pa tha dad pa yod du zin kyang rnam par shes pa rnam pa tha dad pa'i rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though there are different aspects of form, they are not the cause of different consciousnesses.🔽The uncommon cause is the cause of the consciousness of a single continuum.

original: thun mong ma yin pa'i rgyu ni rgyud gcig pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gzugs ni rgyud tha dad pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir thun mong gi rgyu yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa'i rgyu ni rgyud gcig pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gzugs ni rgyud tha dad pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir thun mong gi rgyu yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: Form is a common cause because it is the cause of the consciousness of different continua.🔽The same should be said up to the mental faculty.

original: de bzhin du yid kyi bar du ci rigs par brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin du yid kyi bar du ci rigs par brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: rna ba ni thun mong gi rgyu ste /
analyzed: rna ba ni thun mong gi rgyu ste /
translated: The ear is a common cause

original: sgra thams cad kyi rnam par shes pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra thams cad kyi rnam par shes pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the cause of the consciousness of all sounds.

original: thun mong ma yin pa'i rgyu ni rgyud gcig pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa'i rgyu ni rgyud gcig pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The uncommon cause is the cause of the consciousness of a single continuum.

original: de bzhin @115b du sna la sogs pa la yang de bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin @115b du sna la sogs pa la yang de bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: The same should be applied to the nose and so on.

original: dbang po dang don nges pas rnam par shes pa nges pa zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni mig la sogs pa dbang po rnams dang / gzugs la sogs pa don rnams yul dang yul can gnyis su nges pa ni ma nges par ji ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dbang po dang don nges pas rnam par shes pa nges pa zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni mig la sogs pa dbang po rnams dang / gzugs la sogs pa don rnams yul dang yul can gnyis su nges pa ni ma nges par ji ltar 'gyur te /
translated: How could the determination of the sense faculty and object as the two, object and subject, be indeterminate?

original: mig gi dbang po'i don yul gang yin pa de nyid gzugs yin no //
analyzed: mig gi dbang po'i don yul gang yin pa de nyid gzugs yin no //
translated: The object of the eye sense faculty is just form.

original: lus can ni mig gi dbang po yin no //
analyzed: lus can ni mig gi dbang po yin no //
translated: The possessor of the body is the eye sense faculty.

original: de bzhin du lus kyi dbang po'i don yul gang yin pa de nyid reg bya yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du lus kyi dbang po'i don yul gang yin pa de nyid reg bya yin no //
translated: Similarly, the object of the body sense faculty is just tactile objects.

original: yul can ni lus kyi dbang po yin no //
analyzed: yul can ni lus kyi dbang po yin no //
translated: The possessor of the object is the body sense faculty.

original: drug pa yid rnam par shes pa drug gi mtshan nyid dang / chos dang gnyis yul dang yul can du nges pa ni rnam pa gzhan yin no //
analyzed: drug pa yid rnam par shes pa drug gi mtshan nyid dang / chos dang gnyis yul dang yul can du nges pa ni rnam pa gzhan yin no //
translated: The sixth, the mental consciousness, has two objects, phenomena and the mental faculty, and is determined as the subject.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gal te re zhig mig la sogs pa bzhin du nges par byed na ni yid gang yin pa'i yul de nyid ni chos kyi skye mched dang chos su ma gtogs pa yang yin pas de lta yin na chos kyi skye mched rdzas bdun po 'di yin no zhes🔽bya ba 'grub par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te re zhig mig la sogs pa bzhin du nges par byed na ni yid gang yin pa'i yul de nyid ni chos kyi skye mched dang chos su ma gtogs pa yang yin pas de lta yin na chos kyi skye mched rdzas bdun po 'di yin no zhes bya ba 'grub par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If that were so, then it would not be established that the seven substances are the sense base of mental objects.

original: mig la sogs pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa thams cad yid kyi yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa thams cad yid kyi yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the eye faculty, etc., and form, etc., are all objects of the mental faculty.

original: 'on te yid kho na'i yul gang yin pa yin gyi mig la sogs pa'i ma yin na ni de lta na yang gzugs la sogs pa lnga ni bsal ba yin na mig la sogs pa lnga dang / rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug dang / tshor ba la sogs pa bdun yang de'i yul nyid yin pa'i phyir chos kyi skye mched yin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te yid kho na'i yul gang yin pa yin gyi mig la sogs pa'i ma yin na ni de lta na yang gzugs la sogs pa lnga ni bsal ba yin na mig la sogs pa lnga dang / rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug dang / tshor ba la sogs pa bdun yang de'i yul nyid yin pa'i phyir chos kyi skye mched yin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But if the object of the mental faculty alone is the sense base of mental objects, not the object of the eye faculty, etc., then the five sense objects such as form, the six collections of consciousness, and the seven such as feeling would be the sense base of mental objects because they are objects of the mental faculty.

original: de bas na nges pa rnam pa gnyis byas te /
analyzed: de bas na nges pa rnam pa gnyis byas te /
translated: Therefore, the sense base of mental objects is determined in two ways.

original: yid kho na'i yul gang yin pa yin gyi mig la sogs pa'i ni ma yin no zhes bya bas gzugs la sogs pa bsal bar gyur ba dang / yul kho na yin gyi rten byed pa ni ma yin no zhes bya bas mig la sogs pa dang rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug bsal bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: yid kho na'i yul gang yin pa yin gyi mig la sogs pa'i ni ma yin no zhes bya bas gzugs la sogs pa bsal bar gyur ba dang / yul kho na yin gyi rten byed pa ni ma yin no zhes bya bas mig la sogs pa dang rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug bsal bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: The phrase “that which is the object of the mental faculty alone” excludes form, etc., because they are objects of the eye faculty, etc., and the phrase “that which is an object alone” excludes the eye faculty, etc., and the six collections of consciousness, because they are supports.

original: de ltar byas na chos kyi skye mched rdzas bdun ni chos kyi sgras bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar byas na chos kyi skye mched rdzas bdun ni chos kyi sgras bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba grub pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the seven substances of the phenomena element are established as being indicated by the term phenomena.

original: de ltar na dbang po dang don nges pas rnam par shes pa rnam pa drug skye ba nges pa rab tu bsten pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de ltar na dbang po dang don nges pas rnam par shes pa rnam pa drug skye ba nges pa rab tu bsten pa'i phyir te /
translated: Thus, the six collections of consciousness arise in dependence on the definite number of faculties and objects.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: mig dang gzugs ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rkyen yin pa nas yid dang chos ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i yin pas /
analyzed: mig dang gzugs ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rkyen yin pa nas yid dang chos ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i yin pas /
translated: The eye and form are the conditions for the eye consciousness, and so on up to the mental faculty and phenomena are the conditions for the mental consciousness.

original: gnyis la brten nas rnam par shes pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gnyis la brten nas rnam par shes pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus, it is said, “Consciousness arises in dependence on two.”

original: de lta bu'i don de dag nyid ces bya ba dbang po dang don nges @116a * //
analyzed: de lta bu'i don de dag nyid ces bya ba dbang po dang don nges @116a * //
translated: The meaning of the above is as follows: The two sets of five faculties and objects are as just explained.

original: pa bstan ma thag pa gang yin pa rnams tshigs su bcad de gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: pa bstan ma thag pa gang yin pa rnams tshigs su bcad de gsungs pa ni /
translated: The following verse is stated in summary:

original: lnga po gnyis ni dbang po rnams //
analyzed: lnga po gnyis ni dbang po rnams //
translated: The two sets of five are the faculties.

original: zhes rgyas par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: zhes rgyas par 'byung ba'o //
translated: The rest are their objects.

original: lnga po gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga po gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two sets of five?

original: dbang po rnams gang gi don gang yin pa de'i don de dag nyid yin gyi gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: dbang po rnams gang gi don gang yin pa de'i don de dag nyid yin gyi gzhan ma yin te /
translated: The faculties are the five faculties and the objects are the five objects. The faculties are the five faculties and the objects are the five objects.

original: dper na mig gi dbang po'i don gzugs kho na yin pa nas lus kyi dbang po'i ni reg bya yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: dper na mig gi dbang po'i don gzugs kho na yin pa nas lus kyi dbang po'i ni reg bya yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: For example, the object of the eye faculty is form alone, up to the object of the body faculty is tactile objects alone.

original: mig dang gzugs nas lus dang reg bya'i bar de dag ni lnga po gnyis kho na yin no //
analyzed: mig dang gzugs nas lus dang reg bya'i bar de dag ni lnga po gnyis kho na yin no //
translated: The five faculties from eye and form up to body and tactile objects are the two sets of five.

original: mig dang gzugs nas lus dang reg bya'i bar lnga po de dag ni skye mched du ni bcu yin no //
analyzed: mig dang gzugs nas lus dang reg bya'i bar lnga po de dag ni skye mched du ni bcu yin no //
translated: The five from eye and form up to body and tactile objects are the ten bases.

original: yid gang yin pa de nyid kyi don yin gyi gzhan gyi ma yin pa dang / don gang yin pa de nyid yin gyi rten ni ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: yid gang yin pa de nyid kyi don yin gyi gzhan gyi ma yin pa dang / don gang yin pa de nyid yin gyi rten ni ma yin pa ste /
translated: That very object is the object, not the support.

original: de ltar na drug pa'i skye mched gnyis ni yid kyi skye mched dang / chos kyi skye mched do //
analyzed: de ltar na drug pa'i skye mched gnyis ni yid kyi skye mched dang / chos kyi skye mched do //
translated: Thus the two bases of the sixth are the mental faculty and the entity base.

original: de ltar na re zhig mdo sde gzhan las /
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig mdo sde gzhan las /
translated: Thus, in other sūtras,

original: gnyis la brten nas rnam par shes pa 'byung ngo zhes gsungs pa'i dgongs pa rgyas par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyis la brten nas rnam par shes pa 'byung ngo zhes gsungs pa'i dgongs pa rgyas par bstan pa yin no //
translated: the intention of the statement “Consciousness arises in dependence on two” is explained in detail.🔽Again, in another sūtra, it says:

original: yang gzhan las 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bus tshe dang ldan pa gang gi phyir zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: yang gzhan las 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bus tshe dang ldan pa gang gi phyir zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, because of the eye and form, eye consciousness arises.🔽If attention that generates that exists, eye consciousness that arises from that will arise.

original: de skyed pa yid la byed pa nye bar gnas na de las skyes pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pas yid la byed pa yang rkyen yin par gsungs so ;
analyzed: de skyed pa yid la byed pa nye bar gnas na de las skyes pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pas yid la byed pa yang rkyen yin par gsungs so ;
translated: Thus attention is stated to be a condition.

original: / zhes bya ba 'di'i dgongs pa ston pa ni /
analyzed: / zhes bya ba 'di'i dgongs pa ston pa ni /
translated: The intention of this statement is taught in the line:

original: yid la byed pa ni rigs mi dbye bar thams cad kyi spyi'i rkyen yin te zhes rgyas par smos /
analyzed: yid la byed pa ni rigs mi dbye bar thams cad kyi spyi'i rkyen yin te zhes rgyas par smos /
translated: Mental attention is a condition for all of them, without distinction.

original: rigs dbye ba med pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: rigs dbye ba med pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is it that mental attention is not distinguished?

original: dper na mig la sogs pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ba'i rkyen ni /
analyzed: dper na mig la sogs pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ba'i rkyen ni /
translated: For example, the eye and so on and form and so on are the conditions for the arising of eye consciousness,

original: rigs tha dad pa'i dngos po yin gyi /
analyzed: rigs tha dad pa'i dngos po yin gyi /
translated: because they are different types of entities.

original: de ltar yid la byed pa'i ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar yid la byed pa'i ni ma yin te /
translated: But this is not so for mental attention.

original: yid la byed pa'i rigs ni tha dad pa med pa yin pas rigs tha dad pa med pa'i dbang du byas pa yin gyi /
analyzed: yid la byed pa'i rigs ni tha dad pa med pa yin pas rigs tha dad pa med pa'i dbang du byas pa yin gyi /
translated: The type of mental attention is not different, so it is considered to be without distinction of type.

original: skad cig ma so so ni tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: skad cig ma so so ni tha dad pa yin no //
translated: But each moment is different.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gang yin pa de ni rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'i ma yin no //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gang yin pa de ni rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'i ma yin no //
translated: What is a condition for eye consciousness is not a condition for ear consciousness.

original: gang yang mig gi rnam par shes pa chung ngu'i gang yin pa de ni shin tu chen po ma yin no //
analyzed: gang yang mig gi rnam par shes pa chung ngu'i gang yin pa de ni shin tu chen po ma yin no //
translated: What is a condition for a small eye consciousness is not a condition for a large eye consciousness.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rigs mi dbye bar zhes smras te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rigs mi dbye bar zhes smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that mental attention is not distinguished.

original: ci zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa thams cad kyi spyi'i rkyen ni yid la byed pa yin no //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa thams cad kyi spyi'i rkyen ni yid la byed pa yin no //
translated: The mental attention is the general condition of all consciousnesses, such as visual consciousness.

original: de bskyed pa zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i tshig tshul gyis de skyed par byed pa ni de skyed pa'o //
analyzed: de bskyed pa zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i tshig tshul gyis de skyed par byed pa ni de skyed pa'o //
translated: The term “arisen from that” is a derivation of the term in the sense of “that which produces it is arisen from that.”

original: @116b de ni phyis yid la gcags pa skyed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni yid la gcags pa skyed par byed pa yin zhes bya bar mngon no //
analyzed: @116b de ni phyis yid la gcags pa skyed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni yid la gcags pa skyed par byed pa yin zhes bya bar mngon no //
translated: The phrase “it will later produce regret” indicates that it is the producer of regret.

original: yang na de'i ched du skyes pa yin zhes bya bar mngon te /🔽rnam par shes pa'i don du'am /
analyzed: yang na de'i ched du skyes pa yin zhes bya bar mngon te / rnam par shes pa'i don du'am /
translated: Or, it indicates that it is born for the sake of that.🔽For the sake of consciousness,

original: rnam par shes pa'i rgyu mtshan du zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rgyu mtshan du zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: or for the sake of the sign of consciousness. This is the meaning of the term.

original: dper na pags pa'i phyir ni gzig bsad do zhes rgyas par 'byung ba la pags pa'i ched dang pags pa'i rgyu mtshan dang pags pa'i don du zhes bya ba dang / ba so'i phyir ni ba so'i rgyu mtshan zhes bya ba dang / rnga ma'i phyir zhes bya ba rnga ma'i rgyu mtshan dang zhes bya ba dang /
analyzed: dper na pags pa'i phyir ni gzig bsad do zhes rgyas par 'byung ba la pags pa'i ched dang pags pa'i rgyu mtshan dang pags pa'i don du zhes bya ba dang / ba so'i phyir ni ba so'i rgyu mtshan zhes bya ba dang / rnga ma'i phyir zhes bya ba rnga ma'i rgyu mtshan dang zhes bya ba dang /
translated: For example, in the statement, “For the sake of skin, a deer is killed,” it is said, “for the sake of skin,” “on account of skin,” “for the sake of skin,” “for the sake of ivory,” “on account of ivory,” “for the sake of tail,” “on account of tail,”

original: bud med kyi phyir zhes bya ba bud med kyi rgyu mtshan zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: bud med kyi phyir zhes bya ba bud med kyi rgyu mtshan zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: “for the sake of a woman,” “on account of a woman.”

original: rgyu mtshan gyi bdun pa yin zhes bya bar mngon pa de bzhin no //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan gyi bdun pa yin zhes bya bar mngon pa de bzhin no //
translated: The suffix -tva is added to the root of the word for “reason” to form the word “on account of.”

original: de las gzhan pa gnyis tshogs pa yod du zin kyang zhes bya ba ni yid la byed pa de las gzhan pa dbang po dang don gnyis tshogs pa yod du zin kyang zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa gnyis tshogs pa yod du zin kyang zhes bya ba ni yid la byed pa de las gzhan pa dbang po dang don gnyis tshogs pa yod du zin kyang zhes bya'o //
translated: The phrase “even though the other two are present” means that even though the other two, the sense faculty and object, are present, mental attention is not.

original: de dang mi mthun pa'i yid la byed pa kun du 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dbang po dang don gnyis kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa 'byung ba dang mi mthun pa'i yid la byed pa kun du 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha
analyzed: de dang mi mthun pa'i yid la byed pa kun du 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dbang po dang don gnyis kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa 'byung ba dang mi mthun pa'i yid la byed pa kun du 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha
translated: This is the explanation: because attention incompatible with the arising of consciousness through the conditions of both the sense faculty and the object arises.

original: tshig go // phyis yang 'byung ste /
analyzed: tshig go // phyis yang 'byung ste /
translated: It arises again later.🔽Because one is separated from that.

original: de dang bral ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de dang mi mthun pa'i yid la byed pa dang bral ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de dang bral ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de dang mi mthun pa'i yid la byed pa dang bral ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the explanation: because one is separated from attention incompatible with that.

original: yang mdo sde gzhan las ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes gsungs pa'i dgongs pa ni /
analyzed: yang mdo sde gzhan las ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes gsungs pa'i dgongs pa ni /
translated: The intention in the statement in another sutra that consciousness has name-and-form as a condition is as follows:

original: dbang po dang don dang yid la byed pa de dag nyid bsdus pa'i ming gzugs kyi rkyen gyis zhes rgyas par 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: dbang po dang don dang yid la byed pa de dag nyid bsdus pa'i ming gzugs kyi rkyen gyis zhes rgyas par 'byung ba yin no //
translated: The intention is that consciousness has the condition of name-and-form that subsumes just those sense faculties, objects, and attention.

original: bsdus pa'i zhes bya ba ni mdor bsdus na zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: bsdus pa'i zhes bya ba ni mdor bsdus na zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Subsumes means subsumes in brief.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: gang yid dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / chos rnams ni ming yin no //
analyzed: gang yid dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / chos rnams ni ming yin no //
translated: That which is associated with the mental faculty is the dharmas.

original: dbang po lnga gang yin pa dang // de'i don lnga po de ni gzugs yin no //
analyzed: dbang po lnga gang yin pa dang // de'i don lnga po de ni gzugs yin no //
translated: The five faculties are the five sense objects.

original: de ltar na ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de ltar na ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus, it is said that consciousness has name-and-form as its condition.

original: yang srid pa 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir nus pa skye bar bya ba'i ched du 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: yang srid pa 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir nus pa skye bar bya ba'i ched du 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes gsungs te /
translated: In order to generate the potency for the arising of a new existence, it is said that consciousness has formations as its condition.

original: dbang po dang don dang yid la byed pa de dag nyid kyi rkyen gyis zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni mdo sde 'di'i dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: dbang po dang don dang yid la byed pa de dag nyid kyi rkyen gyis zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni mdo sde 'di'i dgongs pa yin no //
translated: The intention of this sutra is that consciousness has as its condition just those faculties, objects, and mental activity.

original: de'i stobs kyi mthus nus pa yin te zhes bya ba ni 'du byed kyi stobs kyi mthus zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i stobs kyi mthus nus pa yin te zhes bya ba ni 'du byed kyi stobs kyi mthus zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: By the power of formations means by the power of the formations.

original: ji ltar sems med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / @117a * //
analyzed: ji ltar sems med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / @117a * //
translated: How is it that the two mindless meditative attainments have formations as their nature?

original: sems med pa zhes bya ba la sems med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /🔽'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa /
analyzed: sems med pa zhes bya ba la sems med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni rnam pa gnyis te / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa /
translated: The state of composure without conception is the second type of state of composure without conception.

original: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'o //🔽'du shes med pa ni 'du shes med pa'i sems can lha rnams kyi nang du rnam par smin pa skyes pa ste /
analyzed: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'o // 'du shes med pa ni 'du shes med pa'i sems can lha rnams kyi nang du rnam par smin pa skyes pa ste /
translated: The state of composure without conception is the second type of state of composure without conception.🔽The state of composure without conception is the second type of state of composure without conception.🔽The state of composure without conception is the second type of state of composure without conception.

original: gnas skabs de dag na ni rnam par smra ba pa dag ni rnam par shes pa'i rgyun thams cad nas thams cad rgyun chad pa yin no zhes bsams pa'o //🔽btsun pa ba su mi tra na re /
analyzed: gnas skabs de dag na ni rnam par smra ba pa dag ni rnam par shes pa'i rgyun thams cad nas thams cad rgyun chad pa yin no zhes bsams pa'o // btsun pa ba su mi tra na re /
translated: The state of composure without conception is the second type of state of composure without conception.🔽The state of composure without conception is the second type of state of composure without conception.🔽The state of composure without conception is the second type of state of composure without conception.🔽The state of composure without conception is the second type of state of composure without conception.🔽The state of composure without conception is the second type of state of composure without conception.🔽The state of composure without conception is the second type of state of composure without conception.🔽The state of composure without conception is the second type of state of composure without conception.

original: mdo sde las ni 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa sems dang bcas par gsungs te /🔽ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: mdo sde las ni 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa sems dang bcas par gsungs te / ji lta zhe na /
translated: The state of composure without conception is the second type of state of composure without conception.🔽The state of composure without conception is the second type of state of composure without conception.🔽The state of composure without conception is the second type of state of composure without conception.🔽The state of composure without conception is the second type of state of composure without conception.🔽The state of composure without conception is the second type of state of composure without conception.

original: btsun pa 'dod pa can shi nas dus las 'das pa gang yin pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par zhugs pa gang yin pa 'di rnam gnyis la bye brag ni ci yod /
analyzed: btsun pa 'dod pa can shi nas dus las 'das pa gang yin pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par zhugs pa gang yin pa 'di rnam gnyis la bye brag ni ci yod /
translated: The state of composure without conception is the second type of state of composure without conception.

original: tha dad du bya ba'i dgongs pa ni ci yod /
analyzed: tha dad du bya ba'i dgongs pa ni ci yod /
translated: The state of composure without conception is the

original: khyim bdag shi nas dus las 'das pa gang yin pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par zhugs pa gang yin pa 'di gnyis la bye brag dang tha dad du bya ba'i dgongs pa mang du yod de /
analyzed: khyim bdag shi nas dus las 'das pa gang yin pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par zhugs pa gang yin pa 'di gnyis la bye brag dang tha dad du bya ba'i dgongs pa mang du yod de /
translated: There are many intentions for making distinctions and differences between these two: the death and passing away of a householder and the attainment of the absorption of cessation.

original: shi nas dus las 'das pa ni lus kyi 'du byed 'gags pa yin /
analyzed: shi nas dus las 'das pa ni lus kyi 'du byed 'gags pa yin /
translated: Death and passing away is the cessation of the formative factors of the body.

original: ngag gi 'du byed dang yid kyi 'du byed 'gags pa yin /
analyzed: ngag gi 'du byed dang yid kyi 'du byed 'gags pa yin /
translated: It is the cessation of the formative factors of speech and mind.

original: drod yal ba yin /
analyzed: drod yal ba yin /
translated: It is the loss of heat.

original: dbang po yongs su gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: dbang po yongs su gyur pa yin no //
translated: It is the transformation of the faculties.

original: khyim bdag 'gog pa'i snyoms par zhugs pa ni lus kyi 'du byed ma 'gags pa yin /
analyzed: khyim bdag 'gog pa'i snyoms par zhugs pa ni lus kyi 'du byed ma 'gags pa yin /
translated: The attainment of the absorption of cessation by a householder is not the cessation of the formative factors of the body.

original: ngag gi 'du byed ma 'gags pa yin /
analyzed: ngag gi 'du byed ma 'gags pa yin /
translated: It is not the cessation of the formative factors of speech and mind.

original: yid kyi 'du byed ma 'gags pa yin /
analyzed: yid kyi 'du byed ma 'gags pa yin /
translated: It is not the cessation of the formative factors of the mind.

original: tshe dang ma bral ba yin /
analyzed: tshe dang ma bral ba yin /
translated: It is not the separation from life.

original: drod dang ma bral ba yin /
analyzed: drod dang ma bral ba yin /
translated: It is not the separation from heat.

original: dbang po rnams yongs su ma gyur pa yin /
analyzed: dbang po rnams yongs su ma gyur pa yin /
translated: It is not the transformation of the faculties.

original: rnam par shes pa lus dang ma bral ba yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa lus dang ma bral ba yin no //
translated: It is not the separation of consciousness from the body.

original: khyim bdag shi nas dus las 'das pa gang yin pa dang 'gog pa'i snyoms par zhugs pa gang yin pa 'di gnyis gyi bye brag tu bya ba ni 'di yin no //
analyzed: khyim bdag shi nas dus las 'das pa gang yin pa dang 'gog pa'i snyoms par zhugs pa gang yin pa 'di gnyis gyi bye brag tu bya ba ni 'di yin no //
translated: The difference between the death of a householder and the attainment of the meditative attainment of cessation is as follows.

original: 'di gnyis tha dad du bya ba'i dgongs pa yang 'di yin no //
analyzed: 'di gnyis tha dad du bya ba'i dgongs pa yang 'di yin no //
translated: This is the intention for making a distinction between these two.🔽The Venerable Ghoṣaka says:

original: 'o na bcom ldan 'das kyis yid dang chos la brten nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa skye ba dang zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni btsun pa sgra dbyangs kyi yin no //
analyzed: 'o na bcom ldan 'das kyis yid dang chos la brten nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa skye ba dang zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni btsun pa sgra dbyangs kyi yin no //
translated: The Bhagavān says in detail: “Mental consciousness arises in dependence on the mental faculty and mental objects.”🔽The Venerable Vasumitra says:

original: re zhig tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis de ltar gsungs zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni btsun pa ba su mi tra'i yin no //
analyzed: re zhig tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis de ltar gsungs zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni btsun pa ba su mi tra'i yin no //
translated: “In dependence on feeling, craving arises,” the Bhagavān says in detail.

original: mdo gzhan las ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las skyes pa'i tshor ba la brten nas sred pa 'byung ngo zhes bye brag tu byas kyi /
analyzed: mdo gzhan las ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las skyes pa'i tshor ba la brten nas sred pa 'byung ngo zhes bye brag tu byas kyi /
translated: In another sūtra, it is specified: “Craving arises in dependence on feeling that arises from contact accompanied by ignorance.”

original: reg pa ni gang du yang bye brag tu byas pa med do zhes bya ba ni mdo sde gzhan @117b las /
analyzed: reg pa ni gang du yang bye brag tu byas pa med do zhes bya ba ni mdo sde gzhan @117b las /
translated: Contact is not specified in any way.

original: reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang 'du shes dang sems pa'o zhes bye brag tu ma byas par gsungs so //
analyzed: reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang 'du shes dang sems pa'o zhes bye brag tu ma byas par gsungs so //
translated: In other sūtras, it is not specified that contact is a condition for feeling, discrimination, and intention.

original: dgra bcom pa'i srid pa ni rtsa ba nas bcad pa yin gyi zhes bya ba ni de'i bag la nyal bcom pa'i phyir dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i srid pa ni rtsa ba nas bcad pa yin gyi zhes bya ba ni de'i bag la nyal bcom pa'i phyir dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The existence of an arhat is severed at the root, because his latent states are destroyed and he has abandoned the view of the transitory collection.

original: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pa'i 'du shes dang tshor ba gnyis ni ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pa'i 'du shes dang tshor ba gnyis ni ci zhe na /
translated: What about the two, ideation and feeling, in the meditative attainment of cessation?

original: rtsa ba nas bcad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rtsa ba nas bcad pa ma yin te /
translated: They are not severed at the root.

original: yang de mngon par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang de mngon par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They manifest again.

original: gzhan na re nus pa ni 'dus pa yin na zhes bya ba ni btsun pa dga' ba'i sde nus par bya ba'i ched du bsdus pa yin na /
analyzed: gzhan na re nus pa ni 'dus pa yin na zhes bya ba ni btsun pa dga' ba'i sde nus par bya ba'i ched du bsdus pa yin na /
translated: Bhadanta Ghoṣaka says: If the collection is a composite for the purpose of activity,

original: de'i tshe ni tshogs pa tsam du zad kyi 'dus pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshe ni tshogs pa tsam du zad kyi 'dus pa ni ma yin te /
translated: then at that time it is merely a collection, it is not a composite.

original: 'du shes dang tshor ba skyes pa'i mthu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'du shes dang tshor ba skyes pa'i mthu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it lacks the power to generate discernment and feeling.

original: ji ltar mthu med ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar mthu med ce na /
translated: How does it lack power?

original: de'i phyir de sun 'byin pas de bsal ba'i phyir ro zhes smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de sun 'byin pas de bsal ba'i phyir ro zhes smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “because it is a counteragent to them and because it is their antidote.”

original: de sun 'byin pa zhes bya ba ni 'du shes dang tshor ba sun 'byin pas so //
analyzed: de sun 'byin pa zhes bya ba ni 'du shes dang tshor ba sun 'byin pas so //
translated: The term “counteragent to them” means that it is a counteragent to discernment and feeling.

original: de bsal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa de bsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bsal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa de bsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The term “their antidote” means that it is the antidote to the meditative development of the state of composure that is a cessation.

original: gal te dge ba yin na dge ba'i rtsa ba med par ji ltar dge ba yin zhes bya ba ni dge ba ni rnam pa gsum du rnam par gzhag ste /🔽ngo bo nyid kyis dge ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gal te dge ba yin na dge ba'i rtsa ba med par ji ltar dge ba yin zhes bya ba ni dge ba ni rnam pa gsum du rnam par gzhag ste / ngo bo nyid kyis dge ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: If it is wholesome, how can it be wholesome when there is no root of the wholesome? Wholesomeness is determined in three ways:

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams dang / ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams dang / ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa'o //
translated: Wholesomeness by nature refers to the roots of the wholesome, shame, and embarrassment.

original: mtshungs par ldan pas dge ba ni 'di lta ste de las gzhan pa'i sems pas byung ba'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pas dge ba ni 'di lta ste de las gzhan pa'i sems pas byung ba'i chos rnams so //
translated: Wholesomeness by association refers to those entities that are mental factors other than the roots of the wholesome, shame, and embarrassment.

original: kun nas bslong bas dge ba ni 'di lta ste lus dang ngag gi las la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas bslong bas dge ba ni 'di lta ste lus dang ngag gi las la sogs pa'o //
translated: Virtue that is instigated is, for example, the actions of body and speech.

original: de bas na dge ba'i rtsa ba med pa dang de dang mtshungs par ldan pa med na de'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa ji ltar dge ba yin /
analyzed: de bas na dge ba'i rtsa ba med pa dang de dang mtshungs par ldan pa med na de'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa ji ltar dge ba yin /
translated: Therefore, if there is no root of virtue and there is no concomitant, how can the mental consciousness be virtuous?🔽And how can those roots of virtue exist without contact?

original: de dag kyang reg pa med par ji ltar yin te zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kyang reg pa med par dge ba'i rtsa bar rung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag kyang reg pa med par ji ltar yin te zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kyang reg pa med par dge ba'i rtsa bar rung ba ma yin te /
translated: Those roots of virtue are not suitable as roots of virtue without contact,

original: gang ji snyed tshor ba'i phung po dang / 'du shes kyi phung po dang 'du byed kyi phung po dang / de thams cad reg pa'i rkyen gyis zhes mdo sde las gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang ji snyed tshor ba'i phung po dang / 'du shes kyi phung po dang 'du byed kyi phung po dang / de thams cad reg pa'i rkyen gyis zhes mdo sde las gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is said in the sutras that “all the aggregates of feeling, perception, and formation are conditioned by contact.”

original: dge ba'i de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis 'phangs pa'i phyir gal te dge ba yin na ni zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis 'phangs ba'i phyir de dge bar 'gyur ro snyam du gal te sems na de mi rung ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis 'phangs pa'i phyir gal te dge ba yin na ni zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis 'phangs ba'i phyir de dge bar 'gyur ro snyam du gal te sems na de mi rung ste /
translated: If you think that it is virtuous because it is projected by the immediately preceding condition of a virtuous mind, that is not so.🔽Because three types of minds arise immediately after a virtuous mind and so on.

original: dge ba la sogs pa'i sems kyi mjug thogs su sems rnam pa gsum skye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis dge ba nyid du 'grub par byas @118a * //🔽pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dge ba la sogs pa'i sems kyi mjug thogs su sems rnam pa gsum skye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis dge ba nyid du 'grub par byas @118a * // pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not established that a virtuous mind is virtuous because of the immediately preceding condition of a virtuous mind.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i sems so so'i mjug thogs su dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i sems skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i sems so so'i mjug thogs su dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i sems skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because a virtuous, nonvirtuous or neutral mind arises immediately after a virtuous, nonvirtuous or neutral mind.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba'i stobs kyis 'phangs te /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba'i stobs kyis 'phangs te /
translated: It is projected by the power of the root of virtue.

original: sems dge ba'i ngo bo yin na yang de zlog par byed pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba'i de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis 'phangs te de dge ba nyid yin na ni der dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams zlog par byed pa'i
analyzed: sems dge ba'i ngo bo yin na yang de zlog par byed pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba'i de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis 'phangs te de dge ba nyid yin na ni der dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams zlog par byed pa'i
translated: because there is no cause to stop it, even though the mind is of the nature of virtue.🔽If it were virtue because projected by the immediately antecedent condition of the roots of virtue, then what cause would stop the roots of virtue there?

original: rgyu gang zhig yin zlog par byed pa'i rgyu yod na yang des byas pas dge ba de dag kyang yod par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rgyu gang zhig yin zlog par byed pa'i rgyu yod na yang des byas pas dge ba de dag kyang yod par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Even if there were a cause to stop it, that which is made by it would not exist, because those virtues would not exist.

original: de'i nus pa la gnod pa byas pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: de'i nus pa la gnod pa byas pa'i phyir ro//
translated: Because its power would be harmed.

original: de bas na der dge ba'i rtsa ba gdon mi za bar yod par bya dgos so //
analyzed: de bas na der dge ba'i rtsa ba gdon mi za bar yod par bya dgos so //
translated: Therefore, the roots of virtue there must exist without doubt.🔽And the same would apply to nonvirtue.

original: mi dge ba la yang de dag thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni mi dge ba'i de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis 'phangs pa'i phyir mi dge ba nyid yin par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi dge ba la yang de dag thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni mi dge ba'i de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis 'phangs pa'i phyir mi dge ba nyid yin par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: It would follow that nonvirtue would be virtue, because it is projected by the immediately antecedent condition of nonvirtue.

original: mi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not because it is concomitant with the roots of nonvirtue.

original: de ltar ni 'dod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar ni 'dod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: But this is not the case.

original: de'i phyir yang de dge ba yin par mi rigs so//
analyzed: de'i phyir yang de dge ba yin par mi rigs so//
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable that the attainment of cessation is wholesome.

original: 'dir smras pa re zhig 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni dge ba'i rtsa ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa yang ji ltar yin te ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir smras pa re zhig 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni dge ba'i rtsa ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa yang ji ltar yin te ma yin no //
translated: Here, they say: How can the attainment of cessation be associated with the roots of wholesomeness? It cannot be.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa'i lam bzhin du dge ba'i rtsa ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa'i lam bzhin du dge ba'i rtsa ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin te /
translated: It is associated with the roots of wholesomeness like the contaminated and uncontaminated paths.

original: sems med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is mindless.

original: 'bras bu yid du 'ong ba nyid yin pa'i phyir dge ba nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu yid du 'ong ba nyid yin pa'i phyir dge ba nyid kyang ma yin te /
translated: It is not wholesome because it has a pleasant result.

original: 'bras bu la gnas pa rnams ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i dge ba rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa can ma yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu la gnas pa rnams ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i dge ba rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa can ma yin te /
translated: Those who abide in the result do not have contaminated wholesome karma with ripening.

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i lugs kyi srid pa la rgyab kyis phyogs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i lugs kyi srid pa la rgyab kyis phyogs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because they turn their back on existence according to the Yogācāra system.

original: /'on te dge ba'i de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis 'phangs pa'i phyir dge ba nyid yin la /
analyzed: /'on te dge ba'i de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis 'phangs pa'i phyir dge ba nyid yin la /
translated: Or, it is virtuous because it is projected by the immediately preceding condition of a virtuous mind.

original: de ltar 'di yang dge ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ltar 'di yang dge ba nyid yin no //
translated: In this way, it is also virtuous.

original: de'i phyir 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni 'gog pa bzhin du dge ba nyid yin no zhes smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni 'gog pa bzhin du dge ba nyid yin no zhes smras te /
translated: Therefore, like cessation, the meditative attainment of cessation is virtuous.

original: ji ltar 'gog pa ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu rnam par log pa'i phyir dge ba nyid yin pa de bzhin du 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa yang sdug bsngal bar gnas pa rnam par log pa'i phyir dge ba yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar 'gog pa ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu rnam par log pa'i phyir dge ba nyid yin pa de bzhin du 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa yang sdug bsngal bar gnas pa rnam par log pa'i phyir dge ba yin no //
translated: Just as cessation is virtuous because it is the cessation of the causes of suffering, so too the meditative attainment of cessation is virtuous because it is the cessation of the abiding of suffering.🔽Because it is obstructed by the other seven lower levels.

original: sa 'og ma gzhan bdun gyis bar du chod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams su skyes par gyur pa 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par 'jug pa gang yin pa @118b de'i 'dod pa na spyod pa'i rnam par smin pa'i sems ni
analyzed: sa 'og ma gzhan bdun gyis bar du chod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams su skyes par gyur pa 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par 'jug pa gang yin pa @118b de'i 'dod pa na spyod pa'i rnam par smin pa'i sems ni
translated: The mind of the karmic maturation of the desire realm of one who has taken birth in the desire realm and has entered the meditative attainment of cessation is obstructed by the other seven lower levels.

original: sa 'og ma gzhan bdun te /
analyzed: sa 'og ma gzhan bdun te /
translated: The other seven lower levels are the six levels of meditative stability and the summit of existence.

original: gzugs med pa gsum dang / bsam gtan bzhis bar du chod pa'i rtse mo'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems kyi mjug thogs pa mngon du byed pa yin no zhes bya bar rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs med pa gsum dang / bsam gtan bzhis bar du chod pa'i rtse mo'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems kyi mjug thogs pa mngon du byed pa yin no zhes bya bar rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not logical to say that the summit meditative attainment is manifested immediately after the mind of the third meditative attainment, the mind of the fourth meditative attainment, or the three formless meditative attainments.

original: thod rgal ba'i snyoms par 'jug pa dag 'di mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems sa 'og ma pas ni gsum las gong du mngon du byed par nus pa ma yin na /
analyzed: thod rgal ba'i snyoms par 'jug pa dag 'di mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems sa 'og ma pas ni gsum las gong du mngon du byed par nus pa ma yin na /
translated: If one who is equipoised in the summit meditative attainment cannot manifest the mind of a higher level from a lower level,

original: 'dod pa spyod pas sa 'og ma gzhan bdun gyis bar du chod pa la lta smos kyang ci dgos //
analyzed: 'dod pa spyod pas sa 'og ma gzhan bdun gyis bar du chod pa la lta smos kyang ci dgos //
translated: then what need is there to mention that one who is in the desire realm cannot manifest the mind of the summit meditative attainment, which is obstructed by the seven other levels?
