original: srog gi dbang po'i mtshan nyid la sogs pa ci reg pa la brten nas 'byung ngam /
analyzed: srog gi dbang po'i mtshan nyid la sogs pa ci reg pa la brten nas 'byung ngam /
translated: The characteristics of the faculty of life force and so on arise in dependence on contact.

original: reg pa med par yang 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pa ni thob pa las skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: reg pa med par yang 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pa ni thob pa las skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: But they also arise from obtainment, since they arise in the meditative attainment of cessation and so on that is devoid of contact.

original: de bas na sems dang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed rdzas su yod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de bas na sems dang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed rdzas su yod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Therefore nonconcurrent formations do not substantially exist.🔽They are imputed to be different states of form and so on that substantially exist.

original: gzugs la sogs pa rdzas su yod pa'i gnas skabs gzhan la btags pa yin la zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang sems dang sems las byung ba'i gnas skabs gzhan la zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rdzas su yod pa'i gnas skabs gzhan la btags pa yin la zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang sems dang sems las byung ba'i gnas skabs gzhan la zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: They are imputed to be different states of form, mind and mental factors.

original: mi ldan pa rnams dang 'dus ma byas rnams rdzas su yod pa ma yin no zhes rgyas par gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi ldan pa rnams dang 'dus ma byas rnams rdzas su yod pa ma yin no zhes rgyas par gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Nonconcurrent formations and unconditioned states do not substantially exist.

original: dper na nus pa dang / kun du sbyor ba dang rnam par phye ba dang / pha rol nyid dang / tshu rol nyid dang / rgyang ring ba dang / thag nye ba nyid lta bu'o zhes bya ba ci zhe na /
analyzed: dper na nus pa dang / kun du sbyor ba dang rnam par phye ba dang / pha rol nyid dang / tshu rol nyid dang / rgyang ring ba dang / thag nye ba nyid lta bu'o zhes bya ba ci zhe na /
translated: What is meant?

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i gnas skabs gzhan la btags pa yin no zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i gnas skabs gzhan la btags pa yin no zhes bya ste /
translated: It is a designation for a different state of form, etc.

original: 'bras bu skye ba'i rgyu'i dngos por nye bar gnas pa'i @124b gnas skabs la nus pa btags pa yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu skye ba'i rgyu'i dngos por nye bar gnas pa'i @124b gnas skabs la nus pa btags pa yin no //
translated: Potency is a designation for the state of a cause that is present as the basis for the arising of an effect.

original: gzugs rgyun mi 'chad par skye ba'i gnas skabs la kun du sbyor bas so //🔽rgyun mi 'chad par skye bar kun du sbyor bas so //
analyzed: gzugs rgyun mi 'chad par skye ba'i gnas skabs la kun du sbyor bas so // rgyun mi 'chad par skye bar kun du sbyor bas so //
translated: Conjunction is a designation for the state of the arising of form in an uninterrupted continuum.🔽Disjunction is a designation for the state of the arising of form in an interrupted continuum.

original: rnam par phye ste skye ba'i gnas skabs la ni rnam par phye ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par phye ste skye ba'i gnas skabs la ni rnam par phye ba'o //
translated: Distance is a designation for the state of the arising of form in a distant place.🔽Nearness is a designation for the state of the arising of form in a nearby place.🔽Proximity is a designation for the state of the arising of form in an immediate place.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba lhan cig tu skye ba'i gnas skabs la yang kun du sbyor ba btags pa yin te /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba lhan cig tu skye ba'i gnas skabs la yang kun du sbyor ba btags pa yin te /
translated: Conjunction is also a designation for the state of the arising of mind and mental factors together.

original: dus dang / rten dang / dmigs pa mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus dang / rten dang / dmigs pa mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are similar in time, support, and object.

original: pha rol nyid dang tshu rol nyid kyang bar na gzugs mang ba dang nyung ba nyid kyi gnas skabs la btags pa yin te /
analyzed: pha rol nyid dang tshu rol nyid kyang bar na gzugs mang ba dang nyung ba nyid kyi gnas skabs la btags pa yin te /
translated: Far and near are designated in relation to the many or few forms in between.🔽Far is designated in relation to the many forms in between that are seen.

original: mthong ba'i yul las bar na gzugs mang ba la pha rol zhes btags so //
analyzed: mthong ba'i yul las bar na gzugs mang ba la pha rol zhes btags so //
translated: Near is designated in relation to the few forms in between.

original: bar na nyung ba la chu rol zhes btags pa de bzhin du dus dang ngo bo nyid la sogs pa tha dad pa yin du zin kyang /
analyzed: bar na nyung ba la chu rol zhes btags pa de bzhin du dus dang ngo bo nyid la sogs pa tha dad pa yin du zin kyang /
translated: Similarly, even though time, intrinsic reality and so on are different,

original: rgyud tha dad pa la pha rol dang tshu rol zhes btags so //
analyzed: rgyud tha dad pa la pha rol dang tshu rol zhes btags so //
translated: far and near are designated in relation to different continua.

original: de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa'i gnas skabs gzhan la thob pa la sogs pa btags pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa'i gnas skabs gzhan la thob pa la sogs pa btags pa yin te /
translated: Similarly, attainment and so on are designated in relation to other states of form and so on.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: re zhig thob pa ni dge ba la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyi sa bon ma nyams pa'i gnas skabs dang / de skye ba'i dbang ma nyams pa dang / mngon du gyur pa'i gnas skabs la btags pa yin no //
analyzed: re zhig thob pa ni dge ba la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyi sa bon ma nyams pa'i gnas skabs dang / de skye ba'i dbang ma nyams pa dang / mngon du gyur pa'i gnas skabs la btags pa yin no //
translated: Attainment is designated in relation to the state of undamaged seeds of virtuous and so on, the undamaged power generating them and the state of manifest attainment.

original: ma thob pa ni de'i sa bon med pa shin tu kun du 'byung ba'i gnas skabs la btags pa yin no //
analyzed: ma thob pa ni de'i sa bon med pa shin tu kun du 'byung ba'i gnas skabs la btags pa yin no //
translated: Non-possession is the non-existence of the seed, the state of not being in the process of being produced.

original: ris 'dra ba nyid ni sems 'dra ba tsam la btags pa yin te /
analyzed: ris 'dra ba nyid ni sems 'dra ba tsam la btags pa yin te /
translated: Similarity of type is the mere similarity of mind.

original: mi 'dra ba'i rdzas gzhan ni 'dra ba ma yin te /
analyzed: mi 'dra ba'i rdzas gzhan ni 'dra ba ma yin te /
translated: A different substance that is not similar is not similar.

original: 'bras la sogs pa'i sdong bu 'dra ba bzhin no //
analyzed: 'bras la sogs pa'i sdong bu 'dra ba bzhin no //
translated: It is like a different stalk of rice, etc.

original: de ltar na de lta bu yin pa'i gzugs la sogs pa phung po skye ba'i gnas skabs gzhan thob pa ni ris 'dra ba zhes bya ba 'thob ste /
analyzed: de ltar na de lta bu yin pa'i gzugs la sogs pa phung po skye ba'i gnas skabs gzhan thob pa ni ris 'dra ba zhes bya ba 'thob ste /
translated: Thus, the obtaining of a different state of the aggregates, such as form, etc., is called similarity of type,

original: mi la sogs pa bye brag tu gdags pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi la sogs pa bye brag tu gdags pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the cause for the designation of a particular human, etc.

original: de bzhin du sems med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa gnyis ni sems dang sems las byung ba skye ba dang mi mthun pa'i lus skyes pa'i gnas skabs la gdags so //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa gnyis ni sems dang sems las byung ba skye ba dang mi mthun pa'i lus skyes pa'i gnas skabs la gdags so //
translated: Similarly, the two mindless meditative attainments are designated as the state of the arising of the body that is not conducive to the arising of mind and mental factors.

original: 'du shes med pa ba yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o /
analyzed: 'du shes med pa ba yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o /
translated: The state of being without conceptualization should be understood in the same way.

original: srog gi dbang po ni sngon gyi tshe rabs kyi las kyis 'phangs te /
analyzed: srog gi dbang po ni sngon gyi tshe rabs kyi las kyis 'phangs te /
translated: The faculty of life force is projected by the karma of previous lives.🔽

original: ris mthun par gnas pa'i rgyu'i dngos po tsam la gdags so //
analyzed: ris mthun par gnas pa'i rgyu'i dngos po tsam la gdags so //
translated: The faculty of life force is designated as the mere cause that maintains homogeneity of type, projected by karma in previous lives.

original: ma byung ba las byung ba la skye ba gdags so //
analyzed: ma byung ba las byung ba la skye ba gdags so //
translated: Arising is designated as the emergence of that which did not previously exist.

original: 'bras bu dang rgyu'i rgyun la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang rgyu'i rgyun la gnas pa'o //
translated: Endurance is designated as the continuum of results and causes.

original: rgyun snga phyi'i bye brag la ni rgal ba'o //🔽byung nas med pa tsam la mi rtag @125a * //
analyzed: rgyun snga phyi'i bye brag la ni rgal ba'o // byung nas med pa tsam la mi rtag @125a * //
translated: Aging is designated as the distinction between earlier and later states of the continuum.

original: pa nyid gdags so zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: pa nyid gdags so zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Impermanence is designated as the mere nonexistence of that which has arisen.

original: de dag ji ltar rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa ni chos mngon pa'i mdzod las shes par bya'o zhes bya ba ji ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: de dag ji ltar rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa ni chos mngon pa'i mdzod las shes par bya'o zhes bya ba ji ltar yin zhe na /
translated: How they do not substantially exist should be understood from the Abhidharma treatise.

original: thob pa la sogs pa ni rdzas su yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: thob pa la sogs pa ni rdzas su yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Obtainment and so on do not substantially exist.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: de dag gi rang gi ngo bo ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pas bcings pa rnams la gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa bzhin du mi mngon pa'i phyir dang / mig dang rna ba la sogs pa bzhin du byed pa yang med do //
analyzed: de dag gi rang gi ngo bo ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pas bcings pa rnams la gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa bzhin du mi mngon pa'i phyir dang / mig dang rna ba la sogs pa bzhin du byed pa yang med do //
translated: Their own nature is not manifest, like form, sound, etc., for those bound by attachment, hatred, etc., and they do not function like the eye, ear, etc.

original: de bas na rdzas kyis chos med pa'i phyir btags pa'i yod pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na rdzas kyis chos med pa'i phyir btags pa'i yod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are imputedly existent because they are not substantially existent phenomena.

original: yang na thob pa la sogs pa ni ji ltar btags pa'i rnams rdzas su yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yang na thob pa la sogs pa ni ji ltar btags pa'i rnams rdzas su yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Or, attainment, etc., are not substantially existent as they are imputed.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no valid knowledge.

original: de dag rdzas su yod pa nyid du byed pa'i tshad ma mngon sum mam /🔽rjes su dpag pa'am /
analyzed: de dag rdzas su yod pa nyid du byed pa'i tshad ma mngon sum mam / rjes su dpag pa'am /
translated: There is not the slightest valid knowledge that establishes them as substantially existent.🔽What is valid knowledge?🔽Direct perception, inference,

original: yid ches pa'i lung ni cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yid ches pa'i lung ni cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: or reliable scripture.

original: ji ltar gzugs la sogs pa bzhin du'o //
analyzed: ji ltar gzugs la sogs pa bzhin du'o //
translated: They are not like form, etc.

original: 'o na mdo sde las chos bcu po de dag rnams zhes rgyas par gsungs pa ni de nyid las ji ltar rigs par rnam par nges pa gzung bar bya'o //🔽rnam par ma zhig pa dang / bsags pa yang yong ye yod pa ma yin la /🔽gnas skabs gzhan de dag la de nyid btags yang ma yin no //

analyzed: gang yang sems med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang 'du shes med pa pa'i mjug tu ldang ba'i sems skye ba dang zhes bya ba la sems med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa smos pas ni 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug
translated: The sutra itself determines that the ten dharmas are the ten members of the dependent origination.

analyzed: pa gzung ngo //
translated: The sutra itself determines that the ten dharmas

analyzed: de la sems med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i mjug tu ldang ba ni ldang ba'i dus so //
translated: The time of arising is the arising from the meditative attainment that lacks mind.

original: 'du shes med pa pa'i mjug ni 'chi ba'i dus so //
analyzed: 'du shes med pa pa'i mjug ni 'chi ba'i dus so //
translated: The time of death is the end of the meditative attainment of nonperception.

original: gang yang yi ge'i gzhung lan mang du ston pa las ci zhe na /
analyzed: gang yang yi ge'i gzhung lan mang du ston pa las ci zhe na /
translated: What is the purpose of teaching the scriptural passage many times?

original: dran pa skye bar 'gyur re zhes phyis 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dran pa skye bar 'gyur re zhes phyis 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is said that memory arises.

original: don rtag tu mthong ba la sogs pa las zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i yul la yang nas yang du mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / bsnams ba dang / myangs pa dang / reg pa ste /
analyzed: don rtag tu mthong ba la sogs pa las zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i yul la yang nas yang du mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / bsnams ba dang / myangs pa dang / reg pa ste /
translated: From always seeing and so on means that memory arises from seeing, hearing, smelling, tasting, and touching form and so on many times.

original: thos pa dang / bsnams pa dang / myangs pa dang / reg pa dang / rnam par shes pa las phyis dran @125b pa skye ba ni dus phyi nas so //
analyzed: thos pa dang / bsnams pa dang / myangs pa dang / reg pa dang / rnam par shes pa las phyis dran @125b pa skye ba ni dus phyi nas so //
translated: Memory arises later from hearing, smelling, tasting, touching, and cognizing.

original: ci sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i chos gzhan bar skabs su 'ga' yang gang las de las ldang ba'i sems dang ldan pa de dang ge sar dmar po de yang dus gzhan na skye bar 'gyur ba la yod dam /

translated: Or does the mind that arises from that mind that is not concomitant with other phenomena arise at another time, like the red color of the stamen?🔽If the first moment alone is the one that arises, then it would be meaningless to cultivate it

original: gang goms pa dran pa skye bar 'gyur ba skad cig ma gang la de'i skye bar brtag par nus zhes bya ba ni gal te re zhig skad cig ma dang po kho na de skye ba yin na ni skad cig ma gzhan gyi tshe goms par byed pa🔽don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang goms pa dran pa skye bar 'gyur ba skad cig ma gang la de'i skye bar brtag par nus zhes bya ba ni gal te re zhig skad cig ma dang po kho na de skye ba yin na ni skad cig ma gzhan gyi tshe goms par byed pa don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: at the time of the second moment and so on.

original: 'on te skad cig ma gnyis pa la sogs pa gzhan gyi tshe de skye ba yin na ni 'di brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'on te skad cig ma gnyis pa la sogs pa gzhan gyi tshe de skye ba yin na ni 'di brjod par bya ste /
translated: But if it arises at the time of the second moment and so on, then this must be stated:

original: ci skad cig ma gnyis pa la sogs pa de dag la skad cig ma dang po la ston pa dang / mthong ba la sogs pa sngar song ba'i bye brag yod dam /
analyzed: ci skad cig ma gnyis pa la sogs pa de dag la skad cig ma dang po la ston pa dang / mthong ba la sogs pa sngar song ba'i bye brag yod dam /
translated: Do the second moment and so on that arise have the specific attributes of the first moment, such as being taught by the Teacher, being seen and so on?

original: 'on te med pa yin ci nyes ji ste yod na ni de bzhin du bdag nyid thob pa'i bye brag yod pa'i phyir sems dang sems las byung ba'i dran pa phyis skye bar 'gyur bas rtog pa de don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te med pa yin ci nyes ji ste yod na ni de bzhin du bdag nyid thob pa'i bye brag yod pa'i phyir sems dang sems las byung ba'i dran pa phyis skye bar 'gyur bas rtog pa de don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: But if it does exist, then, since it would exist as a particular that is obtained in that way, memory of mind and mental factors would arise later, and that conception would be pointless.

original: 'on te med na ni skad cig ma dang po bzhin du mi rtsom ste de mi skye bas dran pa med par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on te med na ni skad cig ma dang po bzhin du mi rtsom ste de mi skye bas dran pa med par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: But if it does not exist, then, like the first moment, it would not be initiated, and since it would not arise, it would follow that there would be no memory.

original: skad cig ma gnyis pa la sogs pa ni skad cig ma dang po dang bye brag med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: skad cig ma gnyis pa la sogs pa ni skad cig ma dang po dang bye brag med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the second moment and so on are not different from the first moment.

original: skad cig ma snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: skad cig ma snga ma bzhin no //
translated: It is like the previous moment.

original: goms pa smos pas ni chos gzhan skyed par mi nus pa yang ma yin te //
analyzed: goms pa smos pas ni chos gzhan skyed par mi nus pa yang ma yin te //
translated: The statement about habituation shows that it is not the case that it is unable to generate other phenomena.

original: kha cig yi ge'i gzhung ston pa cig car du dran pa yod do //
analyzed: kha cig yi ge'i gzhung ston pa cig car du dran pa yod do //
translated: Some say that the teaching of the texts of letters is remembered all at once.

original: mthong ba la sogs pa'i don kyang cig car du dran pa yod pas gang goms pas dran pa skyed par 'gyur ba skad cig ma gang la de skye bar brtag par nus zhes bya ba'i skyon 'di de la brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba la sogs pa'i don kyang cig car du dran pa yod pas gang goms pas dran pa skyed par 'gyur ba skad cig ma gang la de skye bar brtag par nus zhes bya ba'i skyon 'di de la brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: And since there is a memory of the object of seeing, etc., all at once, it is not to be said that this fault is to be stated to him: “By what cultivation would memory arise? In what instant could it arise?”

original: de bas na 'du byed kyis yongs su bsgos pa'i rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug la zhes rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: de bas na 'du byed kyis yongs su bsgos pa'i rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug la zhes rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Therefore, in the six collections of consciousness that are perfumed by formations, etc.

original: de bas na zhes smos pa ni ji skad du bstan pa'i rnam par rab tu bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bas na zhes smos pa ni ji skad du bstan pa'i rnam par rab tu bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Therefore” is stated in order to demonstrate the teaching as it has been presented.

original: de la yang dbang po tha dad pas rnam par shes pa tha dad pa zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de la yang dbang po tha dad pas rnam par shes pa tha dad pa zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: And there, beginning with “Since there is a difference in the sense faculties, there is a difference in consciousness,”

original: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug yin par khas len kyang rung ste /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug yin par khas len kyang rung ste /
translated: it is acceptable to accept that the condition of consciousness is the six collections of consciousness.

original: sgra'i don ji lta ba bzhin du drangs nas don de bzhin du 'gror mi rung ngo //
analyzed: sgra'i don ji lta ba bzhin du drangs nas don de bzhin du 'gror mi rung ngo //
translated: But it is not acceptable to take the meaning in accordance with the literal sense.

original: sems dang bcas pa dang sems med pa pa'i 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pa khas len kyang rung zhes bya ba ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: sems dang bcas pa dang sems med pa pa'i 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pa khas len kyang rung zhes bya ba ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: It is suitable to accept that the meditative attainment of cessation with mind and the meditative attainment of cessation without mind exist.

original: de'i gnas skabs na gang gi sems yod pa ma @126a * //🔽yin no zhes rgyas par 'byung ba nas sems dang bcas pa'i 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pa khas len kyang rung /
analyzed: de'i gnas skabs na gang gi sems yod pa ma @126a * // yin no zhes rgyas par 'byung ba nas sems dang bcas pa'i 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pa khas len kyang rung /
translated: What is the meaning of that?🔽It is suitable to accept that the meditative attainment of cessation with mind exists,

original: de bzhin sems med pa'i 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa yin no zhes rgyas par 'byung ba nas sems dang bcas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pa yin par khas len kyang rung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin sems med pa'i 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa yin no zhes rgyas par 'byung ba nas sems dang bcas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pa yin par khas len kyang rung ste /
translated: and it is suitable to accept that the meditative attainment of cessation without mind exists.

original: sgra'i don ji lta ba bzhin du drangs na don de bzhin du 'gror mi rung ngo //
analyzed: sgra'i don ji lta ba bzhin du drangs na don de bzhin du 'gror mi rung ngo //
translated: If the meaning of the words is drawn out literally, it is unsuitable to accept that meaning.

original: mngal du nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par shes pa 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis yin no zhes rgyas par 'byung ba nas /
analyzed: mngal du nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par shes pa 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis yin no zhes rgyas par 'byung ba nas /
translated: The consciousness that links to the womb is conditioned by karmic formation.

original: 'das pa'i 'du byed kyi nying mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par shes pa khas len kyang rung ste ;
analyzed: 'das pa'i 'du byed kyi nying mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par shes pa khas len kyang rung ste ;
translated: It is also acceptable to accept the consciousness that links to past compositional activity.

original: sgra'i don ji lta ba bzhin du drangs nas don de bzhin 'gror mi rung ngo //
analyzed: sgra'i don ji lta ba bzhin du drangs nas don de bzhin 'gror mi rung ngo //
translated: But it is not acceptable to take the meaning in accordance with the literal reading.

original: kha cig na re nying mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par shes pa ni 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis yin kyang 'das pa'i las las de skye ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: kha cig na re nying mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par shes pa ni 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis yin kyang 'das pa'i las las de skye ba ma yin gyi /
translated: Some say: The consciousness that links to birth is conditioned by compositional activity, but it does not arise from past karma.🔽However, it arises from the noncessation of the continuum of consciousness that is its cause.

original: 'on kyang de'i rgyu can gyi rnam par ma zhig pa las yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa brjod pa de'i rgyu can gyi rnam par zhig pa la sogs pa rkyen yin par khas len kyang rung ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang de'i rgyu can gyi rnam par ma zhig pa las yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa brjod pa de'i rgyu can gyi rnam par zhig pa la sogs pa rkyen yin par khas len kyang rung ste /
translated: It is acceptable to accept that the cessation of the continuum of consciousness that is its cause and so on are conditions.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar gyur pa /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar gyur pa /
translated: But because that is so,

original: de bas na 'dir don nyid ni dgongs pa can yin par rig par bya'o zhes rgyas par 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: de bas na 'dir don nyid ni dgongs pa can yin par rig par bya'o zhes rgyas par 'byung ba yin no //
translated: here the meaning itself is to be understood as having an underlying thought.

original: gnas pas gnas bstan pa zhes bya ba ni gnas pa mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pas gnas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa bstan te /
analyzed: gnas pas gnas bstan pa zhes bya ba ni gnas pa mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pas gnas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa bstan te /
translated: The statement “the foundation is taught by the abiding” means that the foundation consciousness is taught by the abiding of the eye consciousness, etc.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni rnam par shes pa drug gi gnas yin te /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni rnam par shes pa drug gi gnas yin te /
translated: The foundation consciousness is the foundation of the six consciousnesses,

original: gtso bo'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtso bo'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the principal cause.

original: 'bru'i snod lta bur de de dag gi gnas ni ma yin gyi /🔽de'i sa bon gyi gnas yin no //
analyzed: 'bru'i snod lta bur de de dag gi gnas ni ma yin gyi / de'i sa bon gyi gnas yin no //
translated: It is not the foundation of those consciousnesses in the manner of a container for grain,🔽but it is the foundation of their seeds.

original: de'i sa bon gyi gnas zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de'i sa bon gyi gnas zhes bya ste /
translated: It is the foundation of their seeds,

original: de skye bar nus pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de skye bar nus pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it possesses the ability to generate them.

original: de la sa bon rnams sbyang bar blugs pa lta bu ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de la sa bon rnams sbyang bar blugs pa lta bu ni ma yin gyi /
translated: The seeds are not placed in it as if they were grain.

original: 'o na ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: How then?

original: dper na sa bon dang / myu gu dang / thal ba dang / lus dang / du ba dang / me dang / sa gzhi la sogs pa rnams 'bras bu la nus pa dang ldan pa'i phyir de'i rgyu'i dngos po ni gnas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dper na sa bon dang / myu gu dang / thal ba dang / lus dang / du ba dang / me dang / sa gzhi la sogs pa rnams 'bras bu la nus pa dang ldan pa'i phyir de'i rgyu'i dngos po ni gnas zhes bya'o //
translated: For example, seeds, sprouts, ashes, the body, smoke, fire, the ground, etc., are called foundations because they possess the ability to produce results.

original: de bzhin du 'bras bus rgyu ste bstan to zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'bras bus rgyu ste bstan to zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: Likewise, the cause is indicated by the effect.

original: 'bras bu mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pas rgyu kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'bras bu mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pas rgyu kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa bstan to //
translated: The cause, i.e., the store-consciousness, is indicated by the effect, i.e., the visual consciousness, etc.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de dang ldan pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rgyun 'bab pa bstan pa'i phyir te rnam par shes pa drug de dag dang ldan pa'i kun gzhi rnam par @126b shes pa'i rgyun 'bab pa bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rgyun 'bab pa bstan pa'i phyir te rnam par shes pa drug de dag dang ldan pa'i kun gzhi rnam par @126b shes pa'i rgyun 'bab pa bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the stream of consciousness endowed with that is indicated, i.e., the stream of the store-consciousness endowed with those six consciousnesses is indicated.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bur 'brel ba'i dngos po yin pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bur 'brel ba'i dngos po yin pa'i phyir ro /
translated: because it is a thing that is related as cause and effect.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i rgyun bab pa ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug dang ldan pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i rgyun bab pa ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug dang ldan pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The stream of the store-consciousness is called “endowed with the six groups of consciousnesses”

original: 'brel pa yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'brel pa yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: because it is related to them.

original: de'i dbang po rnams gzhan du gyur pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i dbang po rnams gzhan du gyur pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: The transformation of the faculties is not that of the store-consciousness.

original: gzigs pa mnga' ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dbang po rnams la mthong ba la sogs pa'i bya ba byed pa las rjes su dpag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzigs pa mnga' ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dbang po rnams la mthong ba la sogs pa'i bya ba byed pa las rjes su dpag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are seen.

original: dbang po rnams bsal ba ni mthong bar yang mi nus kyi zhes bya ba ni dbang po rnams dbang po'i yul las 'das pa'i phyir dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pas shes par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po rnams bsal ba ni mthong bar yang mi nus kyi zhes bya ba ni dbang po rnams dbang po'i yul las 'das pa'i phyir dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pas shes par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The eyes, etc. are not perceived because they are beyond the range of the senses and are cognized by the mental consciousness.

original: 'jig rten na yang 'di'i lta ba ni nyams dga' ba yin te /🔽gdong gi mig ni autpa la sngon po'i 'dab ma lta bu'o zhes bya ba lta ba dang mig gis de'i gnas ji lta ba bstan to //
analyzed: 'jig rten na yang 'di'i lta ba ni nyams dga' ba yin te / gdong gi mig ni autpa la sngon po'i 'dab ma lta bu'o zhes bya ba lta ba dang mig gis de'i gnas ji lta ba bstan to //
translated: In the world, it is said that his eyes are delightful to behold.🔽The eyes on his face are like the petals of a blue lotus.

original: lta ba ni 'dir mig gi dbang po la bya'o //
analyzed: lta ba ni 'dir mig gi dbang po la bya'o //
translated: Here, the word “eyes” refers to the eye faculty.

original: mig kyang de'o //
analyzed: mig kyang de'o //
translated: The eyes are also like that.

original: mig gi dbang po ni nyams dga' ba ma yin te /
analyzed: mig gi dbang po ni nyams dga' ba ma yin te /
translated: The eye faculty is not delightful to behold,

original: mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not directly perceived.

original: gdong gi mig ni autpa la sngon po'i 'dab ma lta bu yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gdong gi mig ni autpa la sngon po'i 'dab ma lta bu yang ma yin te /
translated: The eyes on his face are not like the petals of a blue lotus,🔽because they are not like that.

original: mdog dang dbyibs kyis ma zin pa'i phyir dang / zlum po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdog dang dbyibs kyis ma zin pa'i phyir dang / zlum po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not perceived by color and shape, and because it is round.

original: de'i phyir lta ba dang / mig gis de'i gnas ji lta ba bzhin du ston pa 'di grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir lta ba dang / mig gis de'i gnas ji lta ba bzhin du ston pa 'di grub pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the location of the eye sense faculty is established by the eye and by sight.

original: mig gi dbang po'i gnas de ni shin tu sngo ba dang / khyon yangs pa dang nyams dga' ba'ang yin te /
analyzed: mig gi dbang po'i gnas de ni shin tu sngo ba dang / khyon yangs pa dang nyams dga' ba'ang yin te /
translated: That location of the eye sense faculty is very dark, vast, and delightful.

original: mngon sum nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is directly perceived.

original: de ltar na re zhig ngas pas gnas bstan pa shes par byas pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig ngas pas gnas bstan pa shes par byas pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the location of the eye sense faculty is known by the statement of the location.

original: 'bras bus kyang rgyu ji ltar ston pa de bzhin du brjod pa ni /
analyzed: 'bras bus kyang rgyu ji ltar ston pa de bzhin du brjod pa ni /
translated: The statement of the result is also like the statement of the cause.

original: dge slong dag rlung ni nad yin no nad chen po yin no //
analyzed: dge slong dag rlung ni nad yin no nad chen po yin no //
translated: “Monks, wind is a disease, a great disease.

original: sman chen po ni til mar ram til mar dang sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: sman chen po ni til mar ram til mar dang sbyar ba'o //
translated: The great medicine is oil or something mixed with oil.

original: dge slong dag mkhris pa'i nad kyi sman chen po ni zhun mar ram zhun mar dang sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: dge slong dag mkhris pa'i nad kyi sman chen po ni zhun mar ram zhun mar dang sbyar ba'o //
translated: Monks, the great medicine for the disease of bile is ghee or something mixed with ghee.”

original: dge slong dag bad kan gyi nad dang nad chen po'i sman chen po ni sbrang rtsi'am sbrang rtsi dang sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: dge slong dag bad kan gyi nad dang nad chen po'i sman chen po ni sbrang rtsi'am sbrang rtsi dang sbyar ba'o //
translated: Monks, honey or something mixed with honey is a great medicine for phlegm and other serious illnesses.

original: rlung dang mkhris pa dang bad kan ni nad ma yin gyi nad kyi rgyu yin pas nad ces bstan to //
analyzed: rlung dang mkhris pa dang bad kan ni nad ma yin gyi nad kyi rgyu yin pas nad ces bstan to //
translated: Wind, bile, and phlegm are not illnesses, but are taught to be illnesses because they are the causes of illnesses.

original: 'dod chags kyi rgyun nye bar bcad pa ma yin te /🔽de mngon sum du ma gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gnyen po mngon sum du gyur pa'i tshe na /
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi rgyun nye bar bcad pa ma yin te / de mngon sum du ma gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gnyen po mngon sum du gyur pa'i tshe na /
translated: The continuum of attachment is not severed,🔽because it is not manifest.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs mngon du gyur par mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs mngon du gyur par mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When the antidote is manifest, it is not reasonable for the opposing factor to be manifest.

original: 'o na ci zhe na de'i rgyu @127a * //
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na de'i rgyu @127a * //
translated: What is it then? It is the cause of that,

original: dang sa bon te /
analyzed: dang sa bon te /
translated: and the seed of that.

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags kyi'o //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags kyi'o //
translated: That means the cause of attachment.

original: de las yang de 'byung ba ni de'i rgyu dang / phra rgyas dang / sa bon zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de las yang de 'byung ba ni de'i rgyu dang / phra rgyas dang / sa bon zhes bya'o //
translated: The arising of that again is called the cause of that, the cause of that, and the seed of that.

original: de gnyis ni reg bya ma yin gyi de gnyis kyi rgyu reg bya yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de gnyis ni reg bya ma yin gyi de gnyis kyi rgyu reg bya yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: Those two are not tactile objects, but the cause of those two is a tactile object.

original: de gnyis kyi zhes bya ba ni bkres pa dang skom pa gnyis kyi'o ;
analyzed: de gnyis kyi zhes bya ba ni bkres pa dang skom pa gnyis kyi'o ;
translated: The two means hunger and thirst.

original: / zan 'dod pa ni bkres pa ste /
analyzed: / zan 'dod pa ni bkres pa ste /
translated: Hunger is the desire for food.

original: sems las byung ba'i chos so //
analyzed: sems las byung ba'i chos so //
translated: It is a mental factor.

original: de'i rgyu reg bya'i bye brag la bkres pa zhes ston to //
analyzed: de'i rgyu reg bya'i bye brag la bkres pa zhes ston to //
translated: Its cause is a particular kind of tangible object that is called hunger.

original: de bzhin du 'thung 'dod pa ni skom pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'thung 'dod pa ni skom pa ste /
translated: Thirst is the desire for drink.

original: de'i rgyu reg bya'i bye brag la skom pa zhes ston to //🔽chos thams cad kyi sa bon gyi gzhi gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba'i chos thams cad kyi sa bon gyi gzhi byed pa'i sgo nas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa bstan te /🔽gzhan chos thams cad kyi sa bon gyi gzhi byed par mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rgyu reg bya'i bye brag la skom pa zhes ston to // chos thams cad kyi sa bon gyi gzhi gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba'i chos thams cad kyi sa bon gyi gzhi byed pa'i sgo nas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa bstan te / gzhan chos thams cad kyi sa bon gyi gzhi byed par mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Its cause is a particular kind of tangible object that is called thirst.🔽The foundation that is the seed of all dharmas is taught to be the store consciousness.🔽It is not reasonable that anything other than the store consciousness could be the foundation that is the seed of all dharmas.

original: 'gog pa'i snyoms par zhugs pa rnams la de las gzhan pa'i rnam par shes pa yod pa ma yin pas chos thams cad kyi sa bon chad par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i snyoms par zhugs pa rnams la de las gzhan pa'i rnam par shes pa yod pa ma yin pas chos thams cad kyi sa bon chad par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the store consciousness did not exist, there would be no consciousness in beings who have entered the state of composure that is a cessation. Therefore, it would follow, absurdly, that all the seeds of all dharmas would be cut off.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni gtso bo dang / bdag gi rdzas su gyur bar thal bar yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni gtso bo dang / bdag gi rdzas su gyur bar thal bar yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: The alaya consciousness is not the primary cause or the substantial self,

original: mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has the characteristics of impermanence, suffering, emptiness, and nonself.

original: gang dag gis rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug chos thams cad skye bar nus pa dang ldan no zhes pa des kyang de nyid gtso bo dang bdag gi rdzas dang / chos mi mthun pa yi na par brjod par nus kyi gzhan la ma yin no //
analyzed: gang dag gis rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug chos thams cad skye bar nus pa dang ldan no zhes pa des kyang de nyid gtso bo dang bdag gi rdzas dang / chos mi mthun pa yi na par brjod par nus kyi gzhan la ma yin no //
translated: Those who say that the six collections of consciousness are endowed with the power to produce all dharmas can say that the alaya is the primary cause and the substantial self, but not the other consciousnesses, because they are not endowed with the power to produce all dharmas.

original: chos thams cad skye bar nus pa dang ldan pa ma yin no zhes brjod par mi nus so //
analyzed: chos thams cad skye bar nus pa dang ldan pa ma yin no zhes brjod par mi nus so //
translated: They cannot say that the other consciousnesses are not endowed with the power to produce all dharmas.

original: mdo sde pa rnams la ni ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed med pa na gzhan du ji ltar dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i chos skye bar 'gyur /
analyzed: mdo sde pa rnams la ni ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed med pa na gzhan du ji ltar dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i chos skye bar 'gyur /
translated: For the Sautrantikas, who do not accept nonassociated formative factors, how can virtuous, nonvirtuous, and neutral dharmas arise in other states?🔽The sutras also say:

original: mdo sde las kyang 'di skad du sems zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: mdo sde las kyang 'di skad du sems zhes bya ba'am /
translated: The mind is the forerunner of all dharmas.

original: yid dang rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba la yun ring por dad pa yongs su bsgos /
analyzed: yid dang rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba la yun ring por dad pa yongs su bsgos /
translated: It is called mind and consciousness because it is thoroughly imbued with faith for a long time,

original: tshul khrims dang thos pa dang gtong ba dang shes rab yongs su bsgos na /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang thos pa dang gtong ba dang shes rab yongs su bsgos na /
translated: and it is thoroughly imbued with morality, learning, generosity, and wisdom.

original: gong du 'gro bar 'gyur khyad par du 'gro zhing mtho ris su 'gro ba ston to zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gong du 'gro bar 'gyur khyad par du 'gro zhing mtho ris su 'gro ba ston to zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is taught that it goes higher, it goes to a special state, it goes to a higher realm.

original: len pa'i rnam par shes pa yang de yin te /
analyzed: len pa'i rnam par shes pa yang de yin te /
translated: It is also the appropriating consciousness,

original: ris mthun pa gzhan du nying mtshams sbyar ba nas brtsams te nam ma shi'i bar du lus 'dzin par @127b byed par ston te /
analyzed: ris mthun pa gzhan du nying mtshams sbyar ba nas brtsams te nam ma shi'i bar du lus 'dzin par @127b byed par ston te /
translated: because it is taught that it appropriates the body from the time of reincarnation in another life in the same species until death.

original: gzhan de lta bu mi rigs pa'i phyir ro zhes phyis 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan de lta bu mi rigs pa'i phyir ro zhes phyis 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is because it is not reasonable to assume any other consciousness to do this, as will be explained later.

original: rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa yang de yin te zhes bya ba ni mi la sogs pa'i lus kyi dngos po'i rten byed pa'i sgo nas ston te /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa yang de yin te zhes bya ba ni mi la sogs pa'i lus kyi dngos po'i rten byed pa'i sgo nas ston te /
translated: It is also the consciousness that matures, because it is taught that it is the support for the body of humans and so on.

original: gzhan la rnam par smin pa'i mtshan nyid dang 'thad pa de dag mi rigs par phyis 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan la rnam par smin pa'i mtshan nyid dang 'thad pa de dag mi rigs par phyis 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The characteristics and feasibility of karmic maturation for others will be explained later.🔽Because the individual births are the karmic maturation of distinct karma.

original: skye ba so so ni las tha dad pa'i rnam par smin pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de bas na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni las tha dad pa'i rnam par smin pa so sor skye ba yin te /
analyzed: skye ba so so ni las tha dad pa'i rnam par smin pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de bas na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni las tha dad pa'i rnam par smin pa so sor skye ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, the ālaya consciousness is the individual birth that is the karmic maturation of distinct karma.

original: de bas na rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa bstan to //
analyzed: de bas na rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa bstan to //
translated: Therefore, it is taught to be the consciousness that is the karmic maturation.

original: ji ltar na de skye ba so so las thar pa'i rnam par smin pa yin na /🔽de'i phyir las tha dad pa'i shugs yongs su zad pa'i phyir dang zhes smras te /
analyzed: ji ltar na de skye ba so so las thar pa'i rnam par smin pa yin na / de'i phyir las tha dad pa'i shugs yongs su zad pa'i phyir dang zhes smras te /
translated: How is it the karmic maturation of distinct births?🔽Therefore, it is said, “because the force of distinct karma is exhausted.”

original: las tha dad pa'i 'phen pa yongs su zad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: las tha dad pa'i 'phen pa yongs su zad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: This means that the impetus of distinct karma is exhausted.

original: 'chi ba'i dus kyi tshe skye ba snga ma'i las kyis 'phangs pa'i rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa'i shugs yongs su gtugs nas /
analyzed: 'chi ba'i dus kyi tshe skye ba snga ma'i las kyis 'phangs pa'i rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa'i shugs yongs su gtugs nas /
translated: At the time of death, the force of the karmic maturation of consciousness that is impelled by karma from a previous birth is exhausted.

original: skyes nas dang lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las gzhan goms pa'i 'jug pa rnyed pa'i phyir lus kyi dngos po de dang de'i gnas nyid du rnam par smin te /
analyzed: skyes nas dang lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las gzhan goms pa'i 'jug pa rnyed pa'i phyir lus kyi dngos po de dang de'i gnas nyid du rnam par smin te /
translated: Because of the habitual engagement of karma to be experienced after rebirth and in a third life, that physical body ripens in the very place where it will be reborn.

original: de ni yang srid pa mngon par 'grub par bya ba'i phyir bag chags kyi gnas skabs kyi las 'jug pa rnyed de /
analyzed: de ni yang srid pa mngon par 'grub par bya ba'i phyir bag chags kyi gnas skabs kyi las 'jug pa rnyed de /
translated: That is, in order to actualize rebirth, karma in the state of latent tendencies engages.

original: srid par gyur na lus kyi dngos po de dang de'i gnas nyid du kun gzhi rnam par shes pa rnam par smin par byed do //
analyzed: srid par gyur na lus kyi dngos po de dang de'i gnas nyid du kun gzhi rnam par shes pa rnam par smin par byed do //
translated: When one is reborn, the foundation consciousness ripens in the very place where that physical body will be.

original: de dang de'i zhes bya ba ni lha dang mi la sogs pa'i lus kyi dngos po'i gnas nyid la bya'o //
analyzed: de dang de'i zhes bya ba ni lha dang mi la sogs pa'i lus kyi dngos po'i gnas nyid la bya'o //
translated: The phrase “in that and that place” refers to the place where the physical body of a god, human, and so on will be.

original: lus kyi dngos po'i gnas yin pa yang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni lus kyi dngos po de dang de 'brel par 'jug pa yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: lus kyi dngos po'i gnas yin pa yang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni lus kyi dngos po de dang de 'brel par 'jug pa yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The foundation consciousness is the place of the physical body because it engages in connection with that physical body.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams dang sa gzhan dag na lus kyi dngos por gyur pa dag rnam par smin pa ma yin pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams dang sa gzhan dag na lus kyi dngos por gyur pa dag rnam par smin pa ma yin pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no non-maturation of the body in the formless realm and in other stages.

original: btsun pa sa ston pa rnams kyis srid pa'i yan lag gi rnam par shes pa yang de yin te zhes bya ba ni nyi tshe ba gzhan gyi chos mngon pa las srid pa'i gnas byed par rab tu grags pa ston to //
analyzed: btsun pa sa ston pa rnams kyis srid pa'i yan lag gi rnam par shes pa yang de yin te zhes bya ba ni nyi tshe ba gzhan gyi chos mngon pa las srid pa'i gnas byed par rab tu grags pa ston to //
translated: Bhadanta-Sthavira says: “That consciousness is a member of existence.” He teaches the well-known Abhidharma of the Vaibhāṣikas.

original: yan lag dang gnas dang lus zhes bya ba don tha dad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yan lag dang gnas dang lus zhes bya ba don tha dad pa ma yin te /
translated: The terms “member,” “stage,” and “body” are not different in meaning.

original: lus med pa ni yan lag med pa zhes ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus med pa ni yan lag med pa zhes ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it teaches that that which is without a body is without members.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de gnas yongs su ma gyur na srid pa rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir ro zhes smras te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de gnas yongs su ma gyur na srid pa rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir ro zhes smras te /
translated: Therefore, he says, “because the continuum of existence is not interrupted when the stage is not transformed.”

original: de gnas @128a * //
analyzed: de gnas @128a * //
translated: That stage

original: gyur pa yang gnyen po skyes pas kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi chos kyi bag chags ma lus par bcom pa yod na gzhan du skyes pa yin te /
analyzed: gyur pa yang gnyen po skyes pas kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi chos kyi bag chags ma lus par bcom pa yod na gzhan du skyes pa yin te /
translated: is transformed when the antidote arises and the latent tendencies of afflicted phenomena are completely destroyed, and it is born elsewhere.

original: gang la yang srid pa'i yan lag gi rnam par shes pa gzhag pa ma yin no //🔽dmigs pa dang rnam pa yongs su chad pa'o zhes bya ba ni rgyu ba shin tu phra bas de'i dmigs pa dang rnam pa yongs su chad pa'am /
analyzed: gang la yang srid pa'i yan lag gi rnam par shes pa gzhag pa ma yin no // dmigs pa dang rnam pa yongs su chad pa'o zhes bya ba ni rgyu ba shin tu phra bas de'i dmigs pa dang rnam pa yongs su chad pa'am /
translated: It is not the case that the consciousness that is a member of existence is posited in any of them.

original: dmigs pa dang rnam pa chad pa mngon du gyur pa'i phyir dmigs pa dang rnam pa yongs su ma chad pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang rnam pa chad pa mngon du gyur pa'i phyir dmigs pa dang rnam pa yongs su ma chad pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The determination of the object and aspect is because of the extremely subtle movement. The determination of the object and aspect should be understood as the non-determination of the object and aspect because the object and aspect are manifest.

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po gang gi nang du 'dus she na zhes bya ba ni nye bar len pa dang bcas pa thams cad nye bar len pa'i phung por 'dus pa yin pas de ni nye bar len pa'i phung por bsdu ba brjod par bya dgos pa'o
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po gang gi nang du 'dus she na zhes bya ba ni nye bar len pa dang bcas pa thams cad nye bar len pa'i phung por 'dus pa yin pas de ni nye bar len pa'i phung por bsdu ba brjod par bya dgos pa'o
translated: In which of the appropriating aggregates is it included? Since everything that is associated with appropriation is included in the appropriating aggregates, it must be stated that it is included in the appropriating aggregates.

original: // rnam par shes pa nye bar len pa'i phung por ro zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir mtshan nyid kyis 'dus pa yin par bstan to //
analyzed: // rnam par shes pa nye bar len pa'i phung por ro zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir mtshan nyid kyis 'dus pa yin par bstan to //
translated: It is included in the appropriating aggregate of consciousness because it is characterized by consciousness. It is shown to be included by its characteristics.

original: sems pa'i tshogs drug go zhes bya ba ni gzhan 'dun pa dang / reg pa dang yid la byed pa la sogs pa 'du byed nye bar len pa'i phung por 'dus pa med pa yang ma yin no //🔽tshe dang ldan pa gsus po che mi dge ba zhes bya ba ni lus kyi las mi dge ba dang zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa gzhan yang mi dge ba ma yin pa ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sems pa'i tshogs drug go zhes bya ba ni gzhan 'dun pa dang / reg pa dang yid la byed pa la sogs pa 'du byed nye bar len pa'i phung por 'dus pa med pa yang ma yin no // tshe dang ldan pa gsus po che mi dge ba zhes bya ba ni lus kyi las mi dge ba dang zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa gzhan yang mi dge ba ma yin pa ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The six collections of intention are not excluded from the appropriating aggregates of karmic predispositions, such as aspiration, contact, and attention.🔽The Venerable Mahākauṣṭhila said, “There is no nonvirtue that is not included in the six collections of consciousness.”

original: de ltar rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug ces bya ba 'di ni yongs su ma rdzogs pa yin par ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug ces bya ba 'di ni yongs su ma rdzogs pa yin par ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: This statement shows that the six collections of consciousness are incomplete.

original: de ni dgongs pa can du rigs te /
analyzed: de ni dgongs pa can du rigs te /
translated: This statement should be understood as having a special intention.

original: de las gzhan pa'i chos de dag rnams zhes rgyas par 'byung ba la sems pa'i tshogs drug po de las gzhan pa'i chos 'dun pa dang / reg pa dang yid la byed pa la sogs pa rnams mdo sde gzhan las gsungs pa'i phyir ci zhe na /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i chos de dag rnams zhes rgyas par 'byung ba la sems pa'i tshogs drug po de las gzhan pa'i chos 'dun pa dang / reg pa dang yid la byed pa la sogs pa rnams mdo sde gzhan las gsungs pa'i phyir ci zhe na /
translated: because they are mentioned in other sūtras.

original: 'du byed nye bar len pa'i phung po gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'du byed nye bar len pa'i phung po gang zhe na /
translated: What is the appropriated aggregate of formation?

original: sems pa'i tshogs drug go zhes bstan pa 'di dgongs pa can du rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: sems pa'i tshogs drug go zhes bstan pa 'di dgongs pa can du rigs pa yin no //
translated: It is the six collections of intention.🔽This teaching is reasonable as having a specific intention.🔽Other nonvirtuous phenomena are attachment, aversion, and so on,

original: lus kyi las mi dge ba la sogs pa de dag las gzhan mi dge ba'i chos 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa rnams mdo sde gzhan las gsungs pa'i phyir ci zhe na /
analyzed: lus kyi las mi dge ba la sogs pa de dag las gzhan mi dge ba'i chos 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa rnams mdo sde gzhan las gsungs pa'i phyir ci zhe na /
translated: because they are mentioned in other sūtras.

original: lus kyi las mi dge ba zhes rgyas par 'byung ba rnams dgongs pa can du rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: lus kyi las mi dge ba zhes rgyas par 'byung ba rnams dgongs pa can du rigs pa yin no //
translated: This is reasonable as having a specific intention.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni gang du yang ma @128b gsungs te /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni gang du yang ma @128b gsungs te /
translated: The foundation consciousness is not mentioned anywhere.

original: de bas 'di bstan pa dgongs pa can yin par brtag bar nus pa ma yin zhes ston to //
analyzed: de bas 'di bstan pa dgongs pa can yin par brtag bar nus pa ma yin zhes ston to //
translated: Thus, it is not possible to consider this teaching to be of provisional meaning.🔽The phrase “and most of the sūtras spoken by the Buddha have disappeared” shows that it is not possible to say that the teaching of the Mahāyāna did not exist in a certain place, because the sūtras spoken by the Buddha have disappeared.

original: zhal nas gsungs pa'i mdo sde yang phal cher nub la zhes bya ba 'dis ni gang du yang ma gsungs so zhes bya bar mi rung ring ba'i gtan tshigs ston te zhal nas gsungs pa mang du nub pa yin na gang du yang ma gsungs pa 'di ji🔽ltar nges par bya /🔽gsung rab 'di yang da ltar ni phal cher 'phros pa dang zhes bya ba ni nyi tshe ba'i mdo sde dang / chos mngon pa dang / 'dul ba dag 'phros te kha cig tu ni cung zad kyang ma gsungs pa de nyid gzhan nas gsungs so ;
analyzed: zhal nas gsungs pa'i mdo sde yang phal cher nub la zhes bya ba 'dis ni gang du yang ma gsungs so zhes bya bar mi rung ring ba'i gtan tshigs ston te zhal nas gsungs pa mang du nub pa yin na gang du yang ma gsungs pa 'di ji ltar nges par bya / gsung rab 'di yang da ltar ni phal cher 'phros pa dang zhes bya ba ni nyi tshe ba'i mdo sde dang / chos mngon pa dang / 'dul ba dag 'phros te kha cig tu ni cung zad kyang ma gsungs pa de nyid gzhan nas gsungs so ;
translated: How can one be certain that the Mahāyāna sūtras were not spoken by the Buddha?🔽The phrase “and this scriptural collection has been widely disseminated in the present” shows that the Mahāyāna sūtras were spoken by the Buddha because the Mahāyāna sūtras have been widely disseminated.

original: / kha cig tu ni gzhan du gsungs so //
analyzed: / kha cig tu ni gzhan du gsungs so //
translated: The phrase “and this scriptural collection has been widely disseminated in the present” shows that the Mahāyāna sūtras were spoken by the Buddha because the Mahāyāna sūtras have been widely disseminated.

original: gzhan las ni gzhan du gsungs pas nyi tshe ba'i mdo sde dang / 'dul ba dang / chos mngon pa thams cad mngon du ma gyur pas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni gang du yang ma gsungs so zhes bya ba 'di ji ltar nges par bya /
analyzed: gzhan las ni gzhan du gsungs pas nyi tshe ba'i mdo sde dang / 'dul ba dang / chos mngon pa thams cad mngon du ma gyur pas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni gang du yang ma gsungs so zhes bya ba 'di ji ltar nges par bya /
translated: Since it is taught differently in other sūtras, it is a sūtra of limited meaning, and since it is not evident in all the vinaya, sūtra, and abhidharma, it is not taught anywhere that there is a foundation consciousness.

original: 'gro ba'i rtsa ba dag nub pa'i phyir ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'gro ba'i rtsa ba dag nub pa'i phyir ci zhe na /
translated: Why is it that the root of beings has disappeared?

original: zhal nas gsungs pa phal cher nub pa yin te /
analyzed: zhal nas gsungs pa phal cher nub pa yin te /
translated: Most of the teachings of the Buddha have disappeared.

original: gsung rab 'di yang da ltar ni phal cher 'phros par ston te /
analyzed: gsung rab 'di yang da ltar ni phal cher 'phros par ston te /
translated: This scripture teaches that even now most of the teachings have disappeared.

original: de lta ma yin na nyi tshe ba tha dad pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na nyi tshe ba tha dad pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were not so, it would not be a limited teaching.

original: nyi tshe ba gzhan las rnam grangs kyi srid pa'i yan lag gi rnam par shes pa dang / kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang / rnam grangs kyi rtsa ba'i rnam par shes pa zhes gsungs pa na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni gang du yang ma gsungs so zhes ji skad du 'di brjod /
analyzed: nyi tshe ba gzhan las rnam grangs kyi srid pa'i yan lag gi rnam par shes pa dang / kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang / rnam grangs kyi rtsa ba'i rnam par shes pa zhes gsungs pa na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni gang du yang ma gsungs so zhes ji skad du 'di brjod /
translated: When other limited teachings speak of the consciousness that is a link of existence, the foundation consciousness, and the root consciousness, how can you say that the foundation consciousness is not taught anywhere?

original: de las kun gzhi rnam par shes pa zhes rang gi sgras gang du yang ma gsungs so zhes zer na de la ci de tsam gyis rab tu bkag pa yin zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de las kun gzhi rnam par shes pa zhes rang gi sgras gang du yang ma gsungs so zhes zer na de la ci de tsam gyis rab tu bkag pa yin zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: But if you say that the term “storehouse consciousness” is not mentioned anywhere, then we would say that this much is a refutation.

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug la ma gtogs pa'i dngos po yod pa yin pas rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug bstan pa ni dgongs pa can nyid yin par grub pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug la ma gtogs pa'i dngos po yod pa yin pas rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug bstan pa ni dgongs pa can nyid yin par grub pa yin no //
translated: Since there is no entity that is not included in the six collections of consciousness, it is established that the teaching of the six collections of consciousness is provisional.

original: rnam par shes pa bdun pa yod pas de ji ltar 'dod pa don dang rjes su mthun pa'i ming byed pa ni srid pa'i yan lag gi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa bdun pa yod pas de ji ltar 'dod pa don dang rjes su mthun pa'i ming byed pa ni srid pa'i yan lag gi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'am /
translated: Since there is a seventh consciousness, it is possible to give it a name that accords with its object and its nature. It is called the consciousness that is a member of cyclic existence,

original: rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa dang len pa'i rnam par shes pa'am /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa dang len pa'i rnam par shes pa'am /
translated: or the consciousness that is the result of evolution, or the appropriating consciousness,

original: rtsa ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / rkyen gyi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba de la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / rkyen gyi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba de la sogs pa yin no //
translated: or the fundamental consciousness, or the conditional consciousness.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: gal te zhal nas gsungs pa @129a * //
analyzed: gal te zhal nas gsungs pa @129a * //
translated: If the teachings of the Buddha

original: yang mang du nub la /
analyzed: yang mang du nub la /
translated: are disappearing,

original: gsung rab 'di yang da ltar ni phal cher 'phros pa yin pas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa brtag par bya ba yin ni /
analyzed: gsung rab 'di yang da ltar ni phal cher 'phros pa yin pas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa brtag par bya ba yin ni /
translated: Since this scripture is now widespread, the foundation consciousness should be investigated.

original: 'o na gtso bo dang skyes bu la sogs pa yang de lta bu yin pas mu stegs byed kyis yongs su brtags pa yang brtag par bya ba yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gtso bo dang skyes bu la sogs pa yang de lta bu yin pas mu stegs byed kyis yongs su brtags pa yang brtag par bya ba yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Well then, since the primal matter, purusha, and so on are also like that, the imputations of the tirthikas should also be investigated.

original: de ni rnar mi 'ong ste /
analyzed: de ni rnar mi 'ong ste /
translated: That is not so.

original: kho bo gtan tshigs 'dis kun gzhi rnam par shes pa sgrub par byed pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: kho bo gtan tshigs 'dis kun gzhi rnam par shes pa sgrub par byed pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: We do not use this argument to prove the existence of foundation consciousness.

original: 'on kyang ma gsungs pa'i phyir ro zhes khyod 'gag par byed pa de bas na zhal nas gsungs pa yang mang du nub la /
analyzed: 'on kyang ma gsungs pa'i phyir ro zhes khyod 'gag par byed pa de bas na zhal nas gsungs pa yang mang du nub la /
translated: However, you are refuting the position that it is not taught in the scriptures, and thus many teachings of the Buddha have disappeared.

original: gsung rab 'di yang 'phros pa yin pas /
analyzed: gsung rab 'di yang 'phros pa yin pas /
translated: Since this scripture is now widespread,

original: zhal nas ma gsungs so zhes ji ltar nges par bya zhes bya ba 'di smras te /
analyzed: zhal nas ma gsungs so zhes ji ltar nges par bya zhes bya ba 'di smras te /
translated: how can you be certain that it was not taught by the Buddha?

original: de bas na ji ltar ma gsungs pa de ltar khyed cag gis brjod par bya dgos so zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de bas na ji ltar ma gsungs pa de ltar khyed cag gis brjod par bya dgos so zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, just as it was not taught, you should not speak of it.

original: gtso bo dang skyes bu la sogs pa gang yin pa ni chos kyi phyag rgya dang 'gal ba'i phyir dang / rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir brtag par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: gtso bo dang skyes bu la sogs pa gang yin pa ni chos kyi phyag rgya dang 'gal ba'i phyir dang / rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir brtag par bya ba yin te /
translated: The principal, the person, etc., are to be examined because they are contrary to the Dharma-seal and because there is no inference.

original: rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / bdag dang / mi stong bar rnam par shes pa la sogs pa la ni rjes su dpag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / bdag dang / mi stong bar rnam par shes pa la sogs pa la ni rjes su dpag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the inference of permanence, happiness, self, and the non-empty with regard to consciousness, etc.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / stong pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir chos kyi phyag rgya dang 'gal ba med pa yin no //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / stong pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir chos kyi phyag rgya dang 'gal ba med pa yin no //
translated: The store-consciousness is not contrary to the Dharma-seal because it has the characteristics of impermanence, suffering, non-self, and emptiness.

original: rjes su dpag pa dang bcas pa yang yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa dang bcas pa yang yin no //
translated: It is also accompanied by inference.

original: 'gog pa'i snyoms par zhugs pa rnams la de las gzhan pa'i rnam par shes pa med pa'i phyir lus mtha' dag ma zin pa yin par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i snyoms par zhugs pa rnams la de las gzhan pa'i rnam par shes pa med pa'i phyir lus mtha' dag ma zin pa yin par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: For those who have entered the attainment of cessation, the entire body would not be grasped because there is no other consciousness apart from that.

original: de las gzhan pa'i rnam par shes pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i rnam par shes pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because another consciousness is not tenable.

original: srid pa'i rtse mor skyes pa rnams zag pa med pa'i lam mngon du gyur pa na de las gzhan srid pa'i rtse mo pa'i lus kyi dngos po mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mor skyes pa rnams zag pa med pa'i lam mngon du gyur pa na de las gzhan srid pa'i rtse mo pa'i lus kyi dngos po mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is illogical that those born at the peak of cyclic existence would possess a body of the peak of cyclic existence other than that when they manifest the uncontaminated path.

original: nyi tshe ba gzhan las kyang rnam grangs kyis srid pa'i yan lag gi rnam par shes pa dang rtsa ba'i rnam par shes pa zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: nyi tshe ba gzhan las kyang rnam grangs kyis srid pa'i yan lag gi rnam par shes pa dang rtsa ba'i rnam par shes pa zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro /
translated: And because the other limited states are also called the consciousness that is a link of cyclic existence and the fundamental consciousness.

original: yang 'dir rigs pa ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa med par 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa gzhag par mi nus pa dang zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa'i snyoms par zhugs pa rnams la de mi rigs so zhes sngar bstan zin to //
analyzed: yang 'dir rigs pa ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa med par 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa gzhag par mi nus pa dang zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa'i snyoms par zhugs pa rnams la de mi rigs so zhes sngar bstan zin to //
translated: Here, the reason that it is impossible to posit consciousness conditioned by formations without a foundation consciousness has already been explained above, that it is illogical for those who have entered the meditative attainment of cessation.

original: nying mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par shes pa yang 'du byed kyi rkyen @129b gyis rnam par shes pa yin par gang gi phyir mi srid pa yin te /
analyzed: nying mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par shes pa yang 'du byed kyi rkyen @129b gyis rnam par shes pa yin par gang gi phyir mi srid pa yin te /
translated: And it is also impossible that the consciousness that links with a rebirth is consciousness conditioned by formations.

original: de mi srid pa yang sngar bstan zin to //
analyzed: de mi srid pa yang sngar bstan zin to //
translated: And the impossibility of that has already been explained.

original: lus zin pa nyid kyang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa med par gzhag par mi nus so //
analyzed: lus zin pa nyid kyang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa med par gzhag par mi nus so //
translated: And it is impossible to posit the body’s continuity without the foundation consciousness.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: de'i phyir de las gzhan pa'i rnam par shes pa ni nam ma shi'i bar lus mtha' dag khyab par gnas pa ma yin no zhes smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de las gzhan pa'i rnam par shes pa ni nam ma shi'i bar lus mtha' dag khyab par gnas pa ma yin no zhes smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that a consciousness other than that does not exist to pervade the entire body until the end of life.

original: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa ni mig la sogs pa'i dbang po la brten te skye ba'i phyir lus mtha' dag la khyab pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa ni mig la sogs pa'i dbang po la brten te skye ba'i phyir lus mtha' dag la khyab pa ma yin no //
translated: The visual consciousness, etc., do not pervade the entire body because they arise in dependence on the eye faculty, etc.

original: lus kyi rnam par shes pa yang lus mtha' dag la khyab pa ma yin te /
analyzed: lus kyi rnam par shes pa yang lus mtha' dag la khyab pa ma yin te /
translated: The body consciousness also does not pervade the entire body.

original: reg bya'i yul dang 'brel pa'i phyogs la brten te skye ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: reg bya'i yul dang 'brel pa'i phyogs la brten te skye ba'i phyir te /
translated: It arises in dependence on the part of the body that is in contact with a tangible object.

original: lus kyi dbang po'i phyogs tsam la lus kyi rnam par shes pa skye ba de tsam nyid la tshor ba yongs su gcod pa yin no //
analyzed: lus kyi dbang po'i phyogs tsam la lus kyi rnam par shes pa skye ba de tsam nyid la tshor ba yongs su gcod pa yin no //
translated: The body consciousness arises in just the part of the body that is the body faculty, and feeling is determined in just that part.

original: de bas na de nyid des zin pa yin par grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na de nyid des zin pa yin par grub pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is established that that part of the body is grasped by that consciousness.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pas don zab mo sems pa ni snying ga kho nar gnas pas lus thams cad la khyab pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pas don zab mo sems pa ni snying ga kho nar gnas pas lus thams cad la khyab pa ma yin no //
translated: The mental consciousness is associated with the formative forces and is concerned with profound meaning. It is located only in the heart and does not pervade the whole body.

original: de las gzhan yang ma shi'i bar du gnas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de las gzhan yang ma shi'i bar du gnas pa ma yin te /
translated: It does not remain in the body until death,

original: 'di ltar mig gi rnam par shes pa'i mjug thogs su rna ba'i rnam par shes pa skye ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar mig gi rnam par shes pa'i mjug thogs su rna ba'i rnam par shes pa skye ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: because the ear consciousness arises immediately after the eye consciousness and so on.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni lus thams cad nye bar len cing /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni lus thams cad nye bar len cing /
translated: The store-consciousness appropriates the whole body and

original: lus kun la khyab pa yin te /
analyzed: lus kun la khyab pa yin te /
translated: pervades the whole body.

original: rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa dang 'brel pa'i phyir lus dang lus kyi dbang po bzhin du ma shi'i bar du gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa dang 'brel pa'i phyir lus dang lus kyi dbang po bzhin du ma shi'i bar du gnas pa yin no //
translated: It remains in the body until death, like the body and the body-sense-faculty, because it is associated with the consciousness that is the result of evolution.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yul na mi gnas par ji ltar 'grub ce na /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yul na mi gnas par ji ltar 'grub ce na /
translated: How is it established that the store-consciousness is not located in a particular place?

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa rlung gi khams bzhin du zhum pa'am /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa rlung gi khams bzhin du zhum pa'am /
translated: The store-consciousness is like the wind-element in that it is not located in a particular place.

original: rgyas shing lus mtha' dag la khyab pa ma yin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyas shing lus mtha' dag la khyab pa ma yin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: But it is not extensive and does not pervade the entire body.

original: 'on kyang lus mtha' dag dang / kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gnyis phan tshun 'brel cing 'jug pa yin pa'i phyir lus mtha' dag la khyab pa yin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang lus mtha' dag dang / kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gnyis phan tshun 'brel cing 'jug pa yin pa'i phyir lus mtha' dag la khyab pa yin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: However, it should be said that the entire body is pervaded by the store consciousness, because the entire body and the store consciousness are mutually related and function together.

original: de bas na brgal du med pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na brgal du med pa'o //
translated: Therefore, there is no need to raise the question.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams su skyes pa rnams kyi nyon mongs pa can gyi dge ba dang zhes rgya cher 'byung ba ni 'dod pa dang gzugs kyi khams su skyes pa rnams la ni nyon mongs pa can gyi dge ba dang / zag pa med pa'i sems la gzugs su rnam par smin pa de'i 'gro bas bsdus pa rnams la smin pa'i rdzas yod pa @130a * //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams su skyes pa rnams kyi nyon mongs pa can gyi dge ba dang zhes rgya cher 'byung ba ni 'dod pa dang gzugs kyi khams su skyes pa rnams la ni nyon mongs pa can gyi dge ba dang / zag pa med pa'i sems la gzugs su rnam par smin pa de'i 'gro bas bsdus pa rnams la smin pa'i rdzas yod pa @130a * //
translated: The text states, “The afflicted wholesome and the non-defined states of those born in the formless realm.” The afflicted wholesome and the nondefined states of those born in the desire and form realms have real entities that mature in form, because they are included in the destinies that are attracted by form.

original: yin no // gzugs med pa'i khams na ni gzugs yod pa ma yin pa de bas na der skyes pa rnams kyi dge ba nyon mongs pa can dang / zag pa med pa'i sems la kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la ma gtogs pa rnam par smin pa'i rdzas gzhag par mi nus te /🔽rnam smin lung bstan ma yin chos //
analyzed: yin no // gzugs med pa'i khams na ni gzugs yod pa ma yin pa de bas na der skyes pa rnams kyi dge ba nyon mongs pa can dang / zag pa med pa'i sems la kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la ma gtogs pa rnam par smin pa'i rdzas gzhag par mi nus te / rnam smin lung bstan ma yin chos //
translated: Form does not exist in the formless realm, therefore it is impossible to posit a substance that is the maturation of the foundation consciousness in the virtuous, afflicted, and uncontaminated minds of those born there.🔽The unobscured-neutral mind is the one that is the basis of maturation.

original: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said, “The unobscured-neutral phenomena are the basis of maturation.”

original: dge ba nyon mongs pa can dang / zag pa med pa'i sems dag ni rnam par smin pa dang 'brel pa'i phyir lus kyi dngos po dang / 'gro bar gtogs pa dang / rnam par smin pas bsdus pa yin no zhes bya ba thams cad dang 'gal ba yin no//
analyzed: dge ba nyon mongs pa can dang / zag pa med pa'i sems dag ni rnam par smin pa dang 'brel pa'i phyir lus kyi dngos po dang / 'gro bar gtogs pa dang / rnam par smin pas bsdus pa yin no zhes bya ba thams cad dang 'gal ba yin no//
translated: Because the virtuous, afflicted, and uncontaminated minds are related to maturation, it would contradict all of the treatises to say that they are included in the body, included in the realms, and included in maturation.

original: ris mthun pa dang / srog gi dbang bo'i rdzas gzhan ni cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: ris mthun pa dang / srog gi dbang bo'i rdzas gzhan ni cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin na /
translated: There is not even the slightest substance that is a different class, or a life force.

original: dge ba la sogs pa'i sems gang zhig de'i 'gro bas bsdus par 'gyur ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: dge ba la sogs pa'i sems gang zhig de'i 'gro bas bsdus par 'gyur ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: What virtuous and so on mind is included in that realm?

original: rnam par smin pa'i phung po 'dra ba 'phangs pa tsam la de nye bar gdags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i phung po 'dra ba 'phangs pa tsam la de nye bar gdags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is merely the projecting of a similar ripened aggregate and it is designated as such.

original: 'dra ba 'phangs pa tsam ni rdzas gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dra ba 'phangs pa tsam ni rdzas gzhan ma yin te /
translated: The mere projecting of a similar aggregate is not a different substance,

original: 'bras la sogs pa'i sdong bu 'dra ba 'phen pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'bras la sogs pa'i sdong bu 'dra ba 'phen pa bzhin no //
translated: just as the projecting of a similar stalk, etc. is not a different substance.

original: srid pa'i rtse mor 'phags pa'i lam dang ldan pa rnams la zhes rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mor 'phags pa'i lam dang ldan pa rnams la zhes rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: The text continues: “For those possessing the noble path in the summit of existence.”

original: de'i sa pa'i lus kyi dngos po'i rdzas zhes bya ba ni srid pa'i rtse mo'i sa pa'i zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste ;
analyzed: de'i sa pa'i lus kyi dngos po'i rdzas zhes bya ba ni srid pa'i rtse mo'i sa pa'i zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste ;
translated: The substance of the body of that level means the substance of the body of the level of the summit of existence.

original: gzhag par mi nus zhes bya ba'i skabs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: gzhag par mi nus zhes bya ba'i skabs dang sbyar ro //
translated: It is impossible to posit it as a different substance.

original: de'i sa pa'i 'phags pa'i lam ni yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni srid pa'i rtse mo'i sa pa'i'o //
analyzed: de'i sa pa'i 'phags pa'i lam ni yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni srid pa'i rtse mo'i sa pa'i'o //
translated: The noble path of that level does not exist means the noble path of the level of the summit of existence.🔽For that reason, the Abhidharmakośa declares,

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'phags pa dag / ci yang med pa mngon byas nas //🔽srid rtse'i zag pa zad par byed //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'phags pa dag / ci yang med pa mngon byas nas // srid rtse'i zag pa zad par byed //
translated: Having manifested the āryas,

original: ces smras so //
analyzed: ces smras so //
translated: they eliminate the contaminants of the summit of existence.

original: ji ltar de dag shi ba yin //
analyzed: ji ltar de dag shi ba yin //
translated: How do they die?

original: zhes brjod par mi bya /
analyzed: zhes brjod par mi bya /
