analyzed: zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni shi ste gzugs kyi lus 'di nyid bor ba skye ba gzhan gyi dngos por yongs su 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Having died, having abandoned this very body of form, there is transformation into the entity of another birth.

original: ming gi @137a * //
analyzed: ming gi @137a * //
translated: Name-and-form

original: rgyun la ni dad pa dang / tshul khrims dang / thos pa dang / gtong ba dang / shes rab yongs su bsgos pas skye ba gzhan gyi dngos por yongs su 'gyur te /
analyzed: rgyun la ni dad pa dang / tshul khrims dang / thos pa dang / gtong ba dang / shes rab yongs su bsgos pas skye ba gzhan gyi dngos por yongs su 'gyur te /
translated: The stream is transformed into another existence by being perfumed with faith, morality, learning, generosity, and wisdom.

original: de la yang srid kyi rgyu las dang nyon mongs pas yongs su bsgos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la yang srid kyi rgyu las dang nyon mongs pas yongs su bsgos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For it is perfumed by karma and the afflictions, which are the causes of rebirth.

original: yongs su 'gyur ba ni gzhan du skye ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su 'gyur ba ni gzhan du skye ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Transformation should be understood as the arising of another state.

original: grangs can rnams kyi gnas pa'i rdzas kyi chos gzhan log na chos gzhan 'byung ba ni yongs su 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba lta bu ma yin no //
analyzed: grangs can rnams kyi gnas pa'i rdzas kyi chos gzhan log na chos gzhan 'byung ba ni yongs su 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba lta bu ma yin no //
translated: It is not like the transformation of the substance of the Sāṃkhyas, in which another property arises when one property of a substance ceases.🔽Now, the term “name” in the phrase “a formation not associated with mind, a designation by speech, a name” is explained in detail.

original: 'o na gang sems dang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed tshig bla dags ming zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni tshig gis ched du byas pa ni tshig bla dags yin te /
analyzed: 'o na gang sems dang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed tshig bla dags ming zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni tshig gis ched du byas pa ni tshig bla dags yin te /
translated: A designation is a term that is made.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is taught:

original: ngag ni ming la brten pa yin //🔽zhes bstan pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ngag ni ming la brten pa yin // zhes bstan pa lta bu'o //
translated: Speech is based on name.

original: yang na lhag pa'i tshig ni bla dags te /
analyzed: yang na lhag pa'i tshig ni bla dags te /
translated: Or else, a designation is a term that is superior.

original: ngag ni yid kyi brjod pa las gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngag ni yid kyi brjod pa las gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because speech is other than mental expression.

original: ji skad du bstan pa zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni phung po bzhi pa de dag ji skad du bstan pa ni /
analyzed: ji skad du bstan pa zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni phung po bzhi pa de dag ji skad du bstan pa ni /
translated: As it is taught in detail, those four aggregates are as it is taught.

original: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dmigs pa gzhan bskal pa rnams la yang ming gis 'dud par byed pas ming zhes bya'o zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dmigs pa gzhan bskal pa rnams la yang ming gis 'dud par byed pas ming zhes bya'o zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: The object of the past and future is also bent by name in the eons, therefore it is called name.

original: ming gis 'dud par byed pa ni gzhan du skye bar byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ming gis 'dud par byed pa ni gzhan du skye bar byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Bent by name means bent elsewhere, that is, produced elsewhere.

original: yang na 'dud par byed pa bzhin du 'dud par byed pas te /
analyzed: yang na 'dud par byed pa bzhin du 'dud par byed pas te /
translated: Or, like that which is bent, it is bent by bending.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa la sogs pa la gtod par byed pa'i phyir te phyin par byed ces bya ba'i don gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa la sogs pa la gtod par byed pa'i phyir te phyin par byed ces bya ba'i don gang yin pa'o //
translated: Because it directs to the past and future, etc., it is that which is bent, that is, it has the meaning of that which is directed.

original: bskal pa rnams la yang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni da ltar byung ba nye ba'i dmigs pa la yang nges par byed pa ste /
analyzed: bskal pa rnams la yang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni da ltar byung ba nye ba'i dmigs pa la yang nges par byed pa ste /
translated: Also in the eons, by the word also, it is determined in the present, the proximate object.

original: gang du ming thos pa tsam gyis kyang mngon sum ma yin pa la yang rnam par shes pa skye zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gang du ming thos pa tsam gyis kyang mngon sum ma yin pa la yang rnam par shes pa skye zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Even when it is not directly perceived, consciousness arises merely from hearing the name.

original: mig gi yul ni gzugs zhes 'jig rten na grags na zhes bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mig gi yul ni gzugs zhes 'jig rten na grags na zhes bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa'o //
translated: In the world, form is known as the object of the eye, such as blue.

original: 'dir 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa thams cad la ci'i phyir gzugs zhes bya zhe na zhes bya ba ni gsungs rab 'dir ram /
analyzed: 'dir 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa thams cad la ci'i phyir gzugs zhes bya zhe na zhes bya ba ni gsungs rab 'dir ram /
translated: Here, why is everything that is derived from the elements and the elements themselves called form?

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i mdo sde 'dir gzugs gang yin pa ci yang rung ste /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i mdo sde 'dir gzugs gang yin pa ci yang rung ste /
translated: In this scripture, or in the dependent origination sutra, whatever is form

original: de thams cad 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang / 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa'o zhes bya ba la'o //
analyzed: de thams cad 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang / 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa'o zhes bya ba la'o //
translated: is all of that, the four great elements and the four great elements as the cause.🔽Therefore, in another sutra, it is taught that form is that which is harmed.

original: de'i phyir / gnod par gyur pa de bas na gzugs zhes mdo gzhan las bstan te zhes bya ba ni dge slong de dag gnod @137b par gyur pa de bas na gzugs nye bar len pa'i phung po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir / gnod par gyur pa de bas na gzugs zhes mdo gzhan las bstan te zhes bya ba ni dge slong de dag gnod @137b par gyur pa de bas na gzugs nye bar len pa'i phung po zhes bya'o //
translated: The monks, because of that harm, form is called the appropriated aggregate.

original: cis gnod par gyur ce na /
analyzed: cis gnod par gyur ce na /
translated: What is the harm in that?

original: lag pa'i 'dus te reg pa dang / dbyug pa'i 'dus te reg pas kyang zhes rgyas par 'byung ba yin na //
analyzed: lag pa'i 'dus te reg pa dang / dbyug pa'i 'dus te reg pas kyang zhes rgyas par 'byung ba yin na //
translated: It is said in the sutra: “It is also the contact of the hand and the contact of the stick.

original: gzugs zhes bya ba ni gnod par gyur pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni rnam par gyur ba zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gzugs zhes bya ba ni gnod par gyur pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni rnam par gyur ba zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa yin gyi /
translated: ” The term “harm” means “that which is harmful,” which means “that which is changed.”

original: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba bskyed pas gnod par gyur pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba bskyed pas gnod par gyur pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It does not mean “that which produces the feeling of pain.”

original: nad pa gnyid ni ga la yod //
analyzed: nad pa gnyid ni ga la yod //
translated: How can there be sleep for the sick?

original: thug rngus zug bzhin gnod par 'gyur //
analyzed: thug rngus zug bzhin gnod par 'gyur //
translated: Pain is like a dart.

original: zhes bya bar mngon pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya bar mngon pa yin te /
translated: This is the meaning that is clearly expressed.

original: ji ltar zug rngus zug pa bzhin du gnod par 'gyur //
analyzed: ji ltar zug rngus zug pa bzhin du gnod par 'gyur //
translated: Pain is like a dart.

original: zhes bya bar mngon pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya bar mngon pa yin no //
translated: This is the meaning that is clearly expressed.🔽What is the harm in the primary elements and the derivative form being harmed?

original: 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa la cis gnod ce na zhes bya ba ni sems pa med pa la sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bsam pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa la cis gnod ce na zhes bya ba ni sems pa med pa la sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bsam pa'o //
translated: The thought is that since the primary elements and the derivative form are insensate, they do not have the feeling of pain.

original: de'i phyir lag pa'i 'dus te reg pa la sogs pas gzhan du 'gyur par byas pa'o zhes smras pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir lag pa'i 'dus te reg pa la sogs pas gzhan du 'gyur par byas pa'o zhes smras pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said that they are transformed by contact with the hand, etc.

original: gzugs na spyod pa dag la ji ltar gnod par 'gyur //
analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa dag la ji ltar gnod par 'gyur //
translated: How can they be harmed by those in the form realm?

original: zhes bya ba ni de dag ni bsal ba yin pa'i phyir lag pa dang dbyug pa dang bong ba'i 'dus te reg pas rnam par gyur par byar mi nus so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de dag ni bsal ba yin pa'i phyir lag pa dang dbyug pa dang bong ba'i 'dus te reg pas rnam par gyur par byar mi nus so //
translated: They cannot be changed by contact with the hand, stick, or clod, because they are incorporeal.

original: de'i phyir de'i sa pa'i mes zhes smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i sa pa'i mes zhes smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that they are destroyed by the fire of that realm.

original: 'jig pa'i dus kyi tshe zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i dus kyi tshe zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that this refers to the time of the destruction of the world.

original: sems can gyi grangs su gtogs pa la ji ltar yin te /
analyzed: sems can gyi grangs su gtogs pa la ji ltar yin te /
translated: How can this be, since they are included among sentient beings?

original: snod kyi 'jig rten nyid na mes 'jig par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: snod kyi 'jig rten nyid na mes 'jig par 'gyur gyi /
translated: The world of the environment is destroyed by fire,

original: sems can gyi 'jig rten ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sems can gyi 'jig rten ni ma yin te /
translated: but not the world of sentient beings,

original: rdzus te skyes pa rnams la lus shi ba med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: rdzus te skyes pa rnams la lus shi ba med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because there is no death of the body for those who are born supernaturally.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de nyid kyi mes zhes smras te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de nyid kyi mes zhes smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that they are destroyed by the fire of that realm.

original: ci zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: gnod par byar nus zhes 'og nyid nas 'chad de snod kyi 'jig rten gyi grangs su gtogs pa'i gzugs de dag kyang /
analyzed: gnod par byar nus zhes 'og nyid nas 'chad de snod kyi 'jig rten gyi grangs su gtogs pa'i gzugs de dag kyang /
translated: The term “capable of being harmed” will be explained below.

original: gal te phrad na gnod par byar nus pa dag gzugs kyi mtshan nyid 'thob pa'i phyir gzugs zhes brjod do //
analyzed: gal te phrad na gnod par byar nus pa dag gzugs kyi mtshan nyid 'thob pa'i phyir gzugs zhes brjod do //
translated: Those forms that belong to the category of the physical cosmos are called “form” because if they come into contact with each other, they are capable of harming each other and thus acquire the characteristics of form.

original: mthu khyad par can dang ldan pas gnod par gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ste /🔽khams gsum gyi 'dod chags dang bral brdzu 'phrul dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mthu khyad par can dang ldan pas gnod par gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ste / khams gsum gyi 'dod chags dang bral brdzu 'phrul dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: They are called “form” because they are capable of being harmed by the special power of the elements.🔽They are called “form” because they are capable of being harmed by the special power of the elements.

original: ji ltar mes ji lta ba de bzhin du chu dang rlung gis kyang de dag 'jig pa'i dus kyi tshe gnod par 'gyur zhing gnod par byar yang nus pa'i phyir gzugs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar mes ji lta ba de bzhin du chu dang rlung gis kyang de dag 'jig pa'i dus kyi tshe gnod par 'gyur zhing gnod par byar yang nus pa'i phyir gzugs zhes bya'o //
translated: Just as fire is capable of harming them, so too are water and wind capable of harming them at the time of the destruction of the world.

original: gnod par byar med pa yin yang zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni @138a * //
analyzed: gnod par byar med pa yin yang zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni @138a * //
translated: Even though they are not capable of being harmed, etc.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa dang / par ma do'i srid pa'i gzugs la sogs pa rnams gnod par byar med pa yin yang /🔽de'i rigs yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa dang / par ma do'i srid pa'i gzugs la sogs pa rnams gnod par byar med pa yin yang / de'i rigs yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The form of the fourth absorption and the form of the intermediate existence are not subject to harm.

original: gnod par byar med du zin kyang gzugs kyi rigs yin pa'i phyir gzugs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gnod par byar med du zin kyang gzugs kyi rigs yin pa'i phyir gzugs zhes bya'o //
translated: But they are called form because they are the same type.🔽Like the emanations of a buddha.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni ji ltar sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa rnams la gnod pa byar med du zin kyang de'i rigs yin pa'i phyir gzugs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni ji ltar sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa rnams la gnod pa byar med du zin kyang de'i rigs yin pa'i phyir gzugs zhes bya'o //
translated: Just as the emanations of a buddha are not subject to harm, they are called form because they are the same type.

original: srid pa bar ma'i gzugs kyang mthu khyad par can dang ldan pas kyang gnod par byar mi nus so //
analyzed: srid pa bar ma'i gzugs kyang mthu khyad par can dang ldan pas kyang gnod par byar mi nus so //
translated: Also, the form of the intermediate existence is not subject to harm because it possesses special power.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa'i gzugs ni de dag bskal pas 'jig pa med pa'i phyir gnod par byar med du zin kyang de'i rigs yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa'i gzugs ni de dag bskal pas 'jig pa med pa'i phyir gnod par byar med du zin kyang de'i rigs yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan to //
translated: The form of the fourth absorption is not subject to harm because it is not destroyed by the eon.

original: gzhan dag na re gzugs zhes bya ba ni gags byed pa yin no zhe'o zhes bya ba ni lag pa dang / dbyug pa dang bong ba la sogs pas rang gi yul du 'byung ba'i gags byed pa'i mtshan nyid de thogs par byed pa ni gzugs yin gyi /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re gzugs zhes bya ba ni gags byed pa yin no zhe'o zhes bya ba ni lag pa dang / dbyug pa dang bong ba la sogs pas rang gi yul du 'byung ba'i gags byed pa'i mtshan nyid de thogs par byed pa ni gzugs yin gyi /
translated: Obstruction is the characteristic of obstructing the arising of something in its own place, such as a hand or a stick or a clod of earth obstructing.

original: gnod pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gnod pas ni ma yin no //
translated: It is form that obstructs, not harm.

original: de'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa de gnyis dang yang mi 'byor pa yin no zhes smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa de gnyis dang yang mi 'byor pa yin no zhes smras te /
translated: Therefore it is not compatible with the two verses.

original: gzugs kyi mtshan nyid kyi tshigs su bcad pa 'di gnyis po de ni /
analyzed: gzugs kyi mtshan nyid kyi tshigs su bcad pa 'di gnyis po de ni /
translated: The two verses on the characteristics of form🔽are not compatible with the following two verses:

original: nad pa gnyid ni ga la yod //
analyzed: nad pa gnyid ni ga la yod //
translated: How can the sick have sleep?🔽and

original: ces rgyas par 'byung ba dang / 'dod pa skyes pa'i lus can de ;
analyzed: ces rgyas par 'byung ba dang / 'dod pa skyes pa'i lus can de ;
translated: The body of one who has generated desire

original: / zhes rgyas par 'byung ba 'di gnyis dang 'di mi 'byor zhing mi mthun pa yin te /🔽zug rngus zug bzhin gnod par 'gyur //
analyzed: / zhes rgyas par 'byung ba 'di gnyis dang 'di mi 'byor zhing mi mthun pa yin te / zug rngus zug bzhin gnod par 'gyur //
translated: is not compatible with these two verses.

original: zhes smras pas ni gags byed pa yin par khong du chud par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes smras pas ni gags byed pa yin par khong du chud par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: The statement it is like being pierced by a thorn does not establish that it is obstruction.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: gnod par gyur pa yin no zhes khong du chud par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gnod par gyur pa yin no zhes khong du chud par byed pa yin no //
translated: It is understood that it is a harm.🔽The second:

original: gnyis pa / yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: gnyis pa / yang de bzhin no //
translated: It is the same.

original: grang ba dang dro ba dang / bkres pa la sogs pas kyang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: grang ba dang dro ba dang / bkres pa la sogs pas kyang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Cold, heat, hunger, etc.🔽The word “etc.”

original: sogs pa'i sgras rlung dang char pa la sogs pas kyang zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras rlung dang char pa la sogs pas kyang zhes bya ste /
translated: refers to wind, rain, etc.

original: ci zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhe na /
translated: What?

original: gags byed do zhes byar mi rung ste /
analyzed: gags byed do zhes byar mi rung ste /
translated: It is not suitable to say that they obstruct.

original: rang gi yul du 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid gegs byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi yul du 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid gegs byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no obstruction to the characteristics of that which arises in its own domain.

original: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa //
analyzed: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa //
translated: Nonindicative form

original: zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni gang gis gnod par byed pa'i don ni gzugs kyi don yin pa de'i ni rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs kyang gzugs yin par mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni gang gis gnod par byed pa'i don ni gzugs kyi don yin pa de'i ni rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs kyang gzugs yin par mi 'grub ste /
translated: is not established as form because the meaning of form is the object that is harmed.

original: thogs pa med cing yul na mi gnas pa la ni lag pa la sogs pas byar med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thogs pa med cing yul na mi gnas pa la ni lag pa la sogs pas byar med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is nothing to be done by hand and so on to that which is unimpeded and does not abide in a place.

original: gang @138b dag gi gags byed pa ni gzugs yin no zhes bya ba de'i yang mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: gang @138b dag gi gags byed pa ni gzugs yin no zhes bya ba de'i yang mi 'grub ste /
translated: Form is the obstruction of that, but that is not established.

original: yul na mi gnas pa la gags byed pa med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: yul na mi gnas pa la gags byed pa med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because there is no obstruction of that which does not exist in a place.

original: de'i phyir / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa //
analyzed: de'i phyir / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa //
translated: Therefore, nonindicative form

original: zhes bya ba rdzas gzhan du ni cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: zhes bya ba rdzas gzhan du ni cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: does not exist as a different substance.🔽The extensive explanation of “through assertion and reality” means that the mere cessation of body and speech is designated as the pratimoksa vow.

original: khas blangs pa dang chos nyid kyis zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni khas blangs pas lus dang / ngag ldog pa tsam so sor thar pa'i sdom pa zhes bya ba de nye bar brtags pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: khas blangs pa dang chos nyid kyis zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni khas blangs pas lus dang / ngag ldog pa tsam so sor thar pa'i sdom pa zhes bya ba de nye bar brtags pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of that is “because of that.”

original: de bzhin du khas blangs pa tsam lus dang ngag mi ldog pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba la nye bar brtags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du khas blangs pa tsam lus dang ngag mi ldog pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba la nye bar brtags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Similarly, the mere cessation of body and speech is not designated as the pratimoksa vow.

original: chos nyid kyis kyang ci zhe na /
analyzed: chos nyid kyis kyang ci zhe na /
translated: What about through reality?

original: lus dang ngag ldog pa tsam bsam gtan dang zag pa med pa'i sdom pa zhes bya ba la de nye bar brtags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus dang ngag ldog pa tsam bsam gtan dang zag pa med pa'i sdom pa zhes bya ba la de nye bar brtags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The restraint of meditation and uncontaminated restraint are merely the cessation of body and speech, because they are designated in dependence on that.

original: btags pa can de ni gzugs med pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: btags pa can de ni gzugs med pa nyid yin te /
translated: That which is designated is formless,🔽but it is not endowed with the characteristics.

original: mtshan nyid dang ldan pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni brtags pas grub pa ni btags pa can no //
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang ldan pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni brtags pas grub pa ni btags pa can no //
translated: That which is established by designation is designated.

original: mtshan nyid mngon par grub pa ma yin pas mtshan nyid dang ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mtshan nyid mngon par grub pa ma yin pas mtshan nyid dang ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: Since it is not established by characteristics, it is not endowed with characteristics.🔽Because it is designated in the presence of form.

original: gzugs yod pa la de brtags pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni lus kyi gzugs yod pa la rnam par rig byed ma yin pa brtags pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzugs yod pa la de brtags pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni lus kyi gzugs yod pa la rnam par rig byed ma yin pa brtags pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that nonindicative form is designated in the presence of the form of the body.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gzugs med pa'i khams na sdom pa dang sdom pa ma yin pa yin pa dang / cig shos kyi rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs brtags pa med do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gzugs med pa'i khams na sdom pa dang sdom pa ma yin pa yin pa dang / cig shos kyi rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs brtags pa med do //
translated: Therefore, in the formless realm, there is no designation of restraint, unrestraint and the other nonindicative form.

original: yang na gzugs yod pa la zhes bya ba ni lus dang ngag gi rnam par rig byed kyi gzugs la'o //
analyzed: yang na gzugs yod pa la zhes bya ba ni lus dang ngag gi rnam par rig byed kyi gzugs la'o //
translated: Or else, “with respect to existent form” refers to the form of bodily and vocal informative action.

original: de nyid kyi phyir lus dang ngag ldog pa dang / ldog pa ma yin pa tsam la de nye bar brtags pa'i phyir ro zhes smras so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir lus dang ngag ldog pa dang / ldog pa ma yin pa tsam la de nye bar brtags pa'i phyir ro zhes smras so //
translated: For this very reason, he says, “because of the mere reversal or nonreversal of body and speech.”

original: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa la brjod par bya ba mang du yod de /
analyzed: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa la brjod par bya ba mang du yod de /
translated: There is much to be said about noninformative form.

original: re zhig 'dir shin tu 'phros pa gzhag go zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: re zhig 'dir shin tu 'phros pa gzhag go zhes bya ba ni /
translated: But for now, let us set aside this extensive discussion.

original: ji ltar brjod par bya ba mang ba de ltar las grub pa dang / chos mngon pa'i mdzod las blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar brjod par bya ba mang ba de ltar las grub pa dang / chos mngon pa'i mdzod las blta bar bya'o //
translated: As there is much to be said, the establishment of action and so on should be understood from the Abhidharmakośa.

original: ji ltar ming dang gzugs nyid yin par bstan zin to zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gang gis ming nyid yin pa ni ming ni 'dud par byed pas ming zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du rnam pa gang gis gzugs nyid yin par bstan pa ni gnod par gyur pas gzugs zhes bya'o zhes bstan pa dag yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar ming dang gzugs nyid yin par bstan zin to zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gang gis ming nyid yin pa ni ming ni 'dud par byed pas ming zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du rnam pa gang gis gzugs nyid yin par bstan pa ni gnod par gyur pas gzugs zhes bya'o zhes bstan pa dag yin no //
translated: it is taught that name is that which bends, and form is that which is susceptible to being crushed.

original: ci'i phyir phung po lnga la ming dang gzugs nyid @139a * //🔽du rnam par gzhag ce na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ci'i phyir phung po lnga la ming dang gzugs nyid @139a * // du rnam par gzhag ce na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Why are the five aggregates established as name-and-form?

original: phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa thams cad ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi dgongs pa dang bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa thams cad ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi dgongs pa dang bcas pa yin te /
translated: All the various presentations of the aggregates, constituents, and bases, and so on, are based on the intention of the Bhagavān Buddha.

original: gdul bya'i spyod pa tha dad pa la ltos pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gdul bya'i spyod pa tha dad pa la ltos pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they are based on the different behaviors of those to be trained.

original: ji skad du /🔽rmongs dang dbang po 'dod gsum la //🔽phung po la sogs rnam gsum bshad //
analyzed: ji skad du / rmongs dang dbang po 'dod gsum la // phung po la sogs rnam gsum bshad //
translated: As it is said:🔽The aggregates, constituents, and bases are explained as threefold:

original: ces bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ces bstan pa yin no //
translated: for the confused, for those who desire the faculties, and for the wise.

original: de bas na phung po lnga rnams ming dang gzugs nyid du rnam par gzhag pa 'di yang dgos pa dang bcas pa yin pas de'i dgos pa brjod par bya dgos te /
analyzed: de bas na phung po lnga rnams ming dang gzugs nyid du rnam par gzhag pa 'di yang dgos pa dang bcas pa yin pas de'i dgos pa brjod par bya dgos te /
translated: Therefore, since this presentation of the five aggregates as name and form is meaningful, it is necessary to state its purpose.

original: de bas na byis pa phal cher de gnyis la //
analyzed: de bas na byis pa phal cher de gnyis la //
translated: Therefore, the majority of childish beings

original: lus can dang lus su mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed par bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes smras te /
analyzed: lus can dang lus su mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed par bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes smras te /
translated: are taught to make manifest the pride of being a body and having a body.

original: de gnyis la zhes bya ba ni ming dang gzugs gnyis la ste /
analyzed: de gnyis la zhes bya ba ni ming dang gzugs gnyis la ste /
translated: The two is name and form.

original: de la lus can la mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed pa ni ming la ste /
analyzed: de la lus can la mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed pa ni ming la ste /
translated: Pride of being a body is in name because🔽it is that which hears, sees, smells, tastes, touches, and cognizes,

original: gang thos par byed pa dang / mthong par byed pa dang / snom par byed pa dang / ro myong bar byed pa dang / reg par byed pa dang / rnam par shes par byed pa'am /
analyzed: gang thos par byed pa dang / mthong par byed pa dang / snom par byed pa dang / ro myong bar byed pa dang / reg par byed pa dang / rnam par shes par byed pa'am /
translated: or that which thinks of pleasure and pain.🔽Pride of having a body is in form because🔽it is that which is seen, touched, and cognized,

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal bar sems pa de ni lus can la ste /
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal bar sems pa de ni lus can la ste /
translated: or that which is thought of as pleasure and pain.

original: dran pa dang / ngo shes pa dang / dga' ba dang / zhen pa dang / rmongs pa ni lus 'di la gnas pa'i bdag yin par mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed pa'i phyir ro //🔽lus la mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed pa ni zhes bya ba ni gzugs la 'di ni bdag 'di'i lus so //
analyzed: dran pa dang / ngo shes pa dang / dga' ba dang / zhen pa dang / rmongs pa ni lus 'di la gnas pa'i bdag yin par mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed pa'i phyir ro // lus la mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed pa ni zhes bya ba ni gzugs la 'di ni bdag 'di'i lus so //
translated: because one is conceited with the thought that the self which resides in this body is memory, recognition, affection, attachment, and delusion.

original: de yang 'di la brten pa yin no zhes mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang 'di la brten pa yin no zhes mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase “one is conceited with the thought that the self is the body” means that one is conceited with the thought that “this is my body” and “this is based on me.”

original: ming sngar smos pa ni des gzugs gzung ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni ming des gzugs la gzung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ming sngar smos pa ni des gzugs gzung ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni ming des gzugs la gzung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The name is mentioned first because form is grasped on the basis of the name.

original: ming gis gzugs gzung gi / gzugs kyis ming ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ji ltar nges par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ming gis gzugs gzung gi / gzugs kyis ming ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ji ltar nges par bya zhe na /
translated: How is it known that the name is the grasper of form and not the other way around?

original: de'i phyir / 'di ltar de la ni des bdag dang bdag gi zhes rgyas par smras te /🔽'di ltar ming des /
analyzed: de'i phyir / 'di ltar de la ni des bdag dang bdag gi zhes rgyas par smras te / 'di ltar ming des /
translated: The root text states, “For, one conceives of the self and what belongs to the self in relation to it.”

original: bdag dang bdag gi'o zhes bdag dang bdag gir gzugs de la /
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gi'o zhes bdag dang bdag gir gzugs de la /
translated: The name is the grasper of form because one conceives of the self and what belongs to the self in relation to it.🔽The phrase “one conceives of the self and what belongs to the self in relation to it” means that one conceives of the self and what belongs to the self in relation to form.

original: bdag gir byed do //
analyzed: bdag gir byed do //
translated: It is appropriated.

original: yul na mi gnas pa'i ming gis ni bdag gi snyam pa la sogs par zhen pa la ma gtogs par gzhan du gzugs nye bar 'dzin par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yul na mi gnas pa'i ming gis ni bdag gi snyam pa la sogs par zhen pa la ma gtogs par gzhan du gzugs nye bar 'dzin par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: The form is not capable of being apprehended by the name, except through the adherence to the notion of “mine,” etc., because the name does not exist in the object.

original: gzugs ni dmigs pa med pa'i phyir ming la de bzhin du 'dzin par nus pa ma yin pas so //
analyzed: gzugs ni dmigs pa med pa'i phyir ming la de bzhin du 'dzin par nus pa ma yin pas so //
translated: The form is not capable of being apprehended by the name in the same way, because the object does not exist in the name.

original: @139b des btang na yang rul par 'gyur ro zhes bya ste /
analyzed: @139b des btang na yang rul par 'gyur ro zhes bya ste /
translated: If it is abandoned by the name, it decays.

original: ming des gzugs de btang na yang gang gi phyir de rul bar 'gyur ba de bas na yongs su skyong ba nyid kyis ma rul ba'i rgyu'i dngos po byed pas des de gzung ba zhes bya'i /
analyzed: ming des gzugs de btang na yang gang gi phyir de rul bar 'gyur ba de bas na yongs su skyong ba nyid kyis ma rul ba'i rgyu'i dngos po byed pas des de gzung ba zhes bya'i /
translated: If the form is abandoned by the name, it decays. Therefore, it is said that the name holds the form because it functions as the cause of non-decay through the act of protecting.

original: ming gis gzugs btang ba'i gzugs la ni de ltar rnam par 'gyur bar 'gro bas de ni des gzung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: ming gis gzugs btang ba'i gzugs la ni de ltar rnam par 'gyur bar 'gro bas de ni des gzung ba ma yin no //
translated: The form that is abandoned by the name does not go in that way, so it is not held by the name.

original: de'i dbang gis kyang bya ba dag la 'jug go zhes bya ba ni gnas pa dang / 'gro ba dang / khrus byed pa dang / stan la 'dug pa dang / zas za ba la sogs pa'i bya ba dag la ming gi dbang gis 'jug ste /
analyzed: de'i dbang gis kyang bya ba dag la 'jug go zhes bya ba ni gnas pa dang / 'gro ba dang / khrus byed pa dang / stan la 'dug pa dang / zas za ba la sogs pa'i bya ba dag la ming gi dbang gis 'jug ste /
translated: One engages in activities such as standing, walking, bathing, sitting on a seat, eating, etc.,

original: 'dun pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dun pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: by the power of names, because one acts in accordance with one’s desire.

original: de ltar na gdon mi za ba kho nar sgrub par byed pa'i don gyis na gzugs ni ming gis bsdus shing zin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na gdon mi za ba kho nar sgrub par byed pa'i don gyis na gzugs ni ming gis bsdus shing zin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, form is said to be included and pervaded by name, because it is definitely the case that the meaning of “pervasion” is the meaning of “inclusion.”

original: dper na grong khyer gzung ngo //
analyzed: dper na grong khyer gzung ngo //
translated: For example, one says, “I grasp the city,”

original: rgyal srid 'byung ngo zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: rgyal srid 'byung ngo zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: “I grasp the kingdom.”

original: 'jig rten na yang ming 'dod pa'i rjes su gzugs byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten na yang ming 'dod pa'i rjes su gzugs byed pa yin no //
translated: In the world, one makes form in accordance with the desire for a name.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽gang gi phyir 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid dag gzugs la yod pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / gang gi phyir 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid dag gzugs la yod pa ma yin pas /
translated: Why is that?🔽Because the characteristics of desire do not exist in form.

original: gzugs kyi ming gzung zhes mi bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi ming gzung zhes mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should not say that the name of form is grasped.

original: de med pang yang ris mthun pa gzhan du 'grub pa ma yin gyi zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni ming de dag med par ni ris mthun pa gzhan du gzugs mngon par 'grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de med pang yang ris mthun pa gzhan du 'grub pa ma yin gyi zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni ming de dag med par ni ris mthun pa gzhan du gzugs mngon par 'grub pa ma yin no //
translated: and without that, the form of the same type is not established in another place.

original: de'i phyir yang ming kho nas gzugs gzung ba yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir yang ming kho nas gzugs gzung ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, form is apprehended by name alone,

original: de yod na de yod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yod na de yod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because if that exists, this exists.

original: gzugs ni med par yang gzugs med pa dag tu ming mngon par 'byung bar 'gyur bas de'i phyir ma zin pa yin no zhes ston to //
analyzed: gzugs ni med par yang gzugs med pa dag tu ming mngon par 'byung bar 'gyur bas de'i phyir ma zin pa yin no zhes ston to //
translated: Since the name arises in the formless realm without form, it is taught that it is not apprehended.

original: ming ni rgyun la brten nas ris mthun pa gzhan dag tu zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni ming gi rgyun la brten nas srid pa bar ma'i rgyun gyis ris mthun pa gzhan du sngon ma byung ba'i gzugs kyi rgyun len par byed kyi /
analyzed: ming ni rgyun la brten nas ris mthun pa gzhan dag tu zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni ming gi rgyun la brten nas srid pa bar ma'i rgyun gyis ris mthun pa gzhan du sngon ma byung ba'i gzugs kyi rgyun len par byed kyi /
translated: The name arises in another place based on the continuum, and so on, means that the continuum of the intermediate existence is based on the continuum of name and it takes up the continuum of form in another place of the same type that did not exist before.

original: ris mthun pa'i gzugs kyi rgyun sngon byung bas ji ltar ming gi rgyun bzhin du ris mthun pa gzhan du ming mngon par 'grub par byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ris mthun pa'i gzugs kyi rgyun sngon byung bas ji ltar ming gi rgyun bzhin du ris mthun pa gzhan du ming mngon par 'grub par byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The continuum of form of the same type that existed previously does not cause the manifestation of another continuum of the same type, as does the continuum of names.

original: de bas na ris mthun pa gzhan du sngon ma byung ba'i gzugs kyi rgyun ming gis len to zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na ris mthun pa gzhan du sngon ma byung ba'i gzugs kyi rgyun ming gis len to zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the continuum of form that did not exist previously in another continuum of the same type is grasped by the name.

original: gzugs kyi rgyun ni sngon ma byung ba'i ming gi rgyun len par byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzugs kyi rgyun ni sngon ma byung ba'i ming gi rgyun len par byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The continuum of form does not cause the grasping of the continuum of names that did not exist previously.

original: sngon gyi ris mthun pa'i ming gi rgyun ni sngon bzhin du ris mthun pa gzhan du ming gi rgyun rjes su 'jug go //
analyzed: sngon gyi ris mthun pa'i ming gi rgyun ni sngon bzhin du ris mthun pa gzhan du ming gi rgyun rjes su 'jug go //
translated: The continuum of names of the same type that existed previously continues the continuum of names in another continuum of the same type, as before.
Therefore,

original: phyir yang ming nyid kyis gzugs bzung ba yin te /
analyzed: phyir yang ming nyid kyis gzugs bzung ba yin te /
translated: form is grasped by the name.

original: 'dzin pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dzin pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it has the characteristic of grasping.

original: 'dzin par byed pa ni sngon gzung ba'i gzung bar bya ba bor nas de las gzhan pa sngon med pa 'dzin par byed do //
analyzed: 'dzin par byed pa ni sngon gzung ba'i gzung bar bya ba bor nas de las gzhan pa sngon med pa 'dzin par byed do //
translated: The grasper discards the object of grasping that was previously grasped and grasps something else that did not exist previously.

original: gzugs ni gzung bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: gzugs ni gzung bar bya ba yin te /
translated: Form is that which is to be perceived,

original: gzung bar bya ba'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzung bar bya ba'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has the characteristic of being perceived.

original: de dag kyang sngar gzung ba ni 'dor la /
analyzed: de dag kyang sngar gzung ba ni 'dor la /
translated: Moreover, one abandons that which was previously perceived,

original: sngon med pa ni len par byed do //
analyzed: sngon med pa ni len par byed do //
translated: and one takes up that which was not previously perceived.

original: gang yang 'byung ba rgyur byas pa'i gzugs skyes pa dag ces bya ba la /
analyzed: gang yang 'byung ba rgyur byas pa'i gzugs skyes pa dag ces bya ba la /
translated: That which is derived from the primary elements is form that is generated.

original: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs ni mig la sogs pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs ni mig la sogs pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa'o //
translated: Derived form is the eye, etc. and form, etc.🔽How are they conditions for consciousness?

original: de dag ji ltar rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis yin zhe na zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba'i rkyen gyis de las gzhan pa rgyur byas pa de skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ji ltar rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis yin zhe na zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba'i rkyen gyis de las gzhan pa rgyur byas pa de skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that which is derived from the primary elements is generated from the primary elements, which are its conditions.

original: gal te 'byung ba dang 'byung ba la brten pa'i gzugs rnams zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa de dag thams cad spyir las kyis yongs su bsgos pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te 'byung ba dang 'byung ba la brten pa'i gzugs rnams zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa de dag thams cad spyir las kyis yongs su bsgos pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba yin gyi /
translated: If all form is derived from the primary elements, then how can the sutra declare that there are two kinds of form, that derived from the primary elements and that which is not derived from the primary elements?🔽The Vaibhāṣikas respond: The sutra states that form is of two kinds: that derived from the primary elements and that which is not derived from the primary elements.

original: 'byung ba nyi tshes ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'byung ba nyi tshes ni ma yin no //
translated: but not because of the elements’ season.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might ask:

original: 'o na ji ltar de dag 'byung ba las gyur pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar de dag 'byung ba las gyur pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: “How then are they called ‘derived from the elements’?”

original: de'i phyir 'byung ba dang tha dad pa med par skye ba na 'byung ba las gyur pa zhes bya ste zhes smras so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'byung ba dang tha dad pa med par skye ba na 'byung ba las gyur pa zhes bya ste zhes smras so //
translated: Therefore, it is said that “when they arise without being separate from the elements, they are called ‘derived from the elements.’”

original: de ni de dag tha dad pa med par ston pa ni /
analyzed: de ni de dag tha dad pa med par ston pa ni /
translated: To show that they are not separate from the elements,

original: de 'dzin pa dang 'phrog pa dang yongs su gyur na de 'dzin pa la sogs pa yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de 'dzin pa dang 'phrog pa dang yongs su gyur na de 'dzin pa la sogs pa yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: it is said that “when the elements are grasped, stolen, or transformed, grasping, etc., of them exists.”

original: 'byung ba bzung nas 'byung ba las gyur pa yang bzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba bzung nas 'byung ba las gyur pa yang bzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: When the elements are grasped, the derivative form is also grasped.

original: 'byung ba yongs su gyur na 'byung ba las gyur pa yang yongs su gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'byung ba yongs su gyur na 'byung ba las gyur pa yang yongs su gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: When the elements are transformed, the derivative form is also transformed.

original: re zhig 'jig rten na yang dbang po dang don gnyis las bde ba dang sdug bsngal skye ba dang zhes bya ba 'jig rten na grub pa yin te /
analyzed: re zhig 'jig rten na yang dbang po dang don gnyis las bde ba dang sdug bsngal skye ba dang zhes bya ba 'jig rten na grub pa yin te /
translated: “In the world, pleasure and pain arise from the two, the sense faculty and the object,” is established in the world.

original: de yod na de yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yod na de yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because if that exists, that exists.

original: de yang de gnyis las mtshan nyid mi mthun pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang de gnyis las mtshan nyid mi mthun pa yin no //
translated: And that is dissimilar to those two.

original: brdabs pa las sgra dang zhes bya ba ci zhe na /
analyzed: brdabs pa las sgra dang zhes bya ba ci zhe na /
translated: Sound from a drum and

original: skye zhes bya ba'i skabs dang sbyar te /
analyzed: skye zhes bya ba'i skabs dang sbyar te /
translated: The context is “arises.”

original: de yang de las mtshan nyid mi mthun pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang de las mtshan nyid mi mthun pa yin no //
translated: And that is dissimilar to that.🔽Reed from a stalk and

original: rva las 'dam bu dang zhes bya ba ni gal te rva ni sa la sogs pa'i bdag nyid yin du zin kyang /
analyzed: rva las 'dam bu dang zhes bya ba ni gal te rva ni sa la sogs pa'i bdag nyid yin du zin kyang /
translated: Even if the stalk has the nature of earth, etc.,

original: 'dam bu yang de 'dus pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dam bu yang de 'dus pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the reed is also an aggregation of that.

original: de lta mod kyi /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi /
translated: But still,

original: rva dang 'dam bu'i rigs ni tha dad pa yod do //
analyzed: rva dang 'dam bu'i rigs ni tha dad pa yod do //
translated: there is a difference in the type of the stalk and the reed.🔽Smoke from fire and wood

original: me dang shing las du ba dang zhes bya ba @140b 'di la yang rigs tha dad pa yod pa yin te /
analyzed: me dang shing las du ba dang zhes bya ba @140b 'di la yang rigs tha dad pa yod pa yin te /
translated: There is also a difference in the type here.

original: me ni dro ba'i bdag nyid kyi me yin no //
analyzed: me ni dro ba'i bdag nyid kyi me yin no //
translated: Fire is fire with the nature of heat.

original: shing ni du ba ma yin gyi du ba'i rigs yin no /🔽rdo thal dang chu las me dang zhes bya ba ci zhe na /
analyzed: shing ni du ba ma yin gyi du ba'i rigs yin no / rdo thal dang chu las me dang zhes bya ba ci zhe na /
translated: Wood is not smoke, but it is the type of smoke.🔽Fire from saltpeter and water

original: skye zhes bya ba'i skabs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: skye zhes bya ba'i skabs dang sbyar ro //
translated: What is the context? “Arises.”

original: 'di la yang 'byung ba'i rigs tha dad pa'i phyir mtshan nyid mi mthun pa nyid grub pa yin te //
analyzed: 'di la yang 'byung ba'i rigs tha dad pa'i phyir mtshan nyid mi mthun pa nyid grub pa yin te //
translated: And here, the difference in the type of element is established as the reason for the difference in characteristics,

original: rdo thal dang chu gnyis 'byung ba gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdo thal dang chu gnyis 'byung ba gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the element of water is different from the element of salt.

original: klu'i sems kyi mthus chu dang zhes bya ba ci zhe na skye zhes bya ba'i skabs dang sbyar te //
analyzed: klu'i sems kyi mthus chu dang zhes bya ba ci zhe na skye zhes bya ba'i skabs dang sbyar te //
translated: The phrase “through the power of the mind of the nāga” is connected to the phrase “water arises.”

original: chu ni klu la slong ngo zhes bya bar grub pa yin no //🔽ting nge 'dzin gyi bye brag las /
analyzed: chu ni klu la slong ngo zhes bya bar grub pa yin no // ting nge 'dzin gyi bye brag las /
translated: The phrase “water arises through the power of the mind of the nāga” is established.🔽The phrase “through the power of samādhi” is connected to the phrase “the divine eye and ear arise.”

original: lha'i mig dang rna ba zhes bya ba ni snang bar lhag par mos pa dang / sgra mnyan pa'i rtsol ba rab tu sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lha'i mig dang rna ba zhes bya ba ni snang bar lhag par mos pa dang / sgra mnyan pa'i rtsol ba rab tu sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase “the divine eye and ear arise through the power of samādhi” is established.🔽The phrase “from a mind of emanation” is connected to the phrase “an emanation arises.”🔽The phrase “an emanation arises from a mind of emanation” is established.

original: sprul pa'i sems las sprul pa dang zhes bya ba ci zhen gzugs med pa las kyang gzugs skye'o zhes bya ba'i skabs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: sprul pa'i sems las sprul pa dang zhes bya ba ci zhen gzugs med pa las kyang gzugs skye'o zhes bya ba'i skabs dang sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase “form arises from formless” is connected to the phrase “form arises from formless.”🔽The phrase “form arises from formless” is established.

original: rlung gi stobs 'chang ba la sogs pa rtse bar mngon par dga' ba las rlung dang char pa la sogs pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras 'brug gi stobs 'chang ba dang / char pa'i stobs 'chang ba la sogs pa yang yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rlung gi stobs 'chang ba la sogs pa rtse bar mngon par dga' ba las rlung dang char pa la sogs pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras 'brug gi stobs 'chang ba dang / char pa'i stobs 'chang ba la sogs pa yang yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The power of the wind, etc., refers to the power of the wind, the power of the rain, etc.

original: klu'i sems kyi mthus chu'i zhes bya ba ci zhe na /
analyzed: klu'i sems kyi mthus chu'i zhes bya ba ci zhe na /
translated: The power of the mind of the nagas refers to the power of the mind of the nagas.

original: gzugs med pa las kyang gzugs skye'o zhes skabs dang sbyar te /
analyzed: gzugs med pa las kyang gzugs skye'o zhes skabs dang sbyar te /
translated: Form arises from the formless realm.

original: klu chen pos byin gyis brlabs pa'i mtsho ni skam par mi 'gyur ba yin no //🔽gzugs las kyang gzugs med pa skye ba ni mig la sogs pa las /
analyzed: klu chen pos byin gyis brlabs pa'i mtsho ni skam par mi 'gyur ba yin no // gzugs las kyang gzugs med pa skye ba ni mig la sogs pa las /
translated: The great nagas bless the ocean so that it does not dry up.🔽Formless states arise from form.

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa'o zhes bya ba ni sems las byung ba dang bcas zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa'o zhes bya ba ni sems las byung ba dang bcas zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa'o //
translated: The five collections of consciousness together with their associates arise from the eye, etc.

original: mtshan nyid mi mthun pa las kyang yin pa ni dge ba dang mi dge ba la lung du ma bstan pa dang zhes bya ba ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i sems ni lung du ma bstan pa las dge ba dang mi dge ba nyid kyis mtshan nyid🔽mi mthun pa yin no //
analyzed: mtshan nyid mi mthun pa las kyang yin pa ni dge ba dang mi dge ba la lung du ma bstan pa dang zhes bya ba ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i sems ni lung du ma bstan pa las dge ba dang mi dge ba nyid kyis mtshan nyid mi mthun pa yin no //
translated: From dissimilar characteristics means that a neutral mind is from a virtuous or nonvirtuous mind because the characteristics of a virtuous or nonvirtuous mind are dissimilar to those of a neutral mind.

original: de gnyis las lung du ma bstan pa ni lung du ma bstan pa nyid kyis mtshan nyid mi mthun pa yin no //
analyzed: de gnyis las lung du ma bstan pa ni lung du ma bstan pa nyid kyis mtshan nyid mi mthun pa yin no //
translated: From those two, a neutral mind is dissimilar because of its neutral characteristics.

original: 'dod ma chags pa las kyang 'dod chags skye ba dang zhes bya ba ni dbang po dang don dad /🔽tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa la sogs pa las so //
analyzed: 'dod ma chags pa las kyang 'dod chags skye ba dang zhes bya ba ni dbang po dang don dad / tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa la sogs pa las so //
translated: Attachment arises from nonattachment means that attachment arises from faculties, objects,🔽and improper mental attention.

original: 'dod chags las kyang 'dod ma chags pa ste zhes bya ba ni sems pa dang ma rig pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags las kyang 'dod ma chags pa ste zhes bya ba ni sems pa dang ma rig pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Nonattachment arises from attachment means that nonattachment arises from intention, ignorance, and so on.

original: grangs can pa'i bstan bcos las kyang /
analyzed: grangs can pa'i bstan bcos las kyang /
translated: The Sāṃkhya treatise also says:

original: de'i bdag @141a * //
analyzed: de'i bdag @141a * //
translated: From that, this.

original: nyid ma yin pa'i nga'o snyam pa las kyang chen po'am zhes bya ba ni sgra'i bdag nyid ma yin pa las kyang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nyid ma yin pa'i nga'o snyam pa las kyang chen po'am zhes bya ba ni sgra'i bdag nyid ma yin pa las kyang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase “or else, from something that is not the self” means from something that is not the nature of sound.🔽The thought “I am the great one” or “I am the self” is the nature of sattva, rajas, and tamas.

original: snying stobs la sogs pa'i bdag nyid yin pas chen po'am nga'o snyam pa yang sgra la sogs pa'i bdag nyid yin du zin kyang /
analyzed: snying stobs la sogs pa'i bdag nyid yin pas chen po'am nga'o snyam pa yang sgra la sogs pa'i bdag nyid yin du zin kyang /
translated: But even if sound, etc., are the nature of sattva, rajas, and tamas,

original: snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa rnams la bye brag gang dang ldan pas sgra dang reg bya dang gzugs dang ro dang dri yin par brjod pa 'thob par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa rnams la bye brag gang dang ldan pas sgra dang reg bya dang gzugs dang ro dang dri yin par brjod pa 'thob par 'gyur gyi /
translated: they do not obtain the distinctions that are said to be sound, touch, form, taste, and smell.

original: de'i bdag nyid chen po'am nga'o snyam pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid chen po'am nga'o snyam pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The thought “I am the great one” or “I am the self” is not the nature of those.

original: yang na chen po dang nga'o snyam pa de bye brag yod mod kyi /
analyzed: yang na chen po dang nga'o snyam pa de bye brag yod mod kyi /
translated: Or else, the thought “I am the great one” or “I am the self” does have distinctions.

original: 'on kyang chen po dang nga'o snyam pa las sgra la sogs pa mi 'byung ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang chen po dang nga'o snyam pa las sgra la sogs pa mi 'byung ba ni ma yin te /
translated: But it is not the case that sound, etc., do not arise from the thought “I am the great one” or “I am the self.”

original: chen po dang nga'o snyam pa dag skye gnas yin par mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chen po dang nga'o snyam pa dag skye gnas yin par mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the thought “I am the great one” or “I am the self” is the origin of sound, etc.

original: rigs mi mthun pa rdzas dang las gnyis las yon tan skye ba dang zhes bya ba ni kun du ldan pa dang bral pa de gnyis kyi rgyu ni 'du ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs mi mthun pa rdzas dang las gnyis las yon tan skye ba dang zhes bya ba ni kun du ldan pa dang bral pa de gnyis kyi rgyu ni 'du ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The cause of both conjunction and disjunction is the composite.

original: 'du ba can gyi rgyu ni kun du ldan pa dang bral pa gnyis kyi rdzas yin no //
analyzed: 'du ba can gyi rgyu ni kun du ldan pa dang bral pa gnyis kyi rdzas yin no //
translated: The cause of the composite is the substance of both conjunction and disjunction.

original: 'du ba can ma yin pa'i rgyu ni las yin no //
analyzed: 'du ba can ma yin pa'i rgyu ni las yin no //
translated: The cause of the non-composite is action.

original: rdzas ni las rnams 'du ba can gyi rgyu yin no //
analyzed: rdzas ni las rnams 'du ba can gyi rgyu yin no //
translated: Substance is the cause of the composite of actions.

original: 'bras can gyis phongs pa la sogs pa ni yon tan 'du ba can gyi rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: 'bras can gyis phongs pa la sogs pa ni yon tan 'du ba can gyi rgyu ma yin no //
translated: The result, such as the lack of deficiency, is not the cause of the composite of qualities.

original: yon tan gyi byed pa la ni yon tan can gyi byed pa yod pa yin pas rdzas ni las la sogs pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: yon tan gyi byed pa la ni yon tan can gyi byed pa yod pa yin pas rdzas ni las la sogs pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: Since the activity of qualities is the activity of the possessor of qualities, substance is the cause of action, etc.

original: bdag dang dbang po dang yid dang don 'dus pa las bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni rigs mi mthun pa'i yon tan las yon tan skye zhes bya bar ston to //
analyzed: bdag dang dbang po dang yid dang don 'dus pa las bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni rigs mi mthun pa'i yon tan las yon tan skye zhes bya bar ston to //
translated: From the assemblage of self, sense faculties, mind, and objects, there is pleasure, pain, etc. This shows that from qualities of a different type, qualities arise.

original: ji ltar mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i rgyu las 'bras bu 'byung ba yin /
analyzed: ji ltar mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i rgyu las 'bras bu 'byung ba yin /
translated: How could an effect arise from a cause that is dissimilar to it?🔽If that were so, then why wouldn’t everything arise from everything?

original: de lta na ni thams cad las thams cad ci'i phyir mi 'byung zhe na zhes bya ba ni tha dad par bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni thams cad las thams cad ci'i phyir mi 'byung zhe na zhes bya ba ni tha dad par bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no specific difference between them.

original: gang zhig rgyu dang rigs mthun pa de ni nges pa yin par rigs na thams cad ni thams cad dang rigs mthun pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig rgyu dang rigs mthun pa de ni nges pa yin par rigs na thams cad ni thams cad dang rigs mthun pa ma yin no //
translated: If it is logical that an effect is similar to its cause, then everything is not similar to everything else.🔽In the example, even though an effect arises from a cause that is dissimilar to it, everything does not arise from everything.

original: dpe de bdag nyid kyis re zhig mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i rgyu las 'bras bu 'byung yang thams cad las thams cad 'byung ba ma yin no zhes bya ba de dag grub pa yin na 'di la dri bar bya ci dgos zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dpe de bdag nyid kyis re zhig mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i rgyu las 'bras bu 'byung yang thams cad las thams cad 'byung ba ma yin no zhes bya ba de dag grub pa yin na 'di la dri bar bya ci dgos zhes bya ba la /
translated: Since this is established by our own nature, why should we ask you about this?

original: dpe dag nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni ji skad du smos pa de dag gis zhes ston pa ni gang yang dbang po dang don gnyis las bde ba dang sdug bsngal skye ba dang / brdabs pa las sgra dang me dang / shing gnyis @141b las ngu ba dang rdo thal dang chu gnyis las me dang zhes bya ba nas bdag dang dbang po dang yid dang don tshogs pa las bde ba dang /
analyzed: dpe dag nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni ji skad du smos pa de dag gis zhes ston pa ni gang yang dbang po dang don gnyis las bde ba dang sdug bsngal skye ba dang / brdabs pa las sgra dang me dang / shing gnyis @141b las ngu ba dang rdo thal dang chu gnyis las me dang zhes bya ba nas bdag dang dbang po dang yid dang don tshogs pa las bde ba dang /
translated: The phrase “by means of the examples” indicates that the examples that have been mentioned establish that although effects arise from causes that are dissimilar in nature, not everything arises from everything.🔽For example, pleasure and pain arise from the combination of a sense faculty and an object, sound arises from the striking of two objects, fire arises from two sticks, crying arises from two people, fire and water arise from two stones, and so on.

original: sdug bsngal la sogs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du gang smos pa rnams kyis re zhig mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i rgyu las 'bras bu 'byung yang thams cad las thams cad 'byung ba ma yin no zhes bya ba de dag grub pa yin te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la sogs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du gang smos pa rnams kyis re zhig mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i rgyu las 'bras bu 'byung yang thams cad las thams cad 'byung ba ma yin no zhes bya ba de dag grub pa yin te /
translated: The phrase “from the combination of the self, a sense faculty, the mind, and an object” indicates that pleasure, pain, and so on arise from the combination of the self, a sense faculty, the mind, and an object.

original: dbang po dang don gnyis las bde ba dang sdug bsngal yin par khams gsum du ma grags pa ma yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: dbang po dang don gnyis las bde ba dang sdug bsngal yin par khams gsum du ma grags pa ma yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The phrase “it is well known in the three realms” means that it is well known in the three realms that pleasure and pain arise from the combination of a sense faculty and an object.

original: chos nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid dang rang bzhin gyis zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: chos nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid dang rang bzhin gyis zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa'o //
translated: “By the nature of things” means by intrinsic nature and essential nature.

original: de bas na de gnyi gas kyang brgal du med do zhes bya ba ni re zhig rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming skye'o zhes bya ba ni rigs na gzugs mtshan nyid mi mthun pa dag rnam par shes pa las ji ltar skye zhes smras pa gang yin
analyzed: de bas na de gnyi gas kyang brgal du med do zhes bya ba ni re zhig rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming skye'o zhes bya ba ni rigs na gzugs mtshan nyid mi mthun pa dag rnam par shes pa las ji ltar skye zhes smras pa gang yin
translated: Therefore, neither of them can be refuted means that, first, it is reasonable to say that name arises with consciousness as its condition, but how can form, which is dissimilar to consciousness, arise from consciousness?

original: pa dang / de lta na 'o na thams cad las thams cad ci'i phyir mi 'byung zhes smras pa gang yin pa da gnyi gas kyang brgal du med do //
analyzed: pa dang / de lta na 'o na thams cad las thams cad ci'i phyir mi 'byung zhes smras pa gang yin pa da gnyi gas kyang brgal du med do //
translated: And second, if that is so, then why does everything not arise from everything else?🔽Here, the refutation of the ascertainment of conditions and the ascertainment of that which possesses conditions is explained in detail.

original: 'dir yang rkyen dang rkyen can gnyis nges pa dang zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni rkyen nges pa la skyon dang / rkyen can nges pa dang / gnyi ga nges pa dang / ma nges pa yang skyon yin no zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang rkyen dang rkyen can gnyis nges pa dang zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni rkyen nges pa la skyon dang / rkyen can nges pa dang / gnyi ga nges pa dang / ma nges pa yang skyon yin no zhes bya'o //
translated: The ascertainment of conditions is a fault, the ascertainment of that which possesses conditions, the ascertainment of both, and the nonascertainment of both are also faults.

original: rkyen nges pa'i dbang du byas te /
analyzed: rkyen nges pa'i dbang du byas te /
translated: With regard to the ascertainment of conditions,

original: gal te rnam par shes pa kho na'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs yin na dga' ba'i kun 'byung ba las gzugs kun 'byung ba dang zhes bya ba'i mdo sde dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te rnam par shes pa kho na'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs yin na dga' ba'i kun 'byung ba las gzugs kun 'byung ba dang zhes bya ba'i mdo sde dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If name-and-form were a condition of consciousness alone, then the sutra that states “the origin of form is the origin of pleasure” would be contradicted.

original: mdo sde ni 'og nas 'chad pa yin te /
analyzed: mdo sde ni 'og nas 'chad pa yin te /
translated: The sutra is explained below.

original: dga' ba'i rkyen gyis kyang gzugs yin zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: dga' ba'i rkyen gyis kyang gzugs yin zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: It teaches that form is a condition of pleasure.

original: reg pa'i kun 'byung ba las shes zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni rnam par shes pa ma togs par sems las byung ba thams cad kyi spyi'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ming gi rkyen reg pa yin par bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan to //
analyzed: reg pa'i kun 'byung ba las shes zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni rnam par shes pa ma togs par sems las byung ba thams cad kyi spyi'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ming gi rkyen reg pa yin par bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan to //
translated: The origin of contact is the origin of consciousness, etc. The Blessed One taught that contact is a condition of name because it is the general cause of all mental factors, except for consciousness.

original: ming dang gzugs kun 'byung ba las rnam par shes pa kun 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni ming gi phyogs gcig tu gyur pa rnam par shes pa ni ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis yin par bstan te /
analyzed: ming dang gzugs kun 'byung ba las rnam par shes pa kun 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni ming gi phyogs gcig tu gyur pa rnam par shes pa ni ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis yin par bstan te /
translated: The origin of name-and-form is the origin of consciousness is taught because consciousness, which is one part of name, is a condition of name-and-form.

original: rkyen nges pa la ji skad du gsungs pa'i mdo sde dang 'gal ba yin no //🔽rkyen can nges pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: rkyen nges pa la ji skad du gsungs pa'i mdo sde dang 'gal ba yin no // rkyen can nges pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: and it contradicts the sutra that specifies the conditions.

original: 'on te ming dang gzugs kho na rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis yin na ni rdzus te byung ba rnams la logs shig na ming dang gzugs med pa'i phyir skye @142a * //
analyzed: 'on te ming dang gzugs kho na rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis yin na ni rdzus te byung ba rnams la logs shig na ming dang gzugs med pa'i phyir skye @142a * //
translated: If you maintain that name-and-form is a condition of consciousness, then the six sense bases would not be a condition of name-and-form, because name-and-form does not exist separately from the six sense bases.

original: mched drug rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes smras te /
analyzed: mched drug rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes smras te /
translated: You say that the six sense bases are not a condition of consciousness,

original: rdzus te 'byung ba ni skye mched drug yongs su tshang ba kho nar cig car skye ba yin te /
analyzed: rdzus te 'byung ba ni skye mched drug yongs su tshang ba kho nar cig car skye ba yin te /
translated: but beings who are born supernaturally are born simultaneously with the complete six sense bases.

original: de dag la skye mched drug ma gtogs par ming dang gzugs rnam par gzhag tu med do //
analyzed: de dag la skye mched drug ma gtogs par ming dang gzugs rnam par gzhag tu med do //
translated: Name-and-form cannot be posited without the six sense bases.

original: de bas na rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs kyi yan lag rnam par gzhag par bya ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de bas na rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs kyi yan lag rnam par gzhag par bya ba ma yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, the member of name-and-form is not posited as a condition of consciousness.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it then?

original: skye mched drug go //
analyzed: skye mched drug go //
translated: It is the six sense bases.

original: 'on te de dag kyang ming dang gzugs tsam yin bas ming dang gzugs rnam par gzhag na ni ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis skye mched drug ces bya bar brjod du med par 'gyur zhing rang gi rigs kyi skad cig ma gzhan gang yin pa rkyen yin par
analyzed: 'on te de dag kyang ming dang gzugs tsam yin bas ming dang gzugs rnam par gzhag na ni ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis skye mched drug ces bya bar brjod du med par 'gyur zhing rang gi rigs kyi skad cig ma gzhan gang yin pa rkyen yin par
translated: But if name-and-form are posited as the condition of the six sense bases, then it would be impossible to say that the six sense bases are the condition of name-and-form, because name-and-form are merely name-and-form.

original: ni 'di las brjod par bzhed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ni 'di las brjod par bzhed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And it is not maintained that the condition is another moment of the same type.

original: de ltar na rnam par shes pa'i 'bras bu gzhan yang yod pas rkyen can nges par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na rnam par shes pa'i 'bras bu gzhan yang yod pas rkyen can nges par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, since there is another result of consciousness, it is not logical that consciousness is definitely a condition.🔽Also, with regard to the link of consciousness, contact would not occur from the union of the three, because at the time of positing the link of consciousness, name-and-form are not posited.

original: rnam par shes pa'i yan lag la yang gsum 'dus pa las reg pa ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa'i yan lag rnam par gzhag pa'i dus su ming dang gzugs rnam par gzhag tu med pas reg pa ni de'i tshe ming ma
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i yan lag la yang gsum 'dus pa las reg pa ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa'i yan lag rnam par gzhag pa'i dus su ming dang gzugs rnam par gzhag tu med pas reg pa ni de'i tshe ming ma
translated: Contact is not name,

original: yin la / de yang gsum 'dus pa las byung ba yin zhing /
analyzed: yin la / de yang gsum 'dus pa las byung ba yin zhing /
translated: and it arises from the union of the three.

original: de'i rkyen kyang rnam par shes pa yin na ni ming dang gzugs kho na rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis yin gyi gzhan ma yin no zhes rkyen can nges par byed na rnam par shes pa ni reg pa de'i rkyen ma yin par 'gyur ro //🔽'on te ma des pa yin na ni bshad pa don med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de'i rkyen kyang rnam par shes pa yin na ni ming dang gzugs kho na rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis yin gyi gzhan ma yin no zhes rkyen can nges par byed na rnam par shes pa ni reg pa de'i rkyen ma yin par 'gyur ro // 'on te ma des pa yin na ni bshad pa don med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: If consciousness is not the condition of name-and-form, then the explanation of the meaning of the Sūtra is pointless.

original: gal te / re zhig bstan pa'i don rgyu dang rkyen 'di dag yin na ni ming dang gzugs kyi rgyu thams cad brjod par bya dgos kyi /
analyzed: gal te / re zhig bstan pa'i don rgyu dang rkyen 'di dag yin na ni ming dang gzugs kyi rgyu thams cad brjod par bya dgos kyi /
translated: If the meaning of the Sūtra is that these are the causes and conditions of name-and-form, then all the causes of name-and-form should be mentioned,

original: rnam par shes pa 'ba' zhig ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa 'ba' zhig ni ma yin no //
translated: and not just consciousness.

original: 'bras bu shes par bya ba'i phyir yin na ni rnam par shes pa'i 'bras bu thams cad brjod par bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: 'bras bu shes par bya ba'i phyir yin na ni rnam par shes pa'i 'bras bu thams cad brjod par bya ba yin gyi /
translated: If the meaning of the Sūtra is that these are the effects of consciousness, then all the effects of consciousness should be mentioned,

original: ming dang gzugs 'ba' zhig ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs 'ba' zhig ni ma yin no //
translated: and not just name-and-form.

original: 'on te gnyi ga ma yin pa shes par bya ba'i phyir yin na ni 'o na 'di dag ci'i phyir bstan te /
analyzed: 'on te gnyi ga ma yin pa shes par bya ba'i phyir yin na ni 'o na 'di dag ci'i phyir bstan te /
translated: But if it is for the purpose of knowing that it is neither of the two, then why are they taught?

original: 'chad par byed pa dgos pa med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'chad par byed pa dgos pa med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because the purpose of the expounder is not necessary.

original: rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs zhes bya ba ni ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gtso bo'i dbang du byas te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs zhes bya ba ni ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gtso bo'i dbang du byas te /
translated: The statement “Conditioned by consciousness, name-and-form” is made from the perspective of the principal condition of name-and-form.

original: de skad bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: de skad bshad pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said.

original: rnam par shes pa kho na ming dang @142b gzugs kyi rkyen yin no zhes rkyen gyi dbang du byas pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa kho na ming dang @142b gzugs kyi rkyen yin no zhes rkyen gyi dbang du byas pa yin no //
translated: From the perspective of the condition, it is only consciousness that is the condition of name-and-form.

original: de'i bye brag gis zhes bya ba ni 'du byed kyis yongs su bsgos pa'i rnam par shes pa'i bye brag gis so //
analyzed: de'i bye brag gis zhes bya ba ni 'du byed kyis yongs su bsgos pa'i rnam par shes pa'i bye brag gis so //
translated: “By its specific nature” means by the specific nature of consciousness that is infused by karmic formations.

original: ris mthun pa de dag tha dad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni ming dang gzugs de'i ris mthun pa thad dpa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: ris mthun pa de dag tha dad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni ming dang gzugs de'i ris mthun pa thad dpa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: “Because of the difference in their continuity” means because of the difference in the continuity of that name-and-form.

original: ming dang gzugs ni lha dang mi la sogs pa'i ris tha dad pa la ltos par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs ni lha dang mi la sogs pa'i ris tha dad pa la ltos par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Name-and-form is not dependent on the different classes of gods, humans, etc.🔽Just as the different sprouts of rice, barley, etc.

original: 'bras s'a lu dang / nas la sogs pa'i myu gu tha dad pa ni sa bon gtso bor gyur pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni ji ltar 'bras s'a lu dang / nas kyi myu gu tha dad pa la ni sa bon gtso bo yin te /
analyzed: 'bras s'a lu dang / nas la sogs pa'i myu gu tha dad pa ni sa bon gtso bor gyur pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni ji ltar 'bras s'a lu dang / nas kyi myu gu tha dad pa la ni sa bon gtso bo yin te /
translated: are due to the predominance of the seeds of rice, barley, etc.,🔽so the different classes of gods, humans, etc.

original: de thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: are due to the predominance of the formative forces.

original: sa la sogs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sa la sogs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The earth, etc. are not the predominant factors,🔽because they are similar.

original: 'dra ba'i phyir ro de bzhin du ming dang gzugs ris mthun pa tha dad pa dag 'du byed kyis yongs su bsgos pa'i rnam par shes pa'i bye brag gis 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dra ba'i phyir ro de bzhin du ming dang gzugs ris mthun pa tha dad pa dag 'du byed kyis yongs su bsgos pa'i rnam par shes pa'i bye brag gis 'gyur te /
translated: In the same way, the different classes of gods, humans, etc. are due to the different kinds of consciousness that are infused by the formative forces.

original: skye ba'i rgyu ni las kyi yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba'i rgyu ni las kyi yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The cause of birth is karma.

original: 'dir yang skye ba'i rim pa yongs su rdzogs par rjod par bzhed pas zhes bya ba ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'di las yan lag bcu gnyis kyi mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'dir yang skye ba'i rim pa yongs su rdzogs par rjod par bzhed pas zhes bya ba ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'di las yan lag bcu gnyis kyi mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: Here, the twelve members are defined as the complete process of birth.

original: 'dir skye mched drug gi rkyen gyis gtso bo yang rnam par shes pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i mod sde 'di las na brgyud pa'i tshul gyi gtso bo ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir skye mched drug gi rkyen gyis gtso bo yang rnam par shes pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i mod sde 'di las na brgyud pa'i tshul gyi gtso bo ma yin te /
translated: Here, the six sense bases are not the principal condition for consciousness, because in this section of the dependent origination, consciousness is not the principal condition in a sequential process.

original: bdag po'i rkyen yin no //
analyzed: bdag po'i rkyen yin no //
translated: It is the dominant condition.

original: rdzus te byung ba rnams kyi skye mched drug skye ba la ni rnam par shes pa gtso po'i rkyen yin par grub pa yin no //
analyzed: rdzus te byung ba rnams kyi skye mched drug skye ba la ni rnam par shes pa gtso po'i rkyen yin par grub pa yin no //
translated: For those born supernaturally, the six sense bases are established as the principal condition for consciousness.

original: khyad par du ni ming dang gzugs kyi yang ci zhe na /🔽rnam par gtan la dbab pa'i zla la nus mod kyi //
analyzed: khyad par du ni ming dang gzugs kyi yang ci zhe na / rnam par gtan la dbab pa'i zla la nus mod kyi //
translated: What about name-and-form?

original: zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: It is possible to determine this in the Exposition of Valid Cognition.🔽What is the meaning of this verse?

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung pa'i mdo sde 'dir rgyu dang 'bras bur 'brel pa'i gsung rab mtha' dag blangs te bshad par nus te /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung pa'i mdo sde 'dir rgyu dang 'bras bur 'brel pa'i gsung rab mtha' dag blangs te bshad par nus te /
translated: In this sutra on dependent origination, one can take all the scriptures that are related to cause and effect and explain them,

original: gsung rab kyi ngo bo yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsung rab kyi ngo bo yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the essence of the scriptures is the object.

original: ming dang gzugs kyis bsdus pa'i don yang 'dir rnam pa bcur rnam par gzhag pa yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: ming dang gzugs kyis bsdus pa'i don yang 'dir rnam pa bcur rnam par gzhag pa yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: The meaning subsumed by name and form should be understood as being established here in ten aspects.

original: rang gi ngo bo rnam par gzhag pa ni ming dang gzugs kyi rang gi ngo bo brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo rnam par gzhag pa ni ming dang gzugs kyi rang gi ngo bo brjod pa'i phyir ro //
