translated: The establishment of their own nature is because the nature of name and form is expressed.

original: de la ming gi rang gi ngo bo rnam par gzhag pa ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo brjod pa las rig par bya'o //🔽gzugs kyi rang gi ngo bo rnam par gzhag pa ni sa la sogs pa'i rang @143a * //
analyzed: de la ming gi rang gi ngo bo rnam par gzhag pa ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo brjod pa las rig par bya'o // gzugs kyi rang gi ngo bo rnam par gzhag pa ni sa la sogs pa'i rang @143a * //
translated: The establishment of the nature of name should be understood from the expression of the nature of feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness.

original: gi ngo bo brjod pa las so //
analyzed: gi ngo bo brjod pa las so //
translated: The establishment of the nature of form is from the expression of the nature of earth and so forth.

original: rab tu dbye ba rnam par gzhag pa ni ji skad du gzugs can ma yin pa'i phung po bzhi dang / gzugs gang yin pa ci yang rung ste zhes rgyas par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba rnam par gzhag pa ni ji skad du gzugs can ma yin pa'i phung po bzhi dang / gzugs gang yin pa ci yang rung ste zhes rgyas par bstan pa'o //
translated: The presentation of the classification is as follows: “The four formless aggregates and any form whatsoever.

original: bsdus par rnam par gzhag pa ni ji skad du gzugs 'di dang / snga ma'i ming de dag gcig tu bsdus nas zhes rgyas par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bsdus par rnam par gzhag pa ni ji skad du gzugs 'di dang / snga ma'i ming de dag gcig tu bsdus nas zhes rgyas par bstan pa yin no //
translated: ” The presentation of the inclusion is as follows: “This form and the former name are included in one.

original: thog ma'i rkyen rnam par gzhag pa ni ji skad du /
analyzed: thog ma'i rkyen rnam par gzhag pa ni ji skad du /
translated: ” The presentation of the initial condition is as follows:

original: rang gi rigs skad cig ma gzhan gyi rkyen gyi dngos po 'dir ma yin no zhes rgyas par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi rigs skad cig ma gzhan gyi rkyen gyi dngos po 'dir ma yin no zhes rgyas par bstan pa'o //
translated: “This is not the condition of another moment of its own type.

original: nges pa'i tshig rnam par gzhag pa ni ji skad du /
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig rnam par gzhag pa ni ji skad du /
translated: ” The presentation of the etymology is as follows:

original: 'dud pas na ming zhes bya ba dang gnod par gyur pa de bas na gzugs yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'dud pas na ming zhes bya ba dang gnod par gyur pa de bas na gzugs yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: “It is called name because it bends, and it is called form because it is harmed.

original: rnam par gzhag pa'i dngos po rnam par gzhag pa ni ji skad du /
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa'i dngos po rnam par gzhag pa ni ji skad du /
translated: ” The presentation of the established bases is as follows:🔽“The eye sense faculty is the basis of the eye consciousness.

original: ci'i phyir phung po lnga rnams ming nyid du rnam par gzhag ce na zhes rgyas par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ci'i phyir phung po lnga rnams ming nyid du rnam par gzhag ce na zhes rgyas par bstan pa yin no //
translated: Why are the five aggregates established as name?

original: nye bar 'dzin pa rnam par gzhag pa ni ji skad du /
analyzed: nye bar 'dzin pa rnam par gzhag pa ni ji skad du /
translated: The establishment of the apprehender is taught extensively in the passage:

original: ming sngar smos pa ni des gzugs bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes rgyas par bstan pa yin no //🔽rigs mi mthun pa rkyen yin par rnam par gzhag pa ni ji skad du /
analyzed: ming sngar smos pa ni des gzugs bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes rgyas par bstan pa yin no // rigs mi mthun pa rkyen yin par rnam par gzhag pa ni ji skad du /
translated: Name is mentioned first because it apprehends form.🔽The establishment of dissimilar conditions is taught extensively in the passage:

original: mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i rnam par shes pa las gzugs ji ltar skye zhes rgyas par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i rnam par shes pa las gzugs ji ltar skye zhes rgyas par bstan pa yin no //
translated: How can form arise from consciousness that has a dissimilar characteristic?

original: rkyen nges pa rnam par gzhag pa ni ji skad du /
analyzed: rkyen nges pa rnam par gzhag pa ni ji skad du /
translated: The establishment of the certainty of conditions is taught extensively in the passage:

original: de lta na 'o na thams cad las thams cad ci'i phyir mi 'byung zhes rgyas par byas nas chos nyid kyis rang gi ngo bo tha dad pa chos de dag gi nus pa tha dad pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta na 'o na thams cad las thams cad ci'i phyir mi 'byung zhes rgyas par byas nas chos nyid kyis rang gi ngo bo tha dad pa chos de dag gi nus pa tha dad pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du bstan pa yin no //
translated: If that is so, then why don't all things arise from all things?

original: gtso bo'i rkyen rnam par gzhag pa ni ji skad du /
analyzed: gtso bo'i rkyen rnam par gzhag pa ni ji skad du /
translated: The establishment of the primary condition is taught extensively in the passage:

original: de'i bye brag gis ris mthun pa de dag tha dad pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i bye brag gis ris mthun pa de dag tha dad pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: because they are differentiated by their particularities.

original: ming dang gzugs rnam par dbye ba'o //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs rnam par dbye ba'o //
translated: The analysis of name-and-form.🔽What is the sixfold sense-field?

original: skye mched drug gang zhe na zhes bya ba ni ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis skye mched drug ces bstan pa de la skye mched drug kyang phyi dang nang rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: skye mched drug gang zhe na zhes bya ba ni ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis skye mched drug ces bstan pa de la skye mched drug kyang phyi dang nang rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: The sixfold sense-field is twofold: internal and external.

original: de bas na phyi rol gyi bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na phyi rol gyi bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in order to specify the external,

original: nang gi skye mched drug ste zhes rgyas par mdo sde ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: nang gi skye mched drug ste zhes rgyas par mdo sde ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: the internal six sense-fields are explained in detail, as in the sutra.

original: drug nyid skye mched yin pas skye mched drug ste /
analyzed: drug nyid skye mched yin pas skye mched drug ste /
translated: The six sense-fields are the six sense-fields because they are the sense-fields that are six.

original: ji ltar sa gsum dang 'bras bu gsum dang / tsha ba gsum lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni ji ltar gsum nyid sa yin pas sa gsum dang / gsum nyid tsha ba yin pas tsha ba gsum dang / gsum nyid 'bras bu yin pas 'bras bu zhes bya ba de bzhin du dpe @143b gsum po 'dis skye mched drug ces bya ba ni ming dang sgra nyid yin par bstan te /
analyzed: ji ltar sa gsum dang 'bras bu gsum dang / tsha ba gsum lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni ji ltar gsum nyid sa yin pas sa gsum dang / gsum nyid tsha ba yin pas tsha ba gsum dang / gsum nyid 'bras bu yin pas 'bras bu zhes bya ba de bzhin du dpe @143b gsum po 'dis skye mched drug ces bya ba ni ming dang sgra nyid yin par bstan te /
translated: show that the six sense bases are names and sounds.

original: gzhi gcig tu byas pa yang yin no //
analyzed: gzhi gcig tu byas pa yang yin no //
translated: They are also a single basis.

original: ming dang sgra yin pa de nyid kyi phyir mang po'i tshig tu ma yin te /
analyzed: ming dang sgra yin pa de nyid kyi phyir mang po'i tshig tu ma yin te /
translated: They are not plural because they are names and sounds.

original: ji ltar shing tog aa mra lnga dang bcu zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji ltar shing tog aa mra lnga dang bcu zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, “five or ten mangoes.”🔽The explanation of the application of the term is in order to eliminate

original: sgra sbyar ba bstan pa ni sgra sbyar ba gzhan du rtog pa bsal ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: sgra sbyar ba bstan pa ni sgra sbyar ba gzhan du rtog pa bsal ba'i phyir te /
translated: the misconception that the application of the term is elsewhere.🔽If the application of the term were “the six sense bases are the six sense

original: drug gi skye mched ni skye mched drug go zhes sgra sbyar na ni drug gi gnas tsam zhig yin par grags par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: drug gi skye mched ni skye mched drug go zhes sgra sbyar na ni drug gi gnas tsam zhig yin par grags par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: bases,” it would be known as merely the basis of the six.

original: yid kyi skye mched tsam zhig yin par grags par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yid kyi skye mched tsam zhig yin par grags par 'gyur te /
translated: The mental faculty alone would be known as the sense base.

original: de yang rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug ni skye ba'i sgo'i don gyis skye mched yin no //
analyzed: de yang rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug ni skye ba'i sgo'i don gyis skye mched yin no //
translated: The six collections of consciousness are sense bases in the sense of being doors of entry.

original: drug gi skye mched ni skye mched drug go zhes sgra spyar na ni drug gis zhes bya ba yang gang yin /🔽skye mched kyang gang yin /
analyzed: drug gi skye mched ni skye mched drug go zhes sgra spyar na ni drug gis zhes bya ba yang gang yin / skye mched kyang gang yin /
translated: If the term bases is applied to the six, then what is the six and what is the bases?

original: rtogs par bya ba ci yin pa nges par ma zin pas de tsam ni ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis ma yin no //🔽drug las skye mched dam /
analyzed: rtogs par bya ba ci yin pa nges par ma zin pas de tsam ni ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis ma yin no // drug las skye mched dam /
translated: Since it is not ascertained what is to be understood, that much is not the condition of name-and-form.🔽If the term bases is applied to the six,

original: drug tu skye mched ces sgra sbyar na ni drug kyang nges par byar med la /
analyzed: drug tu skye mched ces sgra sbyar na ni drug kyang nges par byar med la /
translated: then what is the six and what is the bases?

original: de las dang de dag tu skye mched ces bya ba gzhan ci zhig yin pa brjod par bya dgos so //
analyzed: de las dang de dag tu skye mched ces bya ba gzhan ci zhig yin pa brjod par bya dgos so //
translated: Since it is not ascertained, it must be stated what is different from that and that, which is the bases.

original: de tsam yang ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis ma yin no //
analyzed: de tsam yang ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis ma yin no //
translated: That much is not the condition of name-and-form.

original: drug dang skye mched dang zhes sgra sbyar na ni //
analyzed: drug dang skye mched dang zhes sgra sbyar na ni //
translated: If the term bases is applied to the six and the sense bases,🔽then what is the six and what is the sense bases?

original: gzhan drug dang skye mched bcu gnyis su nges par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan drug dang skye mched bcu gnyis su nges par 'gyur te /
translated: The other six and the twelve sense spheres would be determined.

original: drug dang skye mched tsam ni ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis yin par 'dod pa yang ma yin no //🔽skye mched drug rnams de ni 'di'i yin pas 'di ni skye mched drug go zhes sgra sbyar na ni skye mched drug la ma gtogs pa sems can zhes bya ba'i dngos po grags par 'gyur ba dang sems dang sems las byung ba'am /
analyzed: drug dang skye mched tsam ni ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis yin par 'dod pa yang ma yin no // skye mched drug rnams de ni 'di'i yin pas 'di ni skye mched drug go zhes sgra sbyar na ni skye mched drug la ma gtogs pa sems can zhes bya ba'i dngos po grags par 'gyur ba dang sems dang sems las byung ba'am /
translated: And it is not maintained that the mere six and the mere sense spheres are conditioned by name-and-form.

original: sems las byung pa'i rgyun tsam grags par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems las byung pa'i rgyun tsam grags par 'gyur te /
translated: If the compound were analyzed as “the six sense spheres are its own, therefore it is the six sense spheres,” then a thing called sentient being that is not included in the six sense spheres would be renowned, and the mere continuum of mind and mental factors or the mere continuum of mental factors would be renowned.

original: de yang ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis yin par dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis yin par dgongs pa yin no //
translated: And that is intended to be conditioned by name-and-form.

original: skye mched rnams so zhes mang po'i tshig phyung nas sgra sbyar na ni skye mched drug rnams so zhes bya ba 'grub par 'gyur te ;
analyzed: skye mched rnams so zhes mang po'i tshig phyung nas sgra sbyar na ni skye mched drug rnams so zhes bya ba 'grub par 'gyur te ;
translated: If the compound were analyzed as “the sense spheres are its own, therefore it is the sense spheres,” then the six sense spheres would be established.

original: ji ltar rtsa ba lnga rnams so zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji ltar rtsa ba lnga rnams so zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: It would be like the expression “the five roots.”

original: bdag yod pa ma yin na ji ltar na nang gi zhes bya zhe na /🔽de'i phyir 'di dag la bdag tu nga rgyal skyed par byed pas bdag ni so so'i lus dang sems kyi rgyun yin te /
analyzed: bdag yod pa ma yin na ji ltar na nang gi zhes bya zhe na / de'i phyir 'di dag la bdag tu nga rgyal skyed par byed pas bdag ni so so'i lus dang sems kyi rgyun yin te /
translated: If the self does not exist, how can there be an “internal”?🔽Therefore, it is said in detail: “The self is the continuum of each individual’s body and mind, because the notion of self is generated in relation to them.

original: de'i dbang du byas pa yin pas na zhes bya'o zhes rgyas @144a * //🔽bar smos so //
analyzed: de'i dbang du byas pa yin pas na zhes bya'o zhes rgyas @144a * // bar smos so //
translated: It is said that the self is the object of the notion of “I” and the notion of “mine.”🔽The self is the object of the notion of “I” and the notion of “mine” because the notion of “I” and the notion of “mine” are generated in relation to it.

original: 'di dag la bdag tu nga rgyal skyed par byed pas bdag go zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i tshig gi tshul gyis so //
analyzed: 'di dag la bdag tu nga rgyal skyed par byed pas bdag go zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i tshig gi tshul gyis so //
translated: This is the method of explanation.

original: de gang zhe na /
analyzed: de gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: de'i phyir so so'i lus dang sems kyi rgyun yin te zhes smras so //
analyzed: de'i phyir so so'i lus dang sems kyi rgyun yin te zhes smras so //
translated: Therefore, it is said that the self is the continuum of each individual’s body and mind.

original: bdag de'i dbang du ched du byas te nang zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bdag de'i dbang du ched du byas te nang zhes bya'o //
translated: The self is said to be internal because it is the object of the notion of “I.”

original: der byung ba zhes bya ba ni nang der byung ba'i skye mched gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: der byung ba zhes bya ba ni nang der byung ba'i skye mched gang yin pa ste /
translated: That which arises in relation to that is the internal sense bases.

original: skye mched drug de ni nang gi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: skye mched drug de ni nang gi zhes bya'o //
translated: The six sense bases that arise in relation to the self are said to be internal.

original: rgyu mtshan bdun pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni der byung ba zhes bya ba bdun pa yin pa'i bdun pa de ni rgyu mtshan gyi bdun pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan bdun pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni der byung ba zhes bya ba bdun pa yin pa'i bdun pa de ni rgyu mtshan gyi bdun pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The seventh case is the reason for the seventh case.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is this?

original: de'i phyir byung ba dang de'i rgyu mtshan du byung ba la der byung ba zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir byung ba dang de'i rgyu mtshan du byung ba la der byung ba zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, that which arises from that and that which arises as the reason for that is called “that which arises there.”

original: gzugs la sogs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But form, etc., is not,🔽because it is the common cause of other consciousnesses.

original: gzhan gyi rnam par shes pa'i rgyu dang thun mong yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nang gi skye mched ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi rnam par shes pa'i rgyu dang thun mong yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nang gi skye mched ma yin te /
translated: The internal sense bases are not like that,

original: 'di ltar de ni gzhan dag gi rnam par shes pa'i rgyu dang thun mong yin pa dang skye mched kyang ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni gzhan dag gi rnam par shes pa'i rgyu dang thun mong yin pa dang skye mched kyang ngo //
translated: because they are the common cause of other consciousnesses and are also sense bases.

original: yang na nang nyid nang gi yin te /
analyzed: yang na nang nyid nang gi yin te /
translated: Or, the internal is internal,🔽like those to be disciplined, etc.

original: rnam par gdul bar bya ba la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni bdag gi ched du byas pa'i skye mched gang yin pa de ni nang gi zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par gdul bar bya ba la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni bdag gi ched du byas pa'i skye mched gang yin pa de ni nang gi zhes bya ste /
translated: That sense base which is made for one’s own sake is called internal.

original: ji ltar bud med kyi ched du byas pa gang yin pa de ni bud med kyi ched du yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar bud med kyi ched du byas pa gang yin pa de ni bud med kyi ched du yin pa bzhin no //
translated: Just as what is done for the sake of a woman is for the sake of a woman.

original: nang nyid nang gi yin te /
analyzed: nang nyid nang gi yin te /
translated: The internal is internal.

original: de ni rang gi don nyid yin par ston pa de yin no //
analyzed: de ni rang gi don nyid yin par ston pa de yin no //
translated: This is the teaching of its own meaning.

original: ji ltar gdul bya nyid gdul bar bya ba yin pa dang / tshul bzang nyid tshul bzang ba pa yin pa dang / dam tshig nyid dam tshig pa yin pa dang / bye brag nyid bye brag pa yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar gdul bya nyid gdul bar bya ba yin pa dang / tshul bzang nyid tshul bzang ba pa yin pa dang / dam tshig nyid dam tshig pa yin pa dang / bye brag nyid bye brag pa yin pa bzhin no //
translated: Just as the one to be disciplined is the one to be disciplined, the good discipline is the good discipline, the vow is the vow, and the distinction is the distinction.

original: de ltar byas na der byung ba zhes bya ba yang brjod dgos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar byas na der byung ba zhes bya ba yang brjod dgos par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is done in this way, it must also be said that it arises there.

original: bdag gi sgra lhag par sngar byas pa'am zhes bya ba ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: bdag gi sgra lhag par sngar byas pa'am zhes bya ba ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of the word self being added before?

original: bdag tu nga rgyal lhag par 'di nyid la skyed pa'i so so'i lus dang sems kyi rgyun ni nges pa'i tshig gi tshul gyi nang yin no //
analyzed: bdag tu nga rgyal lhag par 'di nyid la skyed pa'i so so'i lus dang sems kyi rgyun ni nges pa'i tshig gi tshul gyi nang yin no //
translated: The continuum of one's own body and mind, where pride in self is generated, is internal in the sense of etymological analysis.

original: de'i dgos pa yin pa ni de'i ched yin pa dang so so'i lus dang sems kyi rgyun gyi don yin pa dang / de skye ba'i rgyun gyi rgyu mtshan ni nang gi zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i dgos pa yin pa ni de'i ched yin pa dang so so'i lus dang sems kyi rgyun gyi don yin pa dang / de skye ba'i rgyun gyi rgyu mtshan ni nang gi zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The purpose of that is for the sake of that, and the meaning of the continuum of one's own body and mind, and the reason for the continuum of its arising is called internal.

original: de ltar byas na bdag gi ched du zhes bya ba yang brjod par ma dgos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar byas na bdag gi ched du zhes bya ba yang brjod par ma dgos par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were so, then it would be unnecessary to say for the sake of the self.

original: phyi rol ni de las gzhan yin no zhes bya ba ni nang gi mtshan nyid ji skad du bstan pa de las zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: phyi rol ni de las gzhan yin no zhes bya ba ni nang gi mtshan nyid ji skad du bstan pa de las zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: External means other than that. This means other than what was taught as the characteristics of the internal.

original: 'byung ba'i don @144b ni skye mched kyi don te zhes bya ba ni 'di nas 'gro bas na skye zhes bya ba 'byung zhes bya bar mngon pa yin no //
analyzed: 'byung ba'i don @144b ni skye mched kyi don te zhes bya ba ni 'di nas 'gro bas na skye zhes bya ba 'byung zhes bya bar mngon pa yin no //
translated: The meaning of arising is the meaning of sense base. This means that because one goes from here, it is called arising, and it is clear that it is called arising.

original: rgyas pas na mched pa ste /
analyzed: rgyas pas na mched pa ste /
translated: It spreads, therefore it is a sense base.

original: rgya cher gyur ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rgya cher gyur ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means it becomes extensive.

original: skye ba nyid mched pa yin pas skye mched do //
analyzed: skye ba nyid mched pa yin pas skye mched do //
translated: Because arising itself is spreading, it is a sense base.

original: yang na 'ong bas na skye zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yang na 'ong bas na skye zhes bya ste /
translated: Or, because it comes, it is called arising.

original: 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa'o //
translated: The meaning of “source” is the meaning of “sense base.”

original: 'byung ba de mched par byed pas skye mched de 'bras bu'i rgyun 'byung bar byed ces bya ba'i don gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba de mched par byed pas skye mched de 'bras bu'i rgyun 'byung bar byed ces bya ba'i don gang yin pa'o //
translated: The meaning of “sense base” is the meaning of “origin” because it is the origin of the effect continuum.

original: de ltar na 'byung ba'i don ni skye mched kyi don yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na 'byung ba'i don ni skye mched kyi don yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Thus, the meaning of “source” is the meaning of “sense base.”🔽Others say that the meaning of “source” is the meaning of “door.”

original: gzhan dag na re sgo'i don yin te zhes bya ba ci zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re sgo'i don yin te zhes bya ba ci zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of “door”?

original: skye mched kyi don to zhes bya ba'i skabs dang sbyar ro ;
analyzed: skye mched kyi don to zhes bya ba'i skabs dang sbyar ro ;
translated: The meaning of “sense base.”🔽They say that the meaning of “sense base” is the meaning of “door.”🔽They say that the meaning of “sense base” is the meaning of “door.”🔽They say that the meaning of “sense base” is the meaning of “door.”🔽They say that the meaning of “sense base” is the meaning of “door.”

analyzed: / de dag gis phyi rol rnams gang gi sgo yin par brjod par bya dgos so zhes bya ba ni skye mched sgo'i don yin par smra ba de dag gis phyi rol gzugs la sogs pa rnams gang zhig mthong bar bya ba'i phyir sgo zhes brjod par bya

analyzed: de nyid de nyid kyis mthong bar byed pa'i sgo yin par ni rigs pa ma yin no //

original: don ni rgyu'i rnam grangs kyi sgra yin pa'i phyir sgo'i sgra ni gzugs mthong ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir gzugs rnams mthong bar bya ba'i phyir sgo gzugs yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //

translated: The term “door” is a synonym for cause. Therefore, the meaning of the statement “visible forms are the door for seeing visible forms” is that visible forms are the cause for seeing visible forms.

original: de ltar byas na 'byung ba'i don nyid skye mched kyi don yin no zhes smras pa yin pas ded la ci gnod /
analyzed: de ltar byas na 'byung ba'i don nyid skye mched kyi don yin no zhes smras pa yin pas ded la ci gnod /
translated: If this is the case, then the meaning of the term “sense base” is the same as the meaning of the term “element.” What is the harm in that?

original: sgra la sogs pa la yang de bzhin sbyar ro //
analyzed: sgra la sogs pa la yang de bzhin sbyar ro //
translated: The same explanation applies to sound, etc.

original: gzhan dag na re gnas kyi don yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re gnas kyi don yin te /
translated: Others say that the sense bases have the meaning of abode.

original: lha'i skye mched bzhin no zhes bya ba ni ji ltar lha'i gnas la lha'i skye mched ces bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: lha'i skye mched bzhin no zhes bya ba ni ji ltar lha'i gnas la lha'i skye mched ces bya ba bzhin no //
translated: Just as the abode of the devas is called the sense base of the devas.🔽If one consciousness arises from two eyes, which is its basis?

original: mig gnyis las rnam par shes pa gcig skye na de'i gnas gang yin zhes bya ba ni mig gnyi ga yang skye mched yin pa'i phyir dang / gnyi ga yang rgyu gtso bo yin pa'i phyir mig gi rnam par shes pa de'i gnas gcig cig yin par ni 'grub par mi 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: mig gnyis las rnam par shes pa gcig skye na de'i gnas gang yin zhes bya ba ni mig gnyi ga yang skye mched yin pa'i phyir dang / gnyi ga yang rgyu gtso bo yin pa'i phyir mig gi rnam par shes pa de'i gnas gcig cig yin par ni 'grub par mi 'gyur ro ;
translated: Since both eyes are sense bases and both are primary causes, it is not established that one of them is the basis of that eye consciousness.

original: / de'i phyir gnyi ga yin no zhe na zhes rgyas par smras te /
analyzed: / de'i phyir gnyi ga yin no zhe na zhes rgyas par smras te /
translated: Therefore, if you say both are its basis,

original: gnyi ga yang mig gi rnam par shes pa de'i gnas yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gnyi ga yang mig gi rnam par shes pa de'i gnas yin no zhe na /
translated: if both are the basis of that eye consciousness,🔽because there is nothing between them,

original: bar na de med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba mig de med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don te /🔽rnam par shes pa yang rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur te /
analyzed: bar na de med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba mig de med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don te / rnam par shes pa yang rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur te /

original: de'i rnam par shes pa rnam pa gnyis su @145a * //🔽'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i rnam par shes pa rnam pa gnyis su @145a * //🔽'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: That consciousness would be twofold.

original: yang na de yang de'i gnas yin no zhes bya ba ni de'i bar na yang yod na ni rnam pa thams cad du rnam par shes pa cha shas dang bcas pa yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang na de yang de'i gnas yin no zhes bya ba ni de'i bar na yang yod na ni rnam pa thams cad du rnam par shes pa cha shas dang bcas pa yin par 'gyur te /
translated: Or, if it exists between them, then consciousness would always have parts,

original: bye brag pa yan lag can smra ba dag dang mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bye brag pa yan lag can smra ba dag dang mthun pa'i phyir ro //

original: gcig pu du ma la brten par smra ba 'di yang ngo mtshar che'o //🔽gnyi ga las gcig skye ba ma yin no zhe na yang zhes bya ba ni 'on te 'di snyam du mig gi rnam par shes pa gcig mig gnyi ga las skye ba ma yin no snyam na de yang /
analyzed: gcig pu du ma la brten par smra ba 'di yang ngo mtshar che'o // gnyi ga las gcig skye ba ma yin no zhe na yang zhes bya ba ni 'on te 'di snyam du mig gi rnam par shes pa gcig mig gnyi ga las skye ba ma yin no snyam na de yang /
translated: It is amazing to say that one thing is based on many things.🔽If you say that one consciousness is not produced from both eyes, then that is also unreasonable, because it is said, “If one consciousness is not produced from both eyes,” and so on.

original: mi rung ste gnyis kyis zhes rgyas par 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: mi rung ste gnyis kyis zhes rgyas par 'byung ba yin te /
translated: If one consciousness is not produced from both eyes, then it is also unreasonable to say that one consciousness is produced from one eye.

original: mig gnyis kyis ni shin tu gsal ba yin te /
analyzed: mig gnyis kyis ni shin tu gsal ba yin te /
translated: Because the eyes are very clear,

original: mthong ba shin tu gsal ba zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba shin tu gsal ba zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa'o //
translated: the meaning of “seeing is very clear” is that.

original: gcig gis ni gsal ba ma yin par mngon sum du grub pa yin no //
analyzed: gcig gis ni gsal ba ma yin par mngon sum du grub pa yin no //
translated: It is established by direct perception that one eye is not clear.

original: de bas na gcig gis rim gyis mthong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na gcig gis rim gyis mthong ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not seen by one eye alone.

original: mig phye ba dang phyed btsums pa gnyis kyis cig car zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni mig gcig phye ba dang / gcig phyed btsums pa ni mig bye ba dang phyed btsums pa ste /🔽gal te gcig nas mthong ba yin na ya gcig phye ba dang ya gcig phyed btsums pa de gnyis kyis /🔽cig car dus gcig tu zla ba gnyis la sogs pa mthong bar mi 'gyur ro //

translated: The text continues: “If it were seen by one eye alone, then when one eye is open and the other is half closed, one would not see two moons, etc.🔽at the same time, simultaneously.🔽Just as when both eyes are open, one does not see two moons, etc.,🔽and when both are half closed, one does not see two moons, etc.

original: ji ltar mig gnyi ga phye bas cig car du ma yin pa dang / gnyi ga phyed btsums pas cig car du ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar mig gnyi ga phye bas cig car du ma yin pa dang / gnyi ga phyed btsums pas cig car du ma yin pa bzhin no //

analyzed: gnyi ga 'byung ba yang yod de de bas na de lta bu yin na ni de'i rgyu yin no zhes nges par byar rung ngo //

original: phyi rol gyi ma zin pa rnams kyang zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni phyi rol gyi gzugs la sogs pa ma zin pa rnams kyang ji ltar gnas nyid yin /🔽gang gi phyir gnas kyi don gyis de dag skye mched ces rjod par byed /

original: ma zin pa smos pas ni dbang po dang lhan cig 'dug pa bsal ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: ma zin pa smos pas ni dbang po dang lhan cig 'dug pa bsal ba'i phyir te /

analyzed: de dag dbang po dang lhan cig 'dug pa'i phyir gnas kyi don ni skye mched kyi don te zhes bya bar 'grub bo //

analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang dus mi mtshungs pa'i yid dang chos gnyis kyang ji ltar gnas nyid yin zhes bya ba'i skabs yin /

original: de nyid kyi phyir dgu brgya pa las gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dgu brgya pa las gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The Sūtra says that the

original: de bas na lus can ma yin zhing gzugs can ma yin pa'i chos rnams kyi gnas rnam par gzhag par nus pa ma yin no //🔽'o na bdag gi klad pa'i phyir du tshor ro //
analyzed: de bas na lus can ma yin zhing gzugs can ma yin pa'i chos rnams kyi gnas rnam par gzhag par nus pa ma yin no // 'o na bdag gi klad pa'i phyir du tshor ro //
translated: Therefore, it is not possible to establish the location of non-embodied and non-physical phenomena.🔽But how is it known that the feeling is in the head or in half of the head?

analyzed: bdag gi klad pa'i phyed du tshor ro zhes bya ba 'di ji ltar yongs su gcod ci na zhes rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: The text says, “How is it known?”

analyzed: lus kyi phyogs de dag na de yod pa'i yul las zhes bya ba ni lus kyi phyogs de dag las zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of “from the object where it exists” is from the part of the body where it exists.

original: de skye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni tshor ba de skye ba'i phyir ci zhe na /
analyzed: de skye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni tshor ba de skye ba'i phyir ci zhe na /

analyzed: bdag gi klad par tshor ro bdag gi klad pa'i phyed du chor ro zhes yongs su gcod par byed do //
translated: The meaning of “it is known that the feeling is in the head or in half of the head” is that it is known that the feeling is in the head or in half of the head.🔽The text says, “This is exactly the case.”

original: 'di ni de lta bu kho na yin te zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni nad can gyi lus kyi phyogs la lag pa'i sor mo'i rtse mo'am /
analyzed: 'di ni de lta bu kho na yin te zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni nad can gyi lus kyi phyogs la lag pa'i sor mo'i rtse mo'am /
translated: The meaning of “in the part of the body of the one who is sick” is in the part of the body of the one who is sick.

analyzed: gzhan gang yang rung bas ma bzung bar tshor ba'i rang bzhin yongs su gcod pa med do //
translated: There is no determination of the nature of feeling without the apprehension of something else.

original: de bas na rnam pa de dag gis ni lus kyi phyogs de dag na de yod pa'i yul las de skye ba'i phyir tshor ba'i yul yongs su gcod par mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed do zhes bya ba grub pa yin no //

translated: Therefore, it is established that, by these modes, one is conceited with the determination of the object of feeling, because it arises from the object of that which exists in those parts of the body.

original: 'dis ni nad can gyi lus kyi phyogs na de gnas pa ni lag pa la sogs pa'i yul yin par bsgrubs pa yin no //🔽rgyu la yang gnas zhes bya ba ni gnas kyi don nyid skye mched kyi don yin la /

original: gnas kyi don yang 'dir rgyu'i don yin no zhes ston par byed kyi /
analyzed: gnas kyi don yang 'dir rgyu'i don yin no zhes ston par byed kyi /

original: gnas kyi don lha'i gnas lta bu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gnas kyi don lha'i gnas lta bu ni ma yin no //

original: gnas kyi don rgyu'i don yin par ji ltar gang du mthong zhe na /
analyzed: gnas kyi don rgyu'i don yin par ji ltar gang du mthong zhe na /
translated: How is it known that the meaning of “abode” is the meaning of “cause”?

original: @146a * // ji skad du tshigs su bcad pa las /
analyzed: @146a * // ji skad du tshigs su bcad pa las /
translated: As it is said in the verse:

original: bden par smra zhing khro mi byed //
analyzed: bden par smra zhing khro mi byed //
translated: One speaks the truth and does not get angry.

original: slong la chung yang sbyin par byed //
analyzed: slong la chung yang sbyin par byed //
translated: One gives to a beggar even if one has little.

original: rnam pa 'di gsum gnas kyis ni //
analyzed: rnam pa 'di gsum gnas kyis ni //
translated: By these three types of action,

original: lha yi nang du skye bar 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: lha yi nang du skye bar 'gyur // zhes gsungs te /
translated: one is reborn among the gods.

original: rgyu 'di gsum gyis zhes bya bar mngon pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu 'di gsum gyis zhes bya bar mngon pa yin no //
translated: The three causes are stated in the verse.

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug rnams skye ba mched par byed pas skye mched de zhes bya ba ni rgya cher byed ces bya ba'i don gang yin pa'o //🔽de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug rnams skye ba mched par byed pas skye mched de zhes bya ba ni rgya cher byed ces bya ba'i don gang yin pa'o // de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: The six collections of consciousness are the source of origination of the sense bases, thus they are called sense bases.

original: de skye ba'i rgyun gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes smras te /
analyzed: de skye ba'i rgyun gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes smras te /
translated: This is the meaning of the statement, “because they are the cause of the continuity of its arising.🔽”

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug skye ba'i rgyun gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug skye ba'i rgyun gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: because they are the cause of the continuity of the arising of the six collections of consciousness.

original: de skye ba'i rgyun ni rgyas pa dang / 'ong ba dang / skye ba'o //
analyzed: de skye ba'i rgyun ni rgyas pa dang / 'ong ba dang / skye ba'o //
translated: The continuity of its arising is its growth, coming, and birth.

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug skye ba ni de'i rgyun rgyas pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug skye ba ni de'i rgyun rgyas pa yin no //
translated: The arising of the six collections of consciousness is the growth of that continuity.

original: de'i phyir rgyun gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa'i tshogs rnams skye ba mched par byed pas skye mched do zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyun gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa'i tshogs rnams skye ba mched par byed pas skye mched do zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i tshig yin no //
translated: Therefore, because they are the cause of the continuum, the collections of consciousness are the bases of origination, because they cause the origination of the aggregates. This is the verbal derivation.🔽The five sense objects are form, sound, smell, taste, and tangible objects. The five sense faculties are the eye, etc., in that order.

original: de la gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya yul gzugs dang ba'i bye brag mig la sogs pa lnga go rims bzhin no zhes bya ba 'di la gzugs la sogs pa yul zhes bya ba 'dis ni gzugs kyi skye mched du dang ba bsdus par 'gyur ba bsal ba yin te /
analyzed: de la gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya yul gzugs dang ba'i bye brag mig la sogs pa lnga go rims bzhin no zhes bya ba 'di la gzugs la sogs pa yul zhes bya ba 'dis ni gzugs kyi skye mched du dang ba bsdus par 'gyur ba bsal ba yin te /
translated: The phrase “the five sense objects” is used to exclude the sense object of form that is included in the sense base of form.

original: 'di dag ni gzugs la sogs pa yul ma yin no zhes nges par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni gzugs la sogs pa yul ma yin no zhes nges par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the sense objects are not form, etc.

original: go rims bzhin no zhes bya ba yang ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: go rims bzhin no zhes bya ba yang ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of the phrase “in that order”?

original: gzugs la sogs pa lnga dang / mig la sogs pa lnga nyid go rims bzhin du bya bar nus pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa lnga dang / mig la sogs pa lnga nyid go rims bzhin du bya bar nus pa yin no //
translated: The five sense objects and the five sense faculties, beginning with the eye, are respectively capable of five kinds of activity.

original: bye brag smos pa ni yul dang 'dres par 'gyur ba bsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bye brag smos pa ni yul dang 'dres par 'gyur ba bsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The specification of the sense objects is made in order to exclude the sense base of form.

original: gzugs dang ba nyid kyi bye brag kyang de dag la yod pa yin te /
analyzed: gzugs dang ba nyid kyi bye brag kyang de dag la yod pa yin te /
translated: Also, the specific clarity of form exists for them.

original: dang ba'i bye brag can kha cig gi yul ni gzugs yin /
analyzed: dang ba'i bye brag can kha cig gi yul ni gzugs yin /
translated: The object of some that possess specific clarity is form.

original: kha cig gi yul ni sgra'o //
analyzed: kha cig gi yul ni sgra'o //
translated: The object of some is sound.

original: de bzhin du dri dang ro dang reg bya yul yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du dri dang ro dang reg bya yul yin no //
translated: Similarly, smell, taste, and tactility are objects.

original: de dag kyang rang gi yul la dmigs par byed par yod do zhes bya ba ni yid ches pa'i lung dang rigs pas nges par byar rung ste /
analyzed: de dag kyang rang gi yul la dmigs par byed par yod do zhes bya ba ni yid ches pa'i lung dang rigs pas nges par byar rung ste /
translated: It is suitable to ascertain that they exist as the object of observation of their respective objects by means of authoritative scripture and reasoning.

original: ji skad du mig gi dbang po gang zhe na /
analyzed: ji skad du mig gi dbang po gang zhe na /
translated: As it is said, What is the eye faculty?🔽It is the clarity of form that is the basis of eye consciousness.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rten ni gzugs dang ba'o zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung pa dang / ming dang gzugs la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ba nas lus dang reg bya la brten nas lus kyi rnam par shes pa skye'o zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa thams cad yin te /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rten ni gzugs dang ba'o zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung pa dang / ming dang gzugs la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ba nas lus dang reg bya la brten nas lus kyi rnam par shes pa skye'o zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa thams cad yin te /
translated: It is said that eye consciousness arises in dependence on name and form, up to body consciousness arises in dependence on body and tactility.

original: long ba la sogs pa la gzugs la sogs pa @146b mthong ba med pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa'i yul la gzugs dang ba'i bye brag mig la sogs pa yod do zhes bya ba 'grub pa yin no //
analyzed: long ba la sogs pa la gzugs la sogs pa @146b mthong ba med pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa'i yul la gzugs dang ba'i bye brag mig la sogs pa yod do zhes bya ba 'grub pa yin no //
translated: because the blind, etc. do not see form, etc.

original: ci'i phyir 'di las reg bya yul zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni ci'i phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i mdo sde 'di las reg bya yul dang ba'i bye brag lus zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'di las reg bya yul zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni ci'i phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i mdo sde 'di las reg bya yul dang ba'i bye brag lus zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Why is it that in this Dependent Origination Sutra, the body is the specific basis of tactile objects,

original: ji ltar lus la lus zhes bya ba bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa yul dang ba'i bye brag mig la sogs pa ni lus zhes ma bstan la /
analyzed: ji ltar lus la lus zhes bya ba bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa yul dang ba'i bye brag mig la sogs pa ni lus zhes ma bstan la /
translated: but the eye, etc. are not called the body, as is the body, even though they are the specific basis of form, etc.?

original: ji ltar na 'di las yul reg bya dang ba'i bye brag lus yin no zhes bstan te /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'di las yul reg bya dang ba'i bye brag lus yin no zhes bstan te /
translated: Why is it that in this sutra, the body is the specific basis of tactile objects?

original: lus kyi skye mched ces gsungs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: lus kyi skye mched ces gsungs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because it is said to be the body sense-sphere.🔽Therefore it is said:

original: de'i phyir / lus la khyab pa nyid kyi phyir //🔽zhes smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / lus la khyab pa nyid kyi phyir //🔽zhes smras te /
translated: Because it pervades the body.

original: 'di ltar lus 'di ni lus kyi mtshan nyid la khyab par gnas pa yin gyi mig la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar lus 'di ni lus kyi mtshan nyid la khyab par gnas pa yin gyi mig la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, this body is the universal foundation of the body, but not the eye, etc.

original: de bas na gnas ni gnas pa la bstan pa'am /
analyzed: de bas na gnas ni gnas pa la bstan pa'am /
translated: Therefore, the universal foundation is taught as the universal foundation of the body,

original: lus bzhin du gnas yin pas lus kyi skye mched ces bya'o //
analyzed: lus bzhin du gnas yin pas lus kyi skye mched ces bya'o //
translated: or it is called the body-sense-sphere because it is the universal foundation like the body.

original: rdul phra mo bsags pa'i bye brag can yin ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni ci zhe na /
analyzed: rdul phra mo bsags pa'i bye brag can yin ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni ci zhe na /
translated: Because it is a particular aggregation of atoms.🔽What is it?

original: lus yin no zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lus yin no zhes bya'o //
translated: The body.

original: mig la sogs pa rten kyang rdul phra mo bsags pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa rten kyang rdul phra mo bsags pa yin mod kyi /
translated: The eye, etc. are also aggregations of atoms, but

original: 'di ni rdul phra mo bsags pa bye brag can yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni rdul phra mo bsags pa bye brag can yin no //
translated: this is a particular aggregation of atoms.

original: bye brag can nyid ni phal che ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bye brag can nyid ni phal che ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The particularity is due to the predominance of the atoms of the four great elements.

original: khyad par du gyur pa 'dis na bsags pa gang yin pa de ni lus yin par 'di las gsungs pa yin no zhes ston pa yin gyi /
analyzed: khyad par du gyur pa 'dis na bsags pa gang yin pa de ni lus yin par 'di las gsungs pa yin no zhes ston pa yin gyi /
translated: This is what is taught: that which is an aggregation of atoms with this particularity is called the body.

original: thams cad dam mig la sogs pa thams cad ni bsags pa'i don gyis lus zhes mi bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad dam mig la sogs pa thams cad ni bsags pa'i don gyis lus zhes mi bya'o //
translated: But not all, or all the eye, etc. are called the body by the meaning of aggregation.

original: bye brag tu bya ba'i phyir ni mig gi skye mched dang zhes bya ba nas lce'i skye mched dang zhes bya ba'i bar du bye brag gi ming ston to //
analyzed: bye brag tu bya ba'i phyir ni mig gi skye mched dang zhes bya ba nas lce'i skye mched dang zhes bya ba'i bar du bye brag gi ming ston to //
translated: The specific names are indicated in order to specify the particular sense-fields, from the eye sense-field up to the tongue sense-field.

original: de bas na bye brag du yang byas pa yin la /
analyzed: de bas na bye brag du yang byas pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, they are specified by the particular names.

original: lus kyi ming yang yin pa de ni de nyid kyis bye brag tu byed pa ni lus kyi skye mched ces bya'o //
analyzed: lus kyi ming yang yin pa de ni de nyid kyis bye brag tu byed pa ni lus kyi skye mched ces bya'o //
translated: That which is the name of the body is specified by that very name, and is called the body sense-field.

original: gang gi tshe lus kyi tshor ba zhes ston pa de'i tshe ni mig la sogs pa lnga la yang ming lus zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe lus kyi tshor ba zhes ston pa de'i tshe ni mig la sogs pa lnga la yang ming lus zhes bya'o //
translated: When it is taught as the body's feeling, then the five such as the eye are also called the body.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de'i phyir re re yang rdul phra mo bsags pa yin pa'i phyir dang zhes smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir re re yang rdul phra mo bsags pa yin pa'i phyir dang zhes smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, because each is a collection of atoms.

original: mig la sogs pa la bya bar mngon te /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa la bya bar mngon te /
translated: It is evident that the body is the five such as the eye,

original: bsags pa'i don gyis lus zhes brjod pa ni thun mong gi tshig yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsags pa'i don gyis lus zhes brjod pa ni thun mong gi tshig yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the meaning of collection is expressed as the word body, since it is a common term.

original: lus la gnas pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ni lnga char yang ming lus @147a * //
analyzed: lus la gnas pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ni lnga char yang ming lus @147a * //
translated: Because it is located in the body. The five are also called the body,

original: zhes bya ste zhes bya ba'i skabs dang sbyar te /
analyzed: zhes bya ste zhes bya ba'i skabs dang sbyar te /
translated: The term “and so on” is applied to the term “and so on” in the root text.

original: gnas ni gnas pa la nye bar btags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas ni gnas pa la nye bar btags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term “place” is figuratively applied to that which is placed.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For this reason,

original: gnas la gnas 'dogs pa yang yod do //
analyzed: gnas la gnas 'dogs pa yang yod do //
translated: the term “place” is also figuratively applied to that which is placed.

original: khri'u smra ba dang ri 'dzag pa dang zhes smras te /
analyzed: khri'u smra ba dang ri 'dzag pa dang zhes smras te /
translated: For example, one says, “The bench speaks” and “The mountain oozes.”

original: khri'u'i steng na mi 'dug pa la khri'u ru nye bar btags nas 'di skad du khri'u smra'o zhes bya ba dang / ri la yod pa'i chu la rir nye bar btags nas ri 'dzag go zhes zer yang ri 'dzag pa ni ma yin no //🔽byams pa dang ldan pa'i sems kyis phyogs gcig la mos par byas nas zhes bya ba 'dir yang phyogs gcig na gnas pa'i srog chags la phyogs gcig gi sgrar bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: khri'u'i steng na mi 'dug pa la khri'u ru nye bar btags nas 'di skad du khri'u smra'o zhes bya ba dang / ri la yod pa'i chu la rir nye bar btags nas ri 'dzag go zhes zer yang ri 'dzag pa ni ma yin no // byams pa dang ldan pa'i sems kyis phyogs gcig la mos par byas nas zhes bya ba 'dir yang phyogs gcig na gnas pa'i srog chags la phyogs gcig gi sgrar bstan pa yin te /
translated: The term “bench” is figuratively applied to the person who is seated on the bench, and the term “mountain” is figuratively applied to the water that flows from the mountain.

original: byams pas sems can la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byams pas sems can la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the same way, the term “one direction” is figuratively applied to the sentient beings who are located in one direction, because the mind that is possessed of loving-kindness is directed toward sentient beings.

original: skye mched lnga bstan zin to //
analyzed: skye mched lnga bstan zin to //
translated: The five sense bases have now been explained.

original: drug pa yid kyi skye mched brjod par byed pa ni /
analyzed: drug pa yid kyi skye mched brjod par byed pa ni /
translated: The sixth sense base, the mental faculty, is described as follows:

original: yid kyi skye mched kyi phung po'i nang du ni rnam par shes pa'i phung po gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug gi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: yid kyi skye mched kyi phung po'i nang du ni rnam par shes pa'i phung po gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug gi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The aggregate of consciousness is included in the mind base and in the mind constituent.

original: khams kyi nang du ni yid kyi khams gang yin pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams drug go //
analyzed: khams kyi nang du ni yid kyi khams gang yin pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams drug go //
translated: The mind constituent is established as the aggregate of consciousness, and the six consciousness constituents are also included in the aggregate of consciousness.

original: de ltar byas na rnam par shes pa drug gi mtshan nyid ni yid kyi skye mched du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar byas na rnam par shes pa drug gi mtshan nyid ni yid kyi skye mched du bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the aggregate of consciousness is taught as the mind base and the mind constituent.🔽What other mind constituent is there apart from those?

original: de dag las gzhan gang zhig yid kyi khams yin zhe na zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa'i khams drug de dag las zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de dag las gzhan gang zhig yid kyi khams yin zhe na zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa'i khams drug de dag las zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: There is none other than those, but it is that which is the sixth.

original: gzhan ni gang yang med kyi de dag gang yin pa nyid ces rgyas par 'byung ba ni ji skad du /
analyzed: gzhan ni gang yang med kyi de dag gang yin pa nyid ces rgyas par 'byung ba ni ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: drug po 'das ma thag pa yin //🔽rnam shes gang yin de yod do //
analyzed: drug po 'das ma thag pa yin // rnam shes gang yin de yod do //
translated: The sixth is the mind constituent,

original: zhes ston to //
analyzed: zhes ston to //
translated: which is the immediately past consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa drug pa'i gnas bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i gnas ni mig la sogs pa lnga po nyid go rims bzhin du yin na drug pa yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i gnas ni rnam par shes pa'i
analyzed: rnam par shes pa drug pa'i gnas bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i gnas ni mig la sogs pa lnga po nyid go rims bzhin du yin na drug pa yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i gnas ni rnam par shes pa'i
translated: Because the sixfold base of consciousness is taught.🔽The five such as the eye are respectively the bases of the five such as eye consciousness, but the base of the sixth, mental consciousness, does not exist apart from the six collections of consciousness.

original: tshogs drug la ma gtogs par yod pa ma yin pas de'i gnas bstan par bya ba'i phyir drug pos 'das ma thag pa de dag nyid yid kyi khams yin par rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: tshogs drug la ma gtogs par yod pa ma yin pas de'i gnas bstan par bya ba'i phyir drug pos 'das ma thag pa de dag nyid yid kyi khams yin par rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: Therefore, in order to teach its base, the immediately past six collections of consciousness are posited as the mental element.

original: ji skad du chos mngon pa'i mdzod las /
analyzed: ji skad du chos mngon pa'i mdzod las /
translated: The Abhidharmakośa declares:

original: drug pa'i gnas ni grub bya'i phyir /
analyzed: drug pa'i gnas ni grub bya'i phyir /
translated: In order to establish the base of the sixth,

original: khams ni bco brgyad rnams su dran //🔽zhes ston to //
analyzed: khams ni bco brgyad rnams su dran // zhes ston to //
translated: the elements are said to be eighteen.

original: de ltar yin du zin @147b kyang ming dang gzugs kyi tshe skye mched drug yod pa ma yin na zhes bya ba ni ming dang gzugs kyi gnas skabs na mngal du nges par 'chi ba rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: de ltar yin du zin @147b kyang ming dang gzugs kyi tshe skye mched drug yod pa ma yin na zhes bya ba ni ming dang gzugs kyi gnas skabs na mngal du nges par 'chi ba rnams kyi'o //
translated: Even though that is so, if the six bases do not exist at the stage of name and form, then the six bases do not exist at the stage of name and form in the womb of those who definitely die in the womb.

original: skye mched drug thams cad kyi dang po ni ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis yin par nges par bya'o zhes bya ba ni rdzus te byung ba rnams kyi skye mched drug gi dang po ni ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis ma yin na /
analyzed: skye mched drug thams cad kyi dang po ni ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis yin par nges par bya'o zhes bya ba ni rdzus te byung ba rnams kyi skye mched drug gi dang po ni ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis ma yin na /
translated: If the first of the six sense spheres of those who are born supernaturally is not conditioned by name-and-form,

original: ji ltar 'di skad du thams cad kyi zhes smra bar byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'di skad du thams cad kyi zhes smra bar byed ce na /
translated: how can it be said that all are so conditioned?

original: 'dir ni skye ba'i rim pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i dbang du byas te bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir ni skye ba'i rim pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i dbang du byas te bstan pa yin no //
translated: Here, the teaching is given in terms of the complete process of birth.

original: dang po ni zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma dang po'o //
analyzed: dang po ni zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma dang po'o //
translated: The first is the first moment.

original: skad cig ma gnyis pa la sogs pa gzhan ni skye mched drug gi rkyen gyis skye mched drug nyid yin pas so //
analyzed: skad cig ma gnyis pa la sogs pa gzhan ni skye mched drug gi rkyen gyis skye mched drug nyid yin pas so //
translated: The others, the second moment and so on, are the six sense spheres conditioned by the six sense spheres.

original: ming dang gzugs thams cad skye mched drug gi rkyen ma yin no zhes bya ba ci zhe na nges par bya'o zhes bya ba'i skabs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs thams cad skye mched drug gi rkyen ma yin no zhes bya ba ci zhe na nges par bya'o zhes bya ba'i skabs dang sbyar ro //
translated: It should be understood that not all name-and-form is a condition for the six sense spheres.

original: 'dis ni ming dang gzugs kyi gnas skabs nyid du nges par 'chi ba rnams kyi ming dang gzugs ni skye mched drug gi rkyen nyid ma yin par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni ming dang gzugs kyi gnas skabs nyid du nges par 'chi ba rnams kyi ming dang gzugs ni skye mched drug gi rkyen nyid ma yin par bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows that for those who die in the state of name-and-form, name-and-form is not a condition for the six sense spheres.🔽Like rain from clouds, etc.

original: sprin las char la sogs pa bzhin du zhes bya ba ni dper na char pa thams cad ni sprin gyi rkyen gyis yin par nges pa yin gyi /
analyzed: sprin las char la sogs pa bzhin du zhes bya ba ni dper na char pa thams cad ni sprin gyi rkyen gyis yin par nges pa yin gyi /
translated: For example, it is certain that all rain is conditioned by clouds,

original: sprin thams cad char pa'i rkyen ni ma yin no //🔽'bras bu thams cad me tog gi rkyen gyis yin te /
analyzed: sprin thams cad char pa'i rkyen ni ma yin no // 'bras bu thams cad me tog gi rkyen gyis yin te /
translated: but all clouds are not a condition for rain.🔽All fruits are conditioned by flowers,

original: me tog las byung ba'i 'bras bu'i dbang du byas pa yin gyi /
analyzed: me tog las byung ba'i 'bras bu'i dbang du byas pa yin gyi /
translated: but all flowers are not a condition for fruits.
